Reviews.Title: “recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Robertwayne_11
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4re nights at the Regina, the location is excellent with easy access to all the main sights. Madrid is well worth visiting. We had to change room as the 1st room we had was affected by external noise. This presented no problem and the staff were very friendly and efficient. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: gwyndaf2
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for a visit to Madrid. Within walking distance of Cibeles stop on the bus route from the airport at a cost of only 2 euros, The location couldn't be better - 100 metres from Puerto del Sol, the centre of Madrid. Had requested a room with a bath and was a little disappointed on entering to find the bath half the size of what we're used to in UK, but not to worry once we spoke to reception we were transferred to another room with a full size bath and a balcony overlooking the front of the hotel onto Calle Alcala. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice of hot and cold food. So much to choose from we didn't get fed up with the food even after 6 days. Room service very good. Ordered a pizza and two teas which arrived very quickly at a reasonable cost of 13 euros. If only they had tea making facilities in the room - the hotel would then be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JHJHGC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Regina, Madrid and were very happy with it's central location, good quality room, and quite friendly and efficient service, We appreciated the hotel having both a restaurant and associated cafe open for breakfasts, lunches, dinners and between meals. The Madrid City tour (on-off) bus has bus stops for both of its routes very close to the Hotel so we purchased a two day pass to make the most of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Marvel”
Reviews.Author: NoelLeonPogi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in Madrid last March and the Regina Hotel made everything worthwhile for us. Situated in Alcala St. right in the heart of the city, everything was within reach from Puerto Del Sol to the Palacio Royal to the Prado and Thiessen museums.I was really surprised to see that the Regina was not your typical European hotel. It is quite spacious, nicely decorated with modern furnishings, wooden floor and a fantastic bathroom. The people at the front desk were extra helpful and friendly. Keep watch for Maria Sanchez who does such an amazing work at her desk. My wife and I would see her everyday. She is very knowledfgeable, friendly and very pleasant. Come and vist the US soon, Maria!! Anyway, my wife and I want to come back to the beautiful city of Madrid and definitely we are coming back to Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern Room in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeaconTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here over Easter weekend based on the location and positive reviews. You will not be disappointed with the location. It seemed central to pretty much everything. It was a short walk to the Puerta Del Sol, which is a hub of activity. The room was definitely a good size with a window looking out to a light well. We would have preferred a window looking out, as it was difficult to determine how to dress or what to wear since you couldn't see the weather conditions. We did find the bathroom a bit awkward as it is not really a separate room and has no door. The view to the toilet was blocked, but otherwise it was wide open. We did not have much luck with the wireless. It seemed to be hit and miss...mostly a miss. The staff was quite helpful with booking tours, making change, etc. We found the hotel to be very quiet at night, but noisy in the mornings with cleaning, guests coming and going, etc. We did not eat in the hotel, but we found many other good food and beverage choices within an easy walk. I would recommend this as an overall good accommodation with some drawbacks. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Regina”
Reviews.Author: ANDY-OAFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over Easter and coudn't fault this hotel. Simple room, nicely decorated with comfy bed and very clean. Hotel lobby was lovely and the reception staff efficient and helpful. Stayed room only but took breakfast in the hotel cafe every morning which was great value for money with good coffee. The hotel's location was excellent with metro stop outside and it was centrally located with all major attractions within 10 minutes walking distance. Bars and restaurants are numerous in all directions although we always ended up in the Plaza Santa Ana and surrounding streets and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and Charming”
Reviews.Author: DonPaulo
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Regina in Madrid because it was located centrally; the price was reasonable for a capitol city; it appeared to be tastefully decorated; previous reviews were generally favorable and visitors commended the helpful staff. We found it to be everything we expected. We traveled in Central Spain for nearly two weeks. The Regina was not the tops in any of these rated areas, but it was good enough to get our top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: 15Ruby1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family over easter and we generally really liked this hotel. It was very clean and the staff were pretty friendly (if a bit distant). The location is really good; only a 2 minute walk from the city centre and 10 minutes from the prado. It's also right next to a metro stop (Sevilla) which makes getting to and from the airport a lot easier. Our room was nice, with a lovely bathroom, but the view from the tiny window was onto a walled space and let in very little natural light. My parents didn't sleep very well as they found the walls to be too thin and were kept awake by other guests. The restaurant at the hotel was ok but I think there are much better places a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: ZwarteKater
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel from the moment we walked in. Great location in the center of the city within walking distance from a lot of sites. It was super easy to get there from the airport by public transport (on the way back at 4 in the morning). The room was a lot better than what we had expected: big with a great roof terrace on a top floor! The bathroom was big and very well equipped. The furniture in the room was nicely designed and overall we had a permanent feeling of comfort. The only 'weird' feature was the location of the wardrobe in the bathroom.... we thought that on a longer stay clothes might get dump. We didn't have the chance to eat in the restaurant downstairs, as we arrived too late. However, we got a bottle of wine from the vast collection - excellent. There are plenty of shops and cafes nearby - no shortage of nice food and wine! We did not have breakfast in the hotel as my sister lived in Madrid and knew a lot of local places. We had great breakfast for just 8 EUR in most of the cafes nearby (please avoid Corner Cafe - tourist trap!). The staff at the reception was very professional and nice. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing holiday to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Lauren K
Reviews.Content: The Regina Hotel in Madrid was simply wonderful. My family and I stayed there for a week and we loved every minute of it - the service was excellent, the staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive, the food was delicious and the hotel was immaculate, exceptionally clean and comfortable! This hotel was one of the best we have ever stayed in when travelling and it made our visit to Madrid very enjoyable. Thank you Hotel Regina, we will certainly be coming back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Big room, clean and an actual hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillTravelForStories
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 6 nights on a promotional rate directly on the hotel's official website. The value was great as the room was quite big and clean. The bathroom was really large too in a big European city like Madrid. The location was very convenient to major metro stops and the central plaza. The wifi in the room was consistent until the last 2 days. I asked the front desk and the staff gave me the key to a different room on an upper floor to test the wifi on my laptop, which worked. So we switched the room for the last two nights. And that room was even bigger than the first one!

Reviews.Title: “Recent trip to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LittleNDrogheda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel in early April. The hotel is fantastically situated with easy acess directly from the Airport to the Metro Sevilla which stops outside the Hotel entrance. The hotel was a extremely well situated for sightseeing in the beautiful city of Madrid, everything was within easy access. We got a special rate on accomodation and the room did reflect this but was clean , quiet and more than met our needs. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel which served good breakfasts and bar food at reasonable rates and brilliant Gin and tonics also. There is a more expensive and select restaurant area also but there are so many places to eat in Madrid that we were spoiled for choice. No complaints at all about the hotel or its staff . Madrid itself is a beautiful city with plenty to see and do and plenty of restaurants to try. We thought eating out was good value but shopping in general very expensive. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArveC
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at Hotel Regina Centrally located close to Plaza Any- several good resturants and bars The hotel resturant has very high quality on the food Qlean room and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good room, good service”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a special deal that we found on the hotel's web site. Easy to find hotel which is right next to a metro stop though arriving by train we took a cab which was cheap and quick. On arrival we were greeted by fresh orange juice. The check in was simple and quick. We had an attic room at the back of the hotel which made it quiet. Our room had a nice terrace too but it wasn't warm enough for sitting outside in the shade. Comfortable bed and decent sized bathroom that was kept well stocked. Usual small towels you find in Spain. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel preferring the cafe next door that gave plenty of options for just a few euros. We had several drinks in the bar which was friendly and reasonably priced - not the usual sad hotel experience. They provided a constant stream of tapas or nibbles and it seemed as if locals were using the bar as well as the residents. On departure the hotel ordered us a fixed price taxi to the airport for 22 euros, an example of the good service we experienced here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: matwell
Reviews.Content: The Regina was wonderful. The location is superb (the subway is right out the front door), and Plaza Puerta de Sol is only a few minutes walking away. The restaurant was wonderful. The rooms were clean, modern, quiet, and very comfortable. The staff went out of their way to help you. We were greeted with fresh orange juice upon arrival. Once we settled in our room, we were surprised with fresh fruit and champagne. The manager called to make sure our room was to our satisfaction. There are great restaurants within minutes of this hotel if you want to go somewhere else to eat. We stayed there from 4/3 - 4/7.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the location!”
Reviews.Author: iSpy-uSpy
Reviews.Content: Great location for base from which to visit all the main attractions. Metro Savillia is right outside, so getting from airport also v easy. Location is right in middle of Madrid allowing easy access walking or Metro to east and west Madrid, plus bars, rests and shops in Sol and Grand Via. Hotel itself is friendly and functional. Rooms basic and clean. 3 star is about right. Only downside I can think of is that can be bit noisy sometimes from other guests above as walls bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “Regina Hotel -- a great stay”
Reviews.Author: LenSchwartz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina for fourn nights in Febraury. The location is excellant. The room was quite large. The breakfast (included) was comprehensive and served in a beautiful setting. The only negatives are the poor quality wi-fi outside the immediate lobby area and the sporadic noise such as trash collection. Overall, a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay”
Reviews.Author: NemethPal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of Madrid, near the Sevilla metro station, few minutes by walk from Sol. The staff in very helpful, the price is very good. If you are going for a city trip or with business I higly reccomend this hotel. Near the hotel is a Starbucks, when you can start your day :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed for sight-seeing and trying out the local restaurants etc. The staff were extremely helpful and gave us excellent advice about getting out of the city before the general strike march took place. The breakfast was first class with a great variety of food available. Our room was on floor E and we found it really stuffy as the sliding windows opened out onto a small courtyard and we felt it might not be secure to leave them open at night. We would return to the hotel but would ensure we had a better room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and awesome staff been In the height of controversy...”
Reviews.Content: Excellent welcoming staff!! Carlos, Carlos and Maria! :) height of a National Strike yet the ENTIRE hotel staff made me feel welcome and safe. VERY conveniently located. LOVE, love and would definitely stay again! A little loud noise from outside but drink more, sleep less! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arby_12
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying 8 nights at Hotel Regina. Check in and Check out was extremely easy. Staff was very professional and spoke English very well. The room was large by European standards and was very modern, including a great bathroom. Toiletries were stocked daily. No need to bring combs, razors, shaving cream, shampoo, conditioner or lotion. A hair dryer was also in the room. A safe was in the room along with a television that received some 20 channels. A passcode was given at Check-In in order to use their computer. The location was great with Metro stop Sevilla right out the door. A short 5 minute walk takes you to Puerta del Sol. There was a cafeteria with reasonable prices and seemed to be very popular. I have stayed at a few hotels in Madrid and this was the best. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Lesley Y
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Hotel very clean, rooms good size. Excellent choice for breakfast, staff very helpful and polite. Madrid is a lovely city plenty to see and do. Would visit again and stay in the Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: sun_worshipper00
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter stayed for 3 nights at the end of February. From the moment we saw the hotel as we came up the stairs from the metro, we loved it. The decor is very stylish and the superior room we had was beautiful. Staff there are friendly and very helpful. From the moment we arrived we were looked after very well. As we were checking in a glass of fresh orange was brought to us. Also the porter who took our cases to our room was lovely and he showed us the controls for the lighting etc. Breakfast was lovely and unfortunately we did not dine in the restaurant for dinner but it did look very nice. Absolutely loved Madrid. And was most surprised to find it is not expensive. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located hotel”
Reviews.Author: roon91
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in all of Madrid. It is easily reachable by bus from the airport, by subway from anywhere in town (exit Plaza del Sol) and within walking distance of the Prado. THe staff was efficient, courteous, and pleasant. The rooms were newly remodeled, well lit and had wi fi in all areas. The best room was the one with a terrace. I afforded a rooftop view of Madrid and a quiet place to enjoy a glass of wine in the sun. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: vic1721
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for a better location, walking distance to everything and the metro right outside the hotel doors. Check in was very easy, with the added bonus of being allowed up to our room at 11am on arrival rather than having to wait until the advertised check in time. Our room was lovely, we had one of the "older" rooms that had not had the renovation works yet but it was still modern clean and well equipped. We had two beds (which were super comfortable!) and even a balcony which was huge and a lovely surprise for us. The room had a flat screen TV, fridge with mini bar and hairdryer and soaps, shampoo etc in the bathroom. The only thing missing was a kettle for a morning cup of coffee but we could live without this. We were facing the back of the hotel and on the top floor so street noice was not an issue for us. I had emailed ahead asking for a higher room which was granted. The only thing that is a slight negative is that the walls are thin. We could pretty much here the conversation (and the snoring!) that was happening in the room next door but from my research, I think this is a common problem with hotels in madrid. On check out, we were given a further hour in the room until 1pm and then we left our luggage with reception before leaving. Overall, this hotel is definitely not your average 3*. The level of service, surroundings and the amenities could make it a 4*. I would not hesitate to come back here again and for a long weekend, this was perfect in everyway.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MADRASBAGGER
Reviews.Content: As others have said location is first class with Metro right outside and a 2 minute walk to Sol with other transport connections. Everything about my three day stay was excellent, from the welcoming drink, the friendly staff and the nice room (where everything worked including gratis WiFi). I paid extra for the breakfast which was excellent. My only very minor complaint was noise from outside lane, but solved this by shutting windows and putting on the AC. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay in Mdrid”
Reviews.Author: thommo31
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Bar and restaurant excellent. We had a standard room which was 314 and had no view. The room was very nice except it was far too hot even in March. The air conditioning only blew hot air. Excellent position in the City Centre, recommend highly overall.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable location and service”
Reviews.Author: Byroenius
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else had mentioned, the proximity of the hotel, being in the center of Madrid , to all the beautiful sites around it made it easier to walk to. Plaza mayor and plaza sol is just a few stroll away. Metro stop " Sevilla" is literally just outside the hotel's entrance. Staff are friendly and accommodating. I am writing this review while I'm still here in this hotel, because it deserves it. Truly a great experience. I love the old facade, being a century old building, but don't let it fool you, for it is as modern and stylish. I am staying in of their attic rooms, with a private balcony ..... Superb! It's exactly what I needed coming off from a chaotic, noisy trip from Marakech a night before!!! If you want to rest and have all the amenities you expect from a 4+ hotel , Hotel Regina surely would fit the bill! I love my room (530) Yo me encanta la ciudad , y por supuesto, Hotel Regina!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Best value for money we had during out 17 day tour of Europe! Loved the central location, friendly helpful staff, the 'artsy' decor, the view from our room including the opening windows onto a balcony and the conveniently located and well priced restaurant downstairs. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Easily a 4-star plus experience, brilliantly central location and very affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Sheppied
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable, amazing walk-in shower with all mod cons, cava and fruit on arrival. Breakfast was full and satisfying (again more cava). The travelzoo price for bed and breakfast there was amazing! Truly central location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Niamhey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 16th-19th March, and it was perfect. Walking distance to Sol, Pl Mayor, Palacio Real, Retiro, Prado etc. Metro stop right outside hotel, 5 minutes walk from airport bus stop. We originally received room 123, which was fine, but we arrived on a very warm day and found the room too hot. Reception staff were very helpful in changing our room to 332 the following day, which was much cooler, and also, had been renovated. Very clean, comfortable beds, good sized bathroom, nice toiletries. Only issue I had with the room was the fact that the bathroom door did not close fully - not sure of the reasoning behind that! Very good selection of food for breakfast - cereals, meats, cheese, pastries, breads, pancakes, fruits, juices - and all very tasty. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is perfect for a break in Madrid, I would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MaggieBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our children last year. The room was a very good fit for our family. It had 4 beds - two beds were located in a semi-private are, which gave us a little more privacy. Our room was facing the street, but it was not too noisy. You are in the center of the major city and you expect some noise anyway. This hotel is all about location - everywhere is close and we did walked a lot. We also used a subway - the station is just at the hotel enterance or you can have a short walk to Plaza Del Sol. We had the breakfast at the hotel few times, but you can also go to the Starbucks which is located 2 minutes from the hotel (it is on the left from the entrance). Overall, we enjoyed our stay - we will probably come back to this place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley57_12
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from 8th-12th march 2012 and enjoyed our stay very much.The location could not have been better.Staff were very friendly and helpful.Only one problem lots of noise !..I had emailed the hotel a week before we arrived asking for a quiet room, we got room 130 which was perfect except only one floor above a restaurant in a laneway which caused lots noise not least at nine o clock on Sunday morning hammering and drilling outside (not hotels fault). But staying in city center hotels you expect noise so we were not put out too much,maybe a higher up floor would be quieter.Otherwise this hotel is perfect in every way and I would recomend it to anyone planning a trip to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AshleyHowells
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best accommodation bargain in Madrid - located 200 m from Sol and 400m from the Prado

Reviews.Title: “Centric”
Reviews.Author: Miquelg
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located to walk to the center. Staff helpful and friendly. Standard rooms with old-fashioned decor, a little fair in size, and big soundproofing problems. Breakfast expensive, do it in one of the cafes nearby. The price-quality ratio is high, no doubt you will pay for the location

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamJeF55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and had an eventful stay ( illness not related to the hotel and an accident with the shower screen in the bathroom) but the hotel staff were always so helpful and polite. It made all the difference . The location of the hotel is great , it is in the city centre so could be noisy if your room is at the front , but all the rooms are lovely and very very clean Thankyou to all the staff , we would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: steveo76128
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Regina and found it an excellent base from which to explore the city from. The hotel sits about 200 metres away from the Plaza del Sol which is effectively the centre point of Madrid, the hotel is also convieniently located for Plaza Mayor, The musem triangle, Retiro park and even the Royal Palace all of these are within walking distance. There is also a metro station called Sevilla right outside the hotel which makes it very easy to come to and from the airport and also move around the city to other locations such as Real Madrid's football ground the Santiago Bernebeu. With regards to the hotel itself we found everything to be clean, functional and comfortable without being spectacular howeverfor the price of just over £70 per night in a capital city this was more than acceptable and we were happy with the overall experience. In terms of the staff we didn't have too much interaction with them apart from asking if they had a plug adapter which we could borrow which caused some confusion with the chap at reception thinking we were asking for a wake up call! One very small suggestion for the hotel may be that they keep a few adaptors available to hire or borrow as we had to go out to find one and then spend 10 euros on it. This is more a suggestion than a criticism though. Overall a great experience and we would return back to the Regina without hesitation should we be back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid March 2012”
Reviews.Author: pammiemack
Reviews.Content: Beautifully clean, well situated, well furbished hotel with a welcoming juice on arrival but the best thing about this hotel are the staff. Nothing is too much to ask them. One of our party became unwell and they were instantly there, very kind and helpful. This hotel is centrally situated in a busy city so comes with the accompanying traffic and night time noise but the hotel staff are fabulous and moved us to a quieter room at the back (the couryard room are the quietest) as soon as we asked. The rooms at the rear are those that have been modernised but the room at the front was lovely and spacious. Breakfast is very excellent, large choice of hot and cold buffet (cereals/meats/cheeses/pastries) with the left over cava from the night before to add to your fruit juice! We had a meal in the restaurant adn snacks in the cafe, both good. Walking everywhere is not a problem due to the hotel's great central location but if you need it there is a metro station (seville) at the door and taxis too. Very easy for trip tp the Bernabeau (good match too) adn for all the museums adn local bars and cafes. Excellent flamenco and food in the Villa Rosa which is walking distance adn great meal in the Venta El Buscon. Lovely sunny weather in early March, would definetely go back to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “great stay at great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yardcore_9t7
Reviews.Content: Just stayed four days in Madrid and three of them were in the Hotel Regina. It was a wonderful hotel. It is located on a main street, within walking distance of a lot of the major sites, Plaza Mayor, Retiro Park, Prado Museum, Royal Palace, and much more. Plus the Metro is directly across the street from the Hotel. Let us borrow a converter, free wi-fi, taxi service back to the airport. If I had to list draw backs the restaurant was a bit pricey and if you listened you could hear a little of what was going on in the next room. GREAT hotel....

Reviews.Title: “An all-round first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilP61
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina was perfect for us in every way and we would recommend it strongly. It is situated about 500 metres from the geographical centre of Madrid, the Plaza del Sol. This means you are in walking distance of all the tourist venues, the restaurants, bars and those wonderful little squares where you can sit and drink in the sun. Just outside the hotel is the Sevilla Metro - which lets you take the underground to wherever you want. The location is perfect. However, the hotel itself is even better. Our first room wasn't what we wanted, no proper window and it was noisy. We asked if we could move and without any hesitation we were given a wonderful room on the 6th floor with its own patio! Good size room, large bathroom and always with an eye for style and tasteful design. The staff were so obliging and helpful, they spoke excellent English. Their service is their strength - as demonstrated by them booking a taxi so we got a slightly cheaper rate back to the airport, taking our luggage out and making sure the taxi driver knew which terminal we needed. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't help you there. But we'd recommend not booking breakfast there by going next door, to the Faborite cafe which serve fantastic coffees and pastries and croissants for 5 euros on week days. We're vegetarian and we really rate 'Al Natural' a veggie restaurant on Calle de Zorilla, a 5 minute walk away. The people are really friendly and their menu caused us to go back a second night because there were so many good things to eat there! All in all, Hotel Regina was just perfect and made our 3 night break perfect too.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: CPMM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Regina Madrid and found it to be the perfect hotel for a city stay. Good central location, easy walking distance to all the major sights, roughly 10mins either way will take you to Placa Mayor one way, and park and museums the other way. Also with the Sevilla metro stop outside your airport commute will roughly take 30mins. I loved the rooms,spotlessly clean, decorated in a modern style but still comfortable and relaxing, aided by the fantastic lighting (a feature i would love in my own home!). The style echoes into the rather big bathroom, with lovely walk in shower. Staff are friendly, and helpful when needed. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to friends and family......and if i return to Madrid this will be my 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: atdrc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a pleasant 5 night stay at Hotel Regina. The staff was very kind and helpful. We had a clean, comfortable room for 4 people which is difficult to find in Europe. The location is perfect...walking distance to Puerto de Sol, Plaza Mayor, wonderful restaurants, many attractions, and a metro station at the hotel door! We would definitely stay at Hotel Regina again! Our only recommendation is that you request a room that does not face the street. It can be noisy at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmassimo
Reviews.Content: Right outside Sevilla Station(Metro) few hundred meters from Porta del sol. Great staff and breakfast. Room a bit small but new and with everything you need. Great shower and mattress 32 inch flat tv. The Only complain could be that room is two warm and as facing internal you cannot open the window as very bad smell of food come from near restaurant kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diner000
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here last week with my 2 young adult children. Got a room with 3 single beds. The staff was very helpful and accommodating, and the hotel is in a perfect and convenient location on Calle Alcala, just a short distance from Puerto del Sol, but just far enough away from the noise. The room was fairly basic, but we were happy to have the three beds. A fruit/champagne platter was delivered as a welcome gift from the hotel minutes after we checked in which immediately put us in a festive mood. The staff are generous with the toiletries... even a razor and comb were provided. The breakfast (included) was delicious, and the hotel felt safe and clean. This is a bustling hotel, but pleasantly quiet at night. I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great device, good value”
Reviews.Author: Senojnala
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here for 3 nights from 11th Feb. Arrived about 13.45 but our 2 rooms were not ready but whilst they were checking us in they offered us glasses of fresh OJ. Once checked in they said we could either come back in 30 minutes or wait in the Bar. We chose to wait in the Reception area just outside the Bar. We asked if we could order some drinks which we did. They also offered us some snacks. When our rooms were ready we asked to pay the bill for the drinks etc but they told us they om the house as we had to wait for our rooms which was our problem for arriving before check in time. This was a nice gesture. Our rooms were large, clean and comfortable and clearly decorated for the hot summer months however we couldn't turn the heating down in our room. Staff tried to fix it very quickly and gave us a portable fan to assist. Even leaving the small window open didn't really help as it looked out into the a tiny "courtyard" but then as we don't spend all day in the room it wasn't a big deal. Because of the decor for hot weather the hotel can be a bit noisy when people come and go to their rooms but not enough to be a problem. Hotel is ideally located for most attractions and is close to the tour bus stops and the metro. All in all a very good hotel, good value, good service, worth staying in. Would recommend and use again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjcheeseman
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The room was very clean and stylish. The bed was comfy and the bathroom pristine and wall to wall marble. The staff were lovely and we were greeted with a glass of fresh orange as we checked in - a lovely touch! The breakfast was an extensive buffet with lots of options (we are vegetarian and were very well catered for) and a great pot of coffee. The location is great. Literally right on top of Seville metro stop and a 5 min walk to Sol. Despite being so central it was a quiet spot. Everything is walking distance - no more than a 20-30 min walk to the Prado. All in all an excellent value hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best value for money hotels I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: petejonno
Reviews.Content: Located right in the city centre, in one of the older, grander and more spectacular looking areas of Madrid this hotel could not be in a better location. The view from our room was great looking out over the street and its beautiful buildings. Almost ALL of the main tourist attractions are within walking distance as are many well priced tapas eateries, bars and restaurants - Madrid is not an expensive city which was a welcome bonus for our group. The lobby and restaurant/bar area were lovely and the reception were very professional and curtious. The rooms themselves were nothing fancy, but did have a mini bar, flat screen TV, large wardrobe, seperate living area with couch and large bathroom, all very nicely finished and kept very clean by the maids who were in every day. In summary, if you are only in Madrid a few days and want to make sure you get the most out of your stay, be sure to book into the Regina as for the price it surely cant be beaten, Once again, other Tripadvisor reviews have ensured I have a great trip away so thankyou to you all! :)

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location, food, surpassed very high hotel expectations.”
Reviews.Author: geohove
Reviews.Content: Being as seasoned traveller on a budget this time in Madrid we opted for a slightly cheaper hotel in the centre. Hotel Regina is perfect on so many levels - clean, right at Sol/Sevilla metro and a short walk from the efficient aeroport-city bus stop, cibeles. The upgrade superior rooms are worth a little extra & are actually quite special. Could be a 4/5* hotel - not 3* as promoted

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel, lovely room and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Charm_Lover
Reviews.Content: Hoetl Regina was definitely better than I expected from a 3 star hotel, very centrally located close to all attractions and the metro right outside. We had a lovely room with separate sitting room and good sized bathroom. Very clean and plenty of space. The staff were very helpful, recommending and reserving restaurants and providing us with other information. Breakfast was really good with lots of choice. I would have given it full marks except it was very difficult to sleep as we had the inevitable noise from a city centre location; sirens going all through Saturday night/Sunday morning and drunks shouting outside. They do have rooms facing the inner courtyard so suggest asking for one of these if you want peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: TiffTiph
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome!!! Right next to the metro stop Seville, however it's only a few blocks walk from Sol and everywhere really. The staff were so friendly, they gave me a glass of orange juice while I was checking in. It looks so fancy and nice. The room was really cool, I loved how it was decorated, absolutely spotless. The bathroom was a great size, the shower had stones in the bottom which I enjoyed. They supplied lots of bathroom accessories including a razor and shaving cream, a comb, shampoo conditioner and more! There was free wifi in the room, love that! Great lighting and mood, I'd love to stay there as a couple too. They even had a world radio built into the side of the bed, so I tuned into some stations back home (as I work in radio) and managed to hear myself which just added to my time in Madrid. I loved everything about this hotel. I got quite a good deal but I would pay more to stay here :) I didn't get breakfast and I think it was about 15euro to have it, however there was a delicious juice shop next door and starbucks as well. I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, centrally located hotel, would highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Pilskie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over Valentines Day and were very impressed. The hotel is within easy walking distance to all attractions & close to metro & bus routes for airport. All staff from cleaners, waiters and reception were friendly & professional. Our room was clean, a good size with spotless bathroom. I would recommend this hotel to couples, friends & for business. A brilliant find and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seamus1975
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay in Madrid, the hotel are currently running an excellent winter special. Regina is ideally located just off Puerta del Sol with Metro outside the door. Everything was great, room,food and particularly the staff who were very attentive and welcoming. Would definitely return and recommend this hotel. Séamus and Mary, Limerick, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Worth coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Kees_Ria
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well situated in the centre of Madrid, on walking distance of all places of interest. (Metro stop in front if you want to go further away) Our room was trully "superior". Restaurant offers good diners, but the breakfast-buffet is very expensive. The cafetería in front is much cheaper for breakfast. The reception service is excellent (information, restaurant-reservations and luggage storage). We booked already for our next stay this year.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite week of the year”
Reviews.Author: annabel a
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room and stayed in November 2011. The bathroom was a dream and I want to remodel mine at home, the square sink units were so cool. Infact the hotel is very modern smart flower displays and funky chairs. The room had air con, safe, and a small window to the front of the hotel. You do get a bit of street noise but it didn't bother us at night. The location is so central and all the places of interest are in walking distance or visited easily on the bus that stops outside. Excellent allround value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: DWB_12
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a three day trip to Madrid to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary (Jan 24-27) and it was a wonderful break made all the more memorable by our stay in Hotel Regina. We had a lovely room on the second floor facing a quiet back street - we did hear the bin lorry for a few minutes on a couple of occasions during the night but this was a very small price to pay for the immaculate streets of Madrid! The room was spotlessly clean and modern and certainly met all our expectations. All staff that we came in contact with appeared pleasant and helpful (especially our housekeeper) and our only small quibble would be that we were refused service in the bar one evening at midnight when we wanted a coffee before bed. We were told rather abruptly by the female bar attendant that they were closing which we found rather early for a Spanish hotel especially for residents. This aside we were very pleased with our stay and will hopefully return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: Trinash
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends. We also had a dark room overlooking a courtroom, but we weren't going to Madrid for the hotel. We were going for the sights. So location was really our main priority, and this hotel was ideally located. It was clean, the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The welcome drink on arrival was another nice touch. If you're going away for the 'hotel experience' then maybe pay a bit more for somewhere fancier. But I'd say this is hard to beat for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: SashaRumyantsev
Reviews.Content: I find it very surprising that this hotel has such a good rating on tripadvisor. The only thing going for it in my opinion is its location: it's really close to Puerta del Sol. I had a room that had a very small window giving to an extremely small & dark internal courtyard. Consequence: no daylight in the room. Also there was some strange high-pitched noise in the room that I couldn't place but which caused me a headache. At night I heard people banging the doors which woke me up, despite the earplugs. Finally, I had to ask several times to get the promised "champagne on arrival". I found it humiliating and the receptionist dismissive. I won't come again.

Reviews.Title: “More like 4 stars than 3”
Reviews.Author: OzFood13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newer rooms during low season which was amazing value. Very clean, spacious room with huge balcony/courtyard area on the roof outside our room, though not put to good use because of the weather. Lovely bathroom and fantastic location. Surprising it was rated 3 stars, I would have rated it 4. Also went to the restaurant in the lobby of the hotel which was excellent. The whole experience at the hotel was wonderful, would definitely stay there again if in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: bigb77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room in late Nov 2011. Room was not one of the renovated ones but was still spacious by European standards. We have a small balcony which was a nice addition. Bathroom was a good size and plenty of cupboard space. Bed was comfortable and clean. There was also a safe to keep valuables which was locked and opened by your credit card. Room was towards back of hotel and we had no trouble with street noise, although we could hear the people in the next room showering. The location is the main plus point for this hotel. Was about a 700m walk from where the airport bus stops, metro (which we hardly used) and hop on hop off bus stop are literally right in front of hotel. Puerta del Sol is 500m down the road and this gives you close access to the main shops and bars. The bar in the hotel was nice and had a great array of Tapas which are served free when you order a drink! All in all a pleasant stay and would recommend for travellers who are looking for the ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good rooms n helpful staff...”
Reviews.Author: rajiv_rams
Reviews.Content: If you r first time travller n aint sure abt the hotel with close proximity to all d imp location... go for this one.. centrally located... plaza mayor , subway n atocha station r within 1-2 km radius...staff s friendly n helpful as well.. rooms are pretty neat n clean.. quite a few variety on breakfast table..but tends to b repetative if u choose to hang around for more than 2 days..especially if ur an indian traveller.. :) (loads of meat) nites r pretty cool as well..especially weekends....but didnt get a chance to visit them.. the red bus starts at plaza mayor..1 day or 2 day tour 18 euros(2 options old n new city) frm plaza mayor.. 1 km walk frm regina...dnt miss that one..

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElksLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in mid January. Found it to be very pleasant. Just a 5 minute walk from Puerta del Sol which is the epicentre of great restaurants & bars in central Madrid. The room was of a decent size with a good quality en-suite. It claims to be 4 Star & probably stands up to that billing. If I was to be picky, then a bit of a pain that breakfast's not available until 7.30am if you need an early start.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rarities122
Reviews.Content: In Madrid for a week in Oct when weather was still hot - always good to return each day to air-conditioned coolness of the Regina especially the cafe for a cool drink, tapas or excellent cafe con leche after a big day of sightseeing. Breakfast was varied and fresh with prompt service from the staff. Metro is right outside and plenty of buses, however we walked to most of the places we wanted to visit. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “One more positive review!”
Reviews.Author: Ansol
Reviews.Content: Family and I stayed recently (December 14- January 2) at the hotel for eight nights and in general it was excellent. The customer service before (through internet) and after our arrival was very timely and professional. Personnel at the desk, cleaning, bellboys, and around was always very informative and respectful. Upon our arrival, and after the first night, we switched rooms for better and preferred ones and they accomodated our requests promptly and without resistance. The rooms were always cleaned, very modern and nicely decorated. Sizes typical of Europe for one and two persons respectively. Locations, probably one of the best as mentioned before. Prices very competitive. In general we had a very nice experience at Regina.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Carolinaferreira
Reviews.Content: room: small but with a great view to the square. Needs repairs. good cable tv. location: perfect, 5 metres from metro station 50 m from starbucks staff: medium breakfast: no opinion

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and clean!”
Reviews.Author: MGBaltz
Reviews.Content: I´ve been there twice and I recommend to eveyone whos going to Madrid. Confort bed, clean bathroom, great breakfast, friendly staff and the best thing: VERY WELL LOCATED! You´ll have great time staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Empshel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in over fifty hotels in Europe and a few in Madrid and this was one of my favorite of all. The room I stayed in was one of the largest that I stayed in for the price and you absolutely cannot beat the location, a few blocks from Puerta del Sol and the Gran Via and with a subway stop right outside. Two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: icisEngland
Reviews.Content: I am just repeating what many others have said,great location,all the main sights are within walking distance,Metro literally yards from the front door,fantastic choice at Breakfast,ample space in the bedroom,staff helpful and efficient.Cannot fault,will stay again a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: brightonbrian
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect. All staff, reception, concierge, cleaners and restaurant were all so professional and friendly. The location is the best in Madrid and the superior rooms were very beautifully styled (some people may find the opaque bathroom glass door a little lacking in privacy but that is a minor point!). I cannot recoomend this hotel enough- if you are staying in Madrid look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Breakfast, Price”
Reviews.Author: BashfulBeki
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina is nicely located on Calle Alcala, one long block south of Puerta del Sol and a short, inexpensive taxi ride from the Puerta Atoche train station. A modern, mid-size hotel, it appears to cater to a lot of business travelers. Nicely appointed downstairs and in the guest rooms, it is scrupulously clean and staffers are everywhere at work in the hallways and stairwells. The management certainly takes the hotel’s condition very seriously. The room we had was of a good size and offered two beds, a desk and chair, ample closet space and a thoughtfully laid-out bathroom. Everything was so nice and carefully thought-through that I found it hard to believe that my three-night stay averaged under $100 a night and—thanks to a special Internet package—included breakfast, a welcome bottle of Champagne, bottle of water and snack tray. Now about that breakfast: It is really worth it. The selection of breads, rolls and pastry is ample, platters offer multiple cheeses, three kinds of ham, pate, hard-boiled eggs tomato, melon and pineapple, while hot offerings included bacon, sausage, pork, baked beans and scrambled egg. On our final morning there was even Tortilla (Spanish omelette). There was also fruit cup and multiple juices available, in addition to milk, cereal, coffee and tea. Of the ten breakfasts we had in Spain, this was by far the best. So what didn’t I like? Though the staff was very efficient and professional, they weren’t necessarily inviting or welcoming. It was clear that this was a serious big city hotel and they could be almost brusque at times. My guess is that a dedicated concierge would make a difference as the front desk staff were busy enough without having to give directions and make recommendations. That said, Hotel Regina offered an excellent room in a location 20 minutes walk from the Royal Palace and about 15 minutes from the Prado. It was close to shopping of every sort and a plethora of restaurants of all levels. Near stations for two different Metro lines, it would be hard to find a better value in a Madrid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: spike5882
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location. It is located very central to anything you may want to see. Everything was within a 15 minute walk, from the museums, to the Royal Palace, to many of the neighborhoods for dining, etc. The price was great too. The rooms are nicely furnished overall (was in the updated superior room). The walls are slightly thin and you can hear anybody outside your door; however, this wasn't really much of a problem. There were a couple items that kept me from rating this 5 stars though. Our room (138) was located in what I believe is the back of the building in a small wing with 2 other rooms and a door stating 'Office'. Once entering our room, the quality of wifi went downhill. You essentially had to sit on the toilet or move a chair to that side of the room to get a decent signal. Once you left the room and went close to the middle of the hotel, the signal picked up. For those where wifi isn't a big deal, then this won't matter. For me, I had a bit of work to do while here, so it became somewhat of an annoyance throughout the stay. The second little gripe is that we were right next to the 'Office'. Either somebody in the office or the room next to us on the other side had somebody that smoked during the day. It penetrated our room and we often would walk into our room with a heavy smell of smoke (though you could tell it was from another room). This was also not always the most welcoming scent to walk into the room and smell. Overall, it's a great hotel in a great location. I would stay here again if visiting. I would just ask for a different room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alez
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on Tripadvisor rating and didn’t regret it. The hotel was excellent in every way, including the price. Location is perfect- metro stop right outside the door, 5 minute walk to Puerta de Sol, tons of bars and food options. The large double room on the renovated wing we booked was extremely clean with plenty of space, plasma tv, safe, mini bar, and the usual toiletries provided in the bathroom . The towels were changed daily. The staff were very friendly. I would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Although noisy”
Reviews.Author: MrsHone
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina was the second hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon. Upon arriving in Madrid via the high speed AVE train from Barcelona, we took the Metro and arrived at the Plaza Del Sol. Even with limited resources and no map, we were able to locate the Hotel Regina with relative ease due to its fantastic location. A very modern and sleek hotel, my husband and I were initially pleased with our hotel. We were escorted to our room which was a little small/narrow, but incredibly modern. The bathroom was pretty amazing with an awesome shower that had a rock/pebble-like floor that massaged your feet! Within minutes of arriving to our room, a bottle of champagne was brought up along with some fruit. We were a little disappointed with the staff. While they were nice for the most part, they were by no means amazing. They didn’t really help us much with recommendations or directions, and (unlike the hotel we stayed at previously in Barcelona) never greeted us when we would return to the hotel. The door to our room had a pretty large gap underneath it and my husband and I were constantly being woken up by various noises out in the hall. Many times, we were woken up early in the morning because a business person would be out in the hall way talking on the phone. The modern design of the hotel with all the marble and slate décor provided perfect sound boards which carried voices and noises straight into our room. Over all, we had a pleasant stay at the Hotel Regina, however I wouldn’t recommend it for couples or people on their honeymoon. I probably wouldn’t even recommend it for families. While it was a really nice, clean and modern hotel in a fantastic location, it was definitely a hotel better suited for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Location fabulous! Beware of the blue blinking light, back street night noise, and cold rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dipti29
Reviews.Content: We booked from hotel web site directly and got their fall special with breakfast included and a welcome basket in a superior upgraded room. Hotel was very well situated for our three day stay of touristing around by foot everyday. Sol, Prado, Palace, Plaza Mayor all within easy walking. Chueca neighborhood, directly north a couple blocks was filled with excellent places to have dinner and drinks and evening wandering. Hotel its self has nice lobby. Staff were friendly enough. Our room was lovely looking. On the first floor in the back with floor to ceiling french doors that opened onto Juliet balconies facing quaint mostly pedestrian street. Bed was comfy and modern updates to room gave it a very contemporary feel. Very clean. Based on all of the above I would have given the hotel an excellent rating. Some problems: -Noise at night from street, not sure what was being dragged down the street at night but it went on and on and on. I had ear plugs (dulled the noise) but it woke up my husband who normally sleeps through anything and kept him awake half the night. -Blue flashing light all night. The sound system in the room has a lit up display by the bed that had an annoying blue light that flashed all night, my husband finally pulled our key out of the holder by the door to turn off electricity to the room to get it to stop. I asked front desk to deal with it the next morning and they did so by flipping the breaker switch to shut the whole thing off. -No heat. I got chilled walking around (December in Madrid). Came back and room felt quite cold, especially coming out of shower to bare feet on cold slate floor. The heat controls did not work at all. Called front desk, they sent someone up, and told us just to wait, that it would eventually come on. Three days later it never had.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: pigchops
Reviews.Content: Positives: A modern looking hotel very centrally-placed with a good connections to the city centre and a good, if very expensive, breakfast. The hotel generally was kept very clean and tidy throughout by friendly excellent and efficient cleaning and bedroom staff. Negatives. We especially asked in our booking for two quiet non smoking rooms with a view. We got two noisy rooms with no view - one of which at the back of the hotel on the fourth floor was right next door to four rooms being noisily renovated with loud crashing and banging building works throughout the whole day. The hotel walls are paper thin and the poor double glazing was not adequate for a city cente hotel. Sadly, the noise pollution continued with banging doors, shouting, noisy bin collections in the early hours right outside our windows throughout the whole night. I have stayed in many many city centre hotels and have never been as disturbed by noise as l was here. Having fake wooden flooring in rooms also makes noise radiation throughout the whole hotel much worse. The hotel must have known that it had placed me right next door to rooms which were being renovated. That room should never have been used for guests while renovations were being carried out. So if you want a good night's sleep avoid this hotel. When l complained to reception l was just told that the hotel was in the process of upgrading rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3-star property, unbeatable location!”
Reviews.Author: DottIng
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4-nights stay at hotel Regina, and I couldn't be more satisfied. I got a very good offer from the hotel's own website, considering it is in such a central location: literally steps from some of the most important sights such as Puerta del Sol, Plaza de Cibeles, Edificio Metropolis/Gran Via. The area is very safe and nice, with a Metro station (Sevilla) just outside the door. Breakfast buffet was huge and with lots of choices, both savoury (bacon, scrambled eggs, ham, smoked salmon, ...) and sweet (small pancakes, ensaimadas, croissants, fruit, yoghurt, ...) - couldn't have asked for more. The room I got (n.535) was very large and nice: I was travelling solo, but they gave this room with a double bed and a terrace overlooking a quiet backstreet, with a view of some of the nearby skyscrapers. The bathroom was also very large, with a big shower and excellent water pressure, all the fixtures in perfectly good order and spotlessly clean. I will for sure consider this hotel again for any future visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: meleth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for my birthday and we both thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Everyone was friendly, the room was amazing (and very quiet) and the buffet breakfast was superb. I really can't fault the hotel in anyway. I loved the location - perfect base to walk around the city. I would definitely stay there again if I was in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: 1605liz
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 3 nights in Madrid and thoroughly enjoyed our stay, The hotel was excellent in every way, location, food, cleanliness, price, the staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We even got a free bottle of Cava as a welcome to the city!! I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, and will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service lacking - Beware of group bookings”
Reviews.Author: Ponchogirls
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a trip to Madrid with 5 others. I was delegated the task of booking 2 twin rooms. I had asked if the rooms booked were in the reburbished part and was advised that they were. We are a group of girls in our late 30's/early 40's. We were given 3 rooms beside 3 offices upstairs in the hotel very near the reception area.. Very noisy location. When asked to relocate one of the rooms we were told that it could not be accommodated but advised if we went down in the morning we would be accommodated elsewhere. No apology was given and the complaint was greeted with shrugging of shoulders. The location is great but it was very disappointing to be allocated the "dud rooms" which should be not allocated to paying guests in the first place

Reviews.Title: “Grateful to Tripadvisor members and their reviews”
Reviews.Author: Stuart_traveler
Reviews.Content: Due to a sudden changes of plans, I had to choose a place to stay in Madrid 15 minutes before leaving from USA to Europe. I logged in Tripadvisor, check the reviews, liked the comments on this hotel, and booked it. The hotel was great because of value, location, staff, breakfast, proximity to public transportation and a car garage, contemporary appearance, cleannes, etc. I would recommend not wasting time looking for other hotels if you want to stay close to "La Puerta del Sol", and the price is acceptable to you. I am sure a great porcentage of people staying in this hotels would be highly satisfied with it. My wife and I were. It set high standards for the rest of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Location”
Reviews.Author: Michele_Pope
Reviews.Content: My travel mate and I booked this hotel months before our trip via the hotel site. A small fee was charged to the credit card and the remainder "to be paid to the Hotel Regina". Upon arrival the desk clerk pulled our reservation out of the "cancelled" file and showed up a copy of an email stating the credit card was rejected for the remainder of the bill. Of course that email was never received and there was no explanation for the first charge going through, not to mention the ambiguity of the statement of paying the balance which inferred the balance would be paid upon arrival or check out. The desk clerk seemed a bit grumpy and told us the hotel was "fully booked". Before blood pressure levels could reach critical mass a manager came by to take a look at the paperwork and discuss the matter. Our original price was honored and we were given a room. The room was very clean and comfortable and the size of the shower most impressive. The safe was the best I'd used the entire trip and I encountered nothing but blissful rest. I later got lost while looking for the hotel's public toilets and stumbled upon a posher area of the hotel (downstairs) where the rooms looked amazingly sleek and fancy. Couldn't help but wonder if we were put in a "spare" room due to the email mix up and could have had one of the lower rooms. Sigh, one will never know. I am just glad the manager values customer service and provided us with a room for our stay. The location is fantastic and the lobby very impressive. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Room Location Needs Improvement - Stay at De Las Letras”
Reviews.Author: UTinEurope
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at Hotel Regina 2 weeks ago. Here is an overall review of the hotel: Pros: -Location, Location, Location - metro stop right outside the door, 5 minute walk to Puerta de Sol, tons of Tapas bars and food options (I'd suggest Casanis Madrid) -Modern, clean rooms Cons: -No free international power converter: EVERY hotel that I have been to in Europe has offered a free converter during my stay. I just wanted to power my iPad and Iphone for the flight home and a man from the front desk came into the room and, acting as a salesman, began a bidding war for a converter - rip off - now I have an european outlet converter that I had to pay 5 euro for - thanks... -HOT HOT HOT. We are two young adults in our mid-20's and we can pretty much withstand bad conditions, but on our first night, my partner and I woke up in a full sweat. We decided to open up the window - which unfortunately opened up to a service shaft. With very little breeze coming through, and since there were 3 other windows an arm reach away and workers arriving at 7am on the dot, we didn't get much sleep. The room averaged a temperature of about 92 degrees. The next morning we went downstairs to talk to the front desk, this leads me to my next point: -Service: I speak fairly good Spanish, and I always give it my very best, but this staff was rude. The front desk told me that AC does not work in winter, and basically I just had to get over it. An hr later a man came up to see if the unit was broken, he looked at it and said - well the heat is off so that's all we can do, every room feels like this and upgrading would mean more $$ out of pocket... he said this while beads of sweat ran down his face...Also, I had informed the hotel before arriving that we were celebrating our anniversary. Not once were we given a Congratulations, acknowledgment or anything - I'm assuming the people who received a bottle of champagne (which most hotels compliment if you are celebrating something special) were probably staying in something more than a basic room. My suggestion: go elsewhere or upgrade (dish out more money) if you book here. There are TONS of hotels in this area. For $10 more per night I could have stayed at De Las Letras down the street, (I had stayed here 6 years ago and had a terrific time), but I wanted to give a new hotel a try. I'm bummed I went with the latter choice. De Las Letras has an incredible, swanky bar downstairs - we spent more time in this hotels bar than in Hotel Regina's. You could tell they favored those buying superior rooms and me, booking on Orbitz, really wasn't worth their time.

Reviews.Title: “Why are Americans so loud and obnoxious?”
Reviews.Author: Moliver58
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day trip to Madrid which was excellent. We stayed at the Regina hotel, which is excellently located close to Puerta del Sol, the Prado and many of the best tourist attractions. The hotel was excellent value for money. But why oh why do they allow so many young Americans to stay. The group that stayed at the same time as us lived up to your worst nightmare. Running along corridors from room to room screaming and shouting from 1am to 4am. The hotel staff tried to quieter them, but when I complained to one group I received the response "I'm sorry, but we are from the U.S."; arrogance at its worst.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Family_BausM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located between Paza des Cibeles and Puerta del Sol. You have a subway station in direct vicinity. It is clean, has a very nice service and the rooms are fine. The location of the hotel is perfect for a walk to the center of the city within not more than 5 minutes. From the airport you can choose the Airport Express Bus and can reach the hotel from the Plaza de Cibeles within max. 10 minutes by foot. I enjoyed my stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Ever!”
Reviews.Author: twoplustwoLancashire
Reviews.Content: just come back from three night stay at the Regina Hotel in Madrid. The location of this hotel is absolutely spot on! From the airport you can easily reach the hotel by metro in less than 30 mins and for only 2.50 Euro. There are just two changes and the metro station is right outside the hotel front door. The metro stop to get off at is Sevilla. Hotel room was imaculate - lovely clean, good quality bedding and pillows - great after a full days exploring! Breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of variety. Another plus - breakfast was served until very late morning meaning a nice lie in - great as the nights were usually late! Easy walking distance to Puerta del Sol which has hundreds of little tapas bars and restaurantsto choose from - and most are very reasonably priced. Couldn't fault the hotel at all. Lovely reception area with plenty of seating, nice bar area and although we didn't eat in the restaurant at night - it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_chic80
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after I read the many reviews on Trip Advisor. I have to say that the location of this hotel really makes it! Its within walking distance to Puerto de Sol which is the main area in the city and where all the shops/restaurant and hustle and bustle is going on. We stayed here for five nights in September. When we arrived at Madrid airport we came outside the airport and if you turn right and carry on until you reach the end of the pavement you will see the shuttle bus there which transports you within walking distance of the hotel for 2euro, excellent value! When we reached the hotel and checked in we discovered we had a room in the attic of the hotel which I didn't even book so this was a nice surprise. I have to say I found the blonde lady at reception less that friendly and to be honest she wasn't very welcoming either. The other staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful, especially the guys who helped us with our bags. When we reached our room it was big and spacious with a balcony which we utilised alot, it was perfect for having an afternoon drink and also dining. The beds were very very comfortable and most of the time the corridor was quiet. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the bathroom was fabulous, shower was excellent. We had booked breakfast for two mornings in the hotel. I wouldn't recommend this as it was expensive and not great. We really enjoyed having our coffee in star bucks which is literally a minute walk from the hotel. The breakfast there is excellent and half the price of the hotel. There is also an excellent cafe/juice bar called Faborit next door to the hotel and it was amazing!! We got lots of salads there and their smoothies are to die for, I actually got addicted to them during my stay! We dined in an Asian restaurant called the Wok for a few nights and really enjoyed the food there. Its situated around the corner from Star Bucks. We did have room service from the hotel also and the food was good. The one major criticism I have of the hotel is that the ladies begin to clean the rooms very early in the mornings, we were woke most mornings to the sound of the hoover!! It was quite annoying at nine in the morning and especially when you are on holiday. I probably would return to Hotel Regina again and overall we both enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_NW_Italy
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights with wife and a group of friends; hotel was hand picked based on location, Tripadvisor rating and Trivago deals. We didn't regret it! Location is perfect, a few steps from Puerta del Sol and within walking distance from all central attractions... Prado, Retiro, Plaza Mayor etc.. The lobby gives a good impression. There are two groups of rooms, a more renovated 'wing' and an older one. Our room was of the older type, very spacious, relatively basic eighties-style furnishing but with flatscreen TV. Sound insulation is not great... occasional noise from the hallways and I could even hear the neighbor's shower fairly loud. Newer rooms have more marble and look more modern, but are possibly a tad smaller. Free wifi. Good choice for breakfast, acceptable quality. Staff is helpful about requests although smiles do not abound, and, in the breakfast room, they could do with a bit more professionalism and speed. The clear winners are price and location, so this is a perfect place for mid-budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in all respects!”
Reviews.Author: Youssef S
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Madrid and I couldn't have asked for a better hotel. I was there on business, so being central and having good access to internet was very important and Regina didn't disappoint in that regard. I had a single room, but it was exactly what I needed; the bed was comfortable, linens and towels were clean, the closet was spacious and the safe was convenient and easy to use. The team at the frontdesk were extremely helpful, attentive and friendly. All in all, a fantastic hotel if you are looking for an affordable, comfortable and perfectly located hotel. Were I to return to Madrid, I would have no second thoughts about staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly, centrally located in heart of Madrid (in Sol)”
Reviews.Author: CarlaChicago
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews which were very accurate. Arrived 11/17/11 for 2 nites. Perfect location for us to walk to puerta del sol, museo del prado and Plaza Mayor - within 15 mins walk. Booked hotel thru octopus travel.com which had the lowest room rates than all other sites. Our room faced Calle de Alcala street, which is a busy street with lots of crowds and people watching, but the noise didn't keep us up at night. Didn't have the best welcoming with the lady behind the desk at time of check-in: she was very dry and seemed annoyed at my attempts to communicate in Spanish (albeit broken) with my American accent. She informed me she spoke English and continued the check-in process, which was quick. She said very few words while neglecting to inform us of our free (included) breakfast details/location, password for free wifi, and gave us no map of the city, as I saw her do with other customers. So i had to call from my room to ask of these details. Aside from her sub-par service, the accommodations were great, all other staff were great, lobby had contemporary decor, updated interior, and the same for the rooms - spacious for Madrid rooms. Nice sized bathroom with double sinks and a large shower/bath. Very modern amenities. There is a cafe/restaurant in hotel, but it's pricey so I would recommend eating elsewhere - the free breakfast was just ok. Starbucks is on same block but better coffee/tea right next door (name starts with F). You can't beat the location...also super close to Gran Via street, major street leading to Puerta del Sol and other major areas. Highly recommend this place for it's location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: texaspike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his hotel for 3 nites. Very lovely and centralized to all major locations in the city. Sevilla Metro Station just steps away. For around 2 Euros you can travel to/ from Barajas Aeropuerto. Travel time will take about 35 mins. Hotel had modern amenities. We had the suite. The room was about 300 square feet. The bathroom was really nice and clean. The service at the bar was very good. The young man that waited on us was very good at what he did. Let us try the tapas and made recommendations. Great conversationalist. Next time we return to this vibrant city I will absolutely stay here. Puerta del Sol is a few yards away. There are hundreds of tabernas in the vacinity with excellent food. The night life in the area is like no other. I traveled through out Europe and you cannot not compare the night life on a Saturday night. Electrifiying. Plus both my wife and I felt very safe walking in the area during the day and night. The hotel should add another star to its rating!

Reviews.Title: “Location location......”
Reviews.Author: family4cheshire
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, dead center of Madrid within walking distance of all major sights of interest Right outside is the Metro Sevilla stop . We were met at the hotel reception by the concierge who checked us in and carried our case to our room and showed us the facilities .Buffet breakfast was so good...even champagne, smoked salmon and a great selection of hot, cold, cereal, fruit,cheese, pancakes, pastries and bread. The breakfast room service was excellent as was the general service in the hotel. The staff were helpful and polite. The room was comfortable and clean with fresh towels everyday and new complimentary toiletries each day. Great value for a 4 day break, would highly recommend this hotel.( Thanks to trip advisor we have used you a lot recently and you always come up trumps !!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best customer service in an European hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelerRN83
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Madrid's Regina on 10/21 at 8:30am. We were a bit concerned as check in is 3pm. When we came in the door man was attentive to the extreme and took our bags immediately. At the concierge desk, the gentleman and female welcomed us warmly. They found our reservation right away and told us that though we were so early, he would have a room arranged within 3 hrs while we take a walk or have breakfast at one of their convenient restaurants on location. I was a bit concerned about the rooms difference, and as I feared, we were not booked for a superior room (I found out about the rooms difference in decoration after booking). Upon inquiring about prices for upgrade, the gentleman was so helpful, and told me not to worry about it. Room was ready at time promised and I have to say that I loved it! My favorite thing is the satellite radio with speakers installed through the room and bathroom which, under some soft music, and their ambient lights in the wall behind the bed, give the room a peaceful and relaxing touch. The satellite radio has music from every imaginable country. The decoration was beautiful; contemporary, minimalistic European . Loved the closet space, and the room is plenty big for an European room! Bigger than 4 stars hotels through the continent. Now, I have seen pics of other rooms, the ones not remodeled, and I can see that their decoration is in pal with their lobby style. I think that their lobby should be decorated in pal with these cute and chic superior rooms. The service in the hotel is amazing! The warmest from any European country I have been to. We had a problem with our safe on day 2 and they were there right away to fix it. Housekeeping is efficient. The hotel is located in an amazing spot! Smack in the middle between old Madrid and sophisticated Madrid, right around Grand Via and a little walk from Puerta Del Sol; walkable distance to amazing neighborhoods and tourist spots. We didn't even use the metro though there is a station right in front. After booking out, we waited for a while for our scheduled airport transfer (booked through Amex Platinum seperately), and unlike other hotels that when you book out you they act like you were never there, the door man was checking on us constantly and when our transport was 10min delayed, he offered to call the company for us, walked me to the front desk, and call they did.
