The service arrived within minutes. I have to say, I was a bit eskeptical about going to Madrid for a long weekend break and my fiancée was the one always nagging about wanting to visit Madrid. But, I am more than glad I did. I also have to say a big part of this great experience in Madrid was thanks to the amazing service and accommodations provided by The Regina Hotel. Hands down, the best customer service in an European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: JulianneNM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days and three nights during a two-week vacation throughout Spain. I can't say enough about the amazing value and service we received. First, the location is great. We walked nearly everywhere we wanted to visit in Madrid from this hotel, and the closest Metro stop (Sevilla) is right across the street. It's just a few minutes walk to great attractions like Puerta del Sol or the Prado Museum. The Metro is so efficient you can take it to everywhere else you might need to go, including the Atocha train station. We stayed in a standard room on the first floor (they call the ground floor zero) in what looked to be a new wing. The room was lovely. We had a king bed, very modern and clean bathroom with a shower and it was peaceful & quiet. If you're looking for a quieter room, I highly recommend asking to be in the back part of the hotel as we were, as I imagine the rooms on the street side are not as quiet. This hotel also has a nice restaurant, and a more casual cafe in the lobby. The restaurant was moderately pricey, but the cafe was a great place for breakfast or snacks. On the weekends they offered an "American breakfast" of eggs, bacon and tea for just 5Euro and you could get toast with a tomato marmalade spread for just 1.50. They also had a variety of tapas ranging from 2-7 Euro. We had dessert and wine in the restaurant one night and it was very good. The last and best thing I'll mention was the service- the front desk staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. They helped with everything from recommending attractions, helping us make dinner reservations (I highly recommend La Barraca, for paella 3 mins walk from hotel) and highlighting the best areas for shopping. If we ever visit Madrid again, we will definitely stay at the Hotel Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: ExecPlat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July 2011 for a weekend. We booked the Hotel Regina through Travelzoo for a very good rate that included breakfast and fruit/champagne upon arrival. We got a standard double bed room that was fine and the bathroom was huge. The only thing was the air conditioning wasn't very powerful, but that is common here in Europe. For breakfast there were lots of options; eggs, cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, bread, etc. Hotel Regina was maybe 30 feet from the Seville metro station and a few blocks from Puerta del Sol. There was also a juice bar and Starbucks next door that was convienent. We recommended this hotel to our friends who stayed there in September and they enjoyed it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernums
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the centre of Madrid. It is right outside the sevilla metro station. Large comfortable rooms although a bit hot for our personal taste. The reception staff are amazing, we had our purse stolen on the first afternoon and it contained all our cards, they couldn't have been more helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central position.”
Reviews.Author: GisellaFrance
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over a long weekend and found this hotel to be the best, and ideally situated for all the activities in Madrid. Nicely decorated with very clean rooms. Would go there again, whenever next in Madrid. (However, we avoided the breakfast at 15euros each and instead went to Starbucks a few meters away!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: s0ulffle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Regina for 2 nights (Saturday to Monday). I didn't have very high expectations since it seems like Hotel Regina was a 3-star hotel. However, I was very pleasantly surprised by the location of the hotel and the quality of my stay! Location-wise, it's 5 minutes TOPS for strolling to Puerta del Sol. And the hotel is right at the exit of the Sevilla metro station. I expected to feel very lost looking for the hotel but I didn't have to try at all. Rooms (I stayed in what looked like the new wing) were very modern, very new. Beds were king-sized, comfortable and bathroom with very modern fittings (I spotted "Grohe" brand showerheads). Staff were friendly and accommodating with initiative. When I checked out ahead of my flight time, the reception staff asked (before I could request) if I would like to store my bags with them first. Only gripe was that the main room door was not too sound-proof and it was a little difficult to sleep in with a lot of foot traffic along the corridors. I could even hear the distant whirr of a hairdryer. Don't let that put you off though - unless you are a very very light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: dingyadi
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing - smack bang in the centre of town with a metro stop feet away and only a few minutes more to the central metro station Sol. I agree with all the other comments about the difference in rooms. The hotel is an odd shape and there are atrocious rooms and there are brilliant rooms and the enjoyableness of your stay may depend on which kind you get. We were there for 5 nights and first off we were put in room 117 - if you get that one ask for another. We couldn't find it until we found a cleaner who led us down into what felt like the dungeon. This was one of the unrenovated rooms with a small window overlooking an aircon hole. It was also a wifi, TV and mobile phone blackspot. It would be ok for a night but 5 nights would have been very depressing. And only ok for a night if you are a heavy sleeper as it was next to the lifts, stairs and the door that the housekeeping staff used so it was very noisy all night. But we asked if they could move us to another room and although the place was fully booked, they agreed (although when we asked about our new room the next day, they had not noted it - the reception staff are helpful but harassed). We ended up getting moved to a gorgeous renovated room on one of the higher floors and it made the rest of our stay. Very tasteful, modern, comfortable and airy. If you find yourself in one of the lovely rooms, the Hotel Regina is an amazing bargain - a nice room in a great location in the centre of Madrid for a very reasonable cost. If you find yourself in one of the crappier rooms... hmmmm. So make sure you ask for one of the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ΑΚΡΙΒΗ Κ
Reviews.Content: Very well situated outside metro station ''sevilla'' Very nice decorated and clean rooms! Great breakfast! The staff was extremely helpfull! We really enjoyed our two night stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KSutton
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on business. The room I was allocated was on the 1st floor overlooking the service wall. The first impression was not great I have to say. I walked down a dark corridor with a threadbare carpet and my heart sank. When I walked in to the room, it was dark and dingy despite it being the afternoon. I opened the curtains to find a small frosted glass window, with the noisy air conditioning units outside. However, turning on the lights, the room lit up. They have put plenty of downlighters in, I assume to combat the dreary feeling and it worked. The room itself looked like it had been recently renovated, with nice furniture, fresh paint and overall a very nice atmosphere. The desk was a decent size as well. The bathroom was tiny but clean. The bath was too small with one of those horrible shower curtains that tries to cling to you (one of the reasons for 4, and not 5 stars). I am 5 foot and would no way fit in to the bath in comfort, so I don't know why they didn't just put a decent walk-in shower instead. The bed was really comfortable with great quality, clean linens. Another down-side is that the aircon did not work particularly well, which was OK in November but probably a different story in the summer. We had a group meal in the restaurant, and it was delicious. The sevice was good too. Reception were welcoming and helped me out when I needed a toothbrush, and also some urgent ironing of work clothes for the following day (no iron or board available to do it myself). All in all, the hotel was very good and I would definately stay there again when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ervi I
Reviews.Content: Great locations, friendly receptionist, very clean. We like the airport (shuttle) car service, cheaper then taking a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.....”
Reviews.Author: B T Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really convenient location, just a minute away from Huertas and Sol and right next to the Sevilla Metro station exit. Friendly staff but..... we booked well in advance through Octopus and got a pretty good rate. On arrival the receptionist carefully went through the available rooms and allocated us an old and tired looking 'smoking' room at the front of the hotel. The room smelt of stale smoke and the window looked out onto a sevice well. I contacted reception and asked for a non smoking room, which they immediately agreed to. We took our bags back to reception where the receptionist again carefully scrutinised the room list before allocating us another room. This time we got a very modern room towards the back of the hotel. However, despite some nice design touches, the room was incredibly small and yet again looked out onto a noisy service well. We got the distinct impression that because we had booked through a cut price agency the hotel were determined to give us a cut price room. Without a doubt this can happen at other hotels as well but you might want to bear it in mind when booking. Other than that, the room was pleasant enough and we spent most of our time out and about. The breakfast was pleasant and varied but not really even as good as a typical 'Novotel' chain hotel type breakfast. We loved Madrid and liked the hotel but next time we would probably be more careful when booking somewhere for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: urbantraveler80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Regina for two nights. The room was clean, modern, overlooking a side street. The hotel has a good location. The staff at the front desk was helpful. It was a good value for the money. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern Design”
Reviews.Author: rerutled
Reviews.Content: I travel about a dozen times a year for work. I stayed in a Superior room for 3 nights under an internet special. The room was a tremendous value -- the furnishings were modern, comfortable, well designed. The top/bottom sheet double bed was comfortable, with a hard mattress (which I like). The bathroom was spacious, with a toilet and bidet, and an absolutely modern shower, again all in a modern design. The towels were not the fluffiest, but they were more than adequate. The location of the hotel was exceptional: with easy walking distance to the major Plazas in Madrid, the Gran Via, and the subway is just out the door (also a Starbucks 2 doors down; but there are also great cafes in the area). I liked that the internet WiFi was included; connectivity is important to me, and unlike 95% of the the hotels I stay in, they didn't have a ridiculous web-based log-in page, instead using the WiFi direct login (WPA password). This makes an enormous difference because the computer logs in automatically when you turn it on, so you enter the password once when you arrive, and it's ready to go your whole stay -- a huge factor when you have 3 internet devices like I do when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nicegirl47us
Reviews.Content: Pleasant, friendly welcome on Reception. The room was spotlessly clean and tastefully appointed, with smart, modern decor. The room looked out onto an internal lightwell, but I was only staying one night, so it didn't matter too much. The location is fantastic, right in the centre of Madrid. Only downside (and unfortunately this is the case in too many hotels now) there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Overall, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gigilula
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights on the fourth floor in mid-October 2011. We had an interior room which was very quiet and the place was spotless. The hotel is in an excellent location: the Sevilla metro stop is right out the front door and Sol is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. You can easily walk to most all the sites: Prado (15 minutes), Plaza Mayor (10 minutes), and Royal Palace (10-15 minutes). We had a problem with our refrigerator on the second day there (it wouldn't stay cold). We mentioned the problem to someone at the front desk as we were going out around 10:00 am, and the refrigerator was fixed when we came back around 4:00 pm. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure its a new room!”
Reviews.Author: slao
Reviews.Content: Check in for 3 night stay and requested a newly renovated room, but was given an old room with a busted air conditioning. After coming back from dinner and numerous complaints about the air conditioning, I was given a newly renovated room Room 132 overlooking a sidestreet. (you can hear the garbage being taken away in the middle of the night). No problem with this room and its room size is big compared to other european rooms. Came back for another night stay before leaving Spain and was given a newly renovated room 343. Requested a wake up call at 430 am but was not given one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: IToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a total of 5 nights in the hotel and had a fantastic time! Carlos and his staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel is excellently situated to enjoy all of downtown Madird, and is extremely clean and comfortable. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will stay there again, whenever I travel to Madrid. Overall a very good experience..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Madrid city centre hotel I'd look no further! The courtesy of the staff was excellent, the rooms were very good, and the price for this quality of hotel so near the city centre was great. No negatives - just worth noting that the rooms we got onto the centre courtyard (which were very quiet) were open plan with the bathroom, so be sure this isn't an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “What a disapointment!”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Mendes
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a short stay in Madrid, based on very good reviews. I just got here, and on the reception desk there's a certificate of excellence from tripadvisor. When I got to my room, it's umbelievable... I just realized I didn't choose a superior room, so I got a very old room, noisy floor, funny smell, with the tiniest window facing a gloomy backyard.... A small bathtub with shower curtain... Not at all what I was expecting, not suitable for a four star hotel. Even if I didn't choose a 'Superior' room, I surelly did not choose an inferior one, nor is the price that inferior. Anyway, don't forget to choose Superior, or you'll be very disapointed...

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: annalisajb
Reviews.Content: Right in front there is the Sevilla metro stop, 3 blocks north is Plaza Sol, 3 blocks east is Gran Via! I loved Madrid and the fact that our hotel was right smack in the middle of it all, was icing on the cake. We stayed at the newer/renovated part of the hotel and had a surround sound radio which was awesome. The hotel was overall very comfortable. I WOULD DEFINITELY RETURN TO HOTEL REGINA!! PS- a cab from the airport to the hotel cost roughly around 15 Euros

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, very good services.”
Reviews.Author: Betsy98
Reviews.Content: A short walk from Plaza de Cibeles, and 2 min walk to Puerta del Sol.Centrally located and if you love walking, the hotel is a perfect place to start. Staff were friendly and helpful.On our first night the aircon didn't work but the room seemed newly refurbished,very modern.They then moved us to a bigger room,slightly "older" but quiet and apologised a few times.We would definitely stay here again if we go back to Madrid!Beds and pillows were made in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location and outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: JMI75
Reviews.Content: We got there by a friend recommendation. Although not very new, the hotel is in excellent condition, location is very convenient, and the hotel staff very helpful. Outstanding service. Cafeteria and restaurant are pretty good too. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Guy3344
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was very nice and a friendly hotel staff greeted us. There were a few elevators, which can be a big factor if traveling with a lot of luggage. The room: The room had a bit of a smell in it that only would dissipate after turning the AC on for a few minutes. The bed was fine and the room included a mini-bar (we didn't drink from there but used the extra space in the fridge to chill our drinks that we bought at El Corte Ingles) and flat screen TV. Our room was on the back side of the hotel so, while there was not a great view, it was quiet. Breakfast: Breakfast was included in our special rate. It was decent but I don't think worth the extra 15 euro or whatever it would have cost had it not been included. The buffet had several beverage choices: coffee and tea, OJ and other juices, and champagne for those who want mimosas. There was a minimal selection of hot food including scrambled eggs, "bacon", sausage and some stewed beans (these were very good although different from what we eat for breakfast in the States). There was also a toaster and selection of baguettes, breads, rolls, etc, cold meats (jamon, choirizo, salami) and cheeses, fresh fruit (pineapple, melon, watermelon) and yogurt. Location: Great location in center of tourist locations. 5 minute walk to Puerta del Sol and its Metro line, 1 minute walk to Sevilla Metro stop, 10 minute walk from Plaza Mayor, walkable to the museums (~15 minutes) and the Palace (~15 minutes). Overall I would recommend the hotel for the right price. I think it is about a 3.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina a save choice”
Reviews.Author: janiceLisbon
Reviews.Content: There are two great things about Hotel Regina: fisrt the great placement in Madrid city ( half way to Portas del Sol and Plaza Cibeles, near Gran Via) and the others is the good staff that are very useful and efficient. There is no desigh and Spain have good examples of that, I think is the only thing I have missed. No desigh and no luxury but a very clean room with the basic... Hotel regina is an excellent place to stay if you want to be in touch with Madrid Mood...You can walk to everywhere and you have metro ( Sevilha) and bus just at door. It is a very save choice to enjoy the beauty and Madrid atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Superb12
Reviews.Content: Location is in centre of Madrid next to Sevilla Metro 2 mins walk to Sol and 5 mins walk from Airport bus stop at Cibeles. Entrance and public area of good standard with restaurant, cafe and sitting area for guests. Check in was polite and efficient. Rooms, first room offered was dark with no natural light, there was a window but it appeared to face into a internal shaft, couldnt stay for 5 days in this, returned to reception.Second room had two single beds seperated by furniture, not suitable for married couple.Third room was described as an upgrade but appeared smaller, but had better light and a small terrace allbeight surrounded by a 6' wall and yellow fence arrangement. The room was of a very good standard, well maintained and clean, the bathroom was also very good with toiletries supplied. There was a flat screen TV with a reasonable number of chanels but I would have preferred BBC included. Mini bar in room but did not use cheaper to get drinks from local supermarket. The only real drawback with the room was the walls are not noise insulated and for two nights our neighbours decided to talk loudly to into the small hours, which kept us awake, the hotel really needs to sort the insulation issue out as it is a problem. Overall a very good hotel and if you book in advance you can get a good price, would I stay again probably.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CahuitaFox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days mid July on the first stop of a 2 1/2 month vacation. We got a good rate by booking over a month in advance via Internet. Our room was spacious and the location excellent. We stayed here again on our way home the end of September and the rate was significantly higher and the room much smaller. I'm unsure how they determine their rates but I suspect that the summer months they can afford to offer discounts to tourists and starting September they cater to business travellers. In any event, we enjoyed our stay. The airport shuttle offered by the hotel is good, efficient and cheaper than a regular taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NirElbaz
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location The bathroom The breakfast Cons: Only one elevator available Notice that the bathroom a transparent glass sliding door..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and excellent location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: euroridge
Reviews.Content: Though I was a bit concerned about some of the reviews, we booked 3 nights at Hotel Regina based on the location, photos and possibility of a balcony on Alcala, and we're so glad we did! I'd asked for a balcony double room on Alcala - of which there seem to be just 3, and we were given our first choice of those (106 - see another reviewer's photos here on TripAdvisor). It was ready when we arrived at 1:00, and was exactly as pictured. The man at the desk shook my hand when we checked in (a first for me). We did not experience noise from the hotel (perhaps because our room was reached around 3 bends from the stairs/elevators). But if you're a light sleeper, the late Madrilenos hours may keep you up in any street-facing room in the city! We, however, just loved being able to hang out our French Window doors and balconette over the convergence of 3 active streets. The views include two gorgeous buildings opposite: one with twin black 4-horsed chariot statues atop, and another with a shining dome top. Sunday nights must be the biggest for partying, as the crowds never ceased until 3:00 a.m., yet it was fairly quiet by 11:00 Monday evening). The Sevilla Metro stop is directly in front of the hotel, and busy Sol square is just a long block away, with Plaza Mayor just a few blocks beyond Sol. Madrid's architecture is just mind-boggling (and we came here directly from Lisbon). Everywhere you walk in the older sections, you'll see gorgeously ornate buildings. It's such a walkable city, and when your endurance lags, the Metro beckons (we shared a 10-trip ticket for 9.3 Euros - got two of those in our 3-day stay). Every square and roundabout has a big fountain, and most have statues or monuments. And Madrfid boasts an embarassing wealth of world-class art museums which we visited in strike-force manner, heading for the rooms with pieces we most especially wished to see (watch your dates if art is your passion - most of the art museums are closed Monday). Restaurants and tapas places abound, with outdoor seating in every square. We usually ate dinner at 8 to 9:00, as the locals don't dine till closer to 10:00. But if you like to eat earlier, you'll find plenty of options open early in the tourist areas. Our room was immaculate with a huge (seemed larger than King) bed and desk with chair plus a lounger, flat screen TV (unused by us) and tile bath with shower and double sinks (this was one of the non-renovated rooms, and we liked it) . There were reading lamps on each side of the bed, and 2 "body pillow"-sized bed pillows apiece, plus throw pillows. And, happily for our taste, a sheet and sheet blanket rather than a duvet, which seems too heavy for summer, but appears to be the norm these days. The A/C worked great (and was operational while we were there Sept. 24-27). There were more toiletries here than at some higher ranked/priced places we stayed, including a comb and shower cap in addition to the regular suspects (yes, there was soap, unlike a much earlier review I read). No coffee-making facilities, but a Starbucks 3 doors down from the hotel. Very professional desk service who had our airport taxi waiting as ordered at 7:00 a.m. All this for 82 euros/nite without breakfast (reserved direct via the hotel web site 6 months in advance). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sybarites
Reviews.Content: We had a large room, clean and well serviced, an OK buffet breakfast if you don't fancy finding your own, but it was perfectly placed for walking to the Reina Sofia and El Prado and right opposite the Metro en route from the airport. It was noisy at night and we had a room at the back which had revellers and bin-men competing at one stage in the early hours - but so do many cities! Also it was very well located to explore most central parts of a great city. The staff indulged our use of English and were most helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellerN0tT0urist
Reviews.Content: Located quite near Puerta del sol and another metro station, this hotel is a great springboard for a tour of Madrid. Modern, but oddly laid out rooms, very helpful staff distinguish this hotel. If anything, it is a little corporate for a traveller wanting to relax, and the walls are a bit thin. For some reason our air con did not work on the last night of our stay. A fairly option. Not bad, not exceptionally good.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dessislava
Reviews.Content: We did not eat in this hotel so I can not comment on the food. Hotel was clean throughout our stay, toiletries replaced daily. Shower was lovely and hot daily, dryer in bathroom. Staff in the reception did not appear to be very friendly as most of the time they did not even look at us when we were coming back from sightseeing. Few channels on tv, bed was comfortable, extra pillows were provided and we had a safe in the wardrobe. Location was amazing- just 10 metres from the metro exit. There was a cafe just across the road with breakfast for £2.50-bargain.Overall nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “If only we were younger and thinner...”
Reviews.Author: TawnyaSingapore
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; 10 min walk to Puerta del Sol and the Prado, with subway just outside the door. Staff was very helpful, and got us good tickets to the bullfight, and had info about sights nearby when we arrived at 8 AM and could not get into our room yet. Only plugs near bed were for iPods, so sleep apnea machine had to be strung across the room. No clock, and not many English TV channels. Toilet was placed next to wall, so difficult to use comfortably for anyone wider than 26 inches. There must be a good bar just behind, as a crowd of young men were drinking there, and fighting, until 5 AM. Very clean, with nice coffee chain shop just next door. Restaurant was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Di0nysia
Reviews.Content: It is not only the location that is the best you can get if you want to spend some days sightseeing in Madrid. For me, most of all, what makes this hotel great is the staff: efficient, knowledgable and proffessional, a really great team, that runs this busy place really well! Well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Myfanwy2
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in early Sept at Hotel Regina, reserved at a great rate. Central location for most sights, and the Sevilla metro station is right outside the front door if you want to go further afield. Courteous and helpful staff, from the reception desk through to the maids. Room was modern, functional and spotlessly clean, and we were given a bottle of Cava and some fresh fruit on the first evening. Great breakfasts, and the adjoining cafeteria attracts a lot of local and business custom - always a good sign. Numerous, bars, cafes and eateries within walking distance. Would certainly stay there again if returning to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: loves2spooge
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated to explore Madrid - with a Metro station right outside the hotel entrance. I recommend purchasing the Madrid Tourist Travel Pass at the airport for the duration of your stay as it is extremely good value for money. I did not eat at the hotel, though the restaurant and room service menu looks delicious and extensive. There are plenty of cafes just outside the hotel where you can buy a cheap, and local, breakfast. I booked this hotel with an excellent rate and the twin room was perfect for my friend and me for a four night stay. Spotlessly clean, great room service, a very useful locking safe (which you can lock with a metallic strip card - no charge), extra pillows and blankets and great air conditioning. I also left some jewellery in the room when I checked out and returned about 45mins later - was given a card to get into the room with absolutely no problems. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dynasty09
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated right by metro and places of interest. Hotel perfect. Good food, spotless accomodation and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Friendly, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Travmur
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right at Seville metro station - walking distance to everything. Friendly staff - helpful and smiling - especially the porters and serving staff. Good buffet breakfast. Rooms recently renovated - large and stylish, we had one at the front looking out on the main street but windows and shutter blinds kept most of the noise out. You really can't beat this hotel if you want somewhere central and affordable in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable rooms, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: carola312741
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just in front of the tube station Sevilla so you can take the subway directly from Barajas, the airport, for about 1,60 euros! The hotel staff at the reception desk are friendly and very helpful. They recommended us a great restaurant near the hotel, and helped and advised us when we were told our flight had been delayed: they offered us a late check out for a very low price. The beds are king sized and the linen, super soft. Don´t use the hotel shampoo, though, it smells really bad. The location is perfect, just a 2minute walk from Plaza Mayor. I strongly recommend this hotel and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fab location”
Reviews.Author: billfish08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid August when Madrid is very hot. The AC managed well. The Hotel is very well located. We took the bus from the airport but in hindsight would have been better taking the metro as the hotel is right beside the metro station Seville. Check in was very efficient with the staff giving us some great advice about the area. Once we got to our room we realised the AC was making quite a racket. I reluctantly went down to complain at reception. From this point the staff were exceptional. We were changed rooms initially to a smaller room with the promise of being moved again the following day back to a bigger room. The smaller room was quite adequate and the next day the staff moved all of our baggage while we were out sight seeing, which was excellent. Our third and final room was outstanding with a magnificent view of the Banco De Spania building. The breakfast that was included in the room was fantastic with a great chioce of anything you could want to start the day. The little bar in the hotel was also reasonably priced. The hotel is briliantly located only a two minute walk to Puerto del Sol and another couple to Plaza Mayor. Lots of great places to eat within 10 mins walk. We tried a lot of tapas bars after going on a guided tapas trail. Overall this hotel was exactly what you want on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value booked through Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: xienlee
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great room. Very easy to find as our first city on our Spanish trip, right next to a subway stop and walking distance to The Padro and surrounding areas. Great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon was okay”
Reviews.Author: Trvl151
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, and the room was less than expected. Issues: 1. tiny room 2. the bed was 2 twin beds put together that came apart almost nightly 3. the shower door only covered half of the shower, and there is no room to move around in the shower. Normally not a big deal, but this was a honeymoon, so, not so cool. 4. attitude from front desk was quite cold, particularly from management 5. restaurant service was good only one time, and that was the time when we decided to splurge and have a big, expensive meal. Go figure. 6. very thin walls 7. old-style TV. . .would have expected at least a flat screen That being said, there was one manager who was so incredibly nice and kind, and went above and beyond. Unfortunately, he was overshadowed by the other managers who were quite cold. I felt like our requests or questions were inconveniences. Also, the location is INCREDIBLE!! I can't stress that enough. At this hotel, you are pretty much right in the middle of everything, so that is why we chose to stay. And really, we were on our honeymoon, so we knew that we were going to get out a bit. Balcony area was cool, as we didn't know we were getting that. It was too cold when we were there (March), so we only went out there post-drinking, but in warmer weather, I bet it would be great. . .especially for a breakfast with cafe con leche. Would we stay there again? No, and that is not easy for me to say. I feel as though this might hurt the hotel, and for that, I am sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: glacey
Reviews.Content: The metro is located right at the hotel doorstep which is just perfect. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but usually popped next door to a nice little cafe with fresh juices, awesome hot chocolate and pastries. Also plenty of cafes in the area. The neighbour is excellent. Clean, safe, wide roads, and gorgeous buildings all around. The room itself was clean and adequate. Quite a good size! Service, meh, but we got everything we needed so nothing to complain about. Would definitely stay here again if I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Very Close to City Center”
Reviews.Author: AndersonGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Regina August 1-16, 2011. Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel influenced our reservation when planning our visit to Spain and we were not disappointed. The hotel was about a 5-minute brisk walk from the Puerta del Sol, and conveniently located along the route for the Barajas Airport/Atocha Rail Station bus. We couldn't have selected a better location for our stay. The bi-lingual staff was extremely helpful and the hotel decor/room/amenities were excellent. We would definitely stay at this hotel again on our next Madrid visit. Additionally, on the corner adjacent to the hotel was a VIPS restaurant, very good food, great value, and very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Rozental
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Regina for 4 nights. Rooms are cozy, comfortable, minimalist and well decorated. The phrase that describes Regina front desk was: YES IS THE ANSWER, WHAT IS THE QUESTION. Excellent breakfast, location, commodities.... I fully recommend Regina, worth the thing!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, awesome, awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura A
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9 AM from overseas flight. The front desk agent gave us a room within 45 minutes of our arrival--we were exhausted and so grateful. The hotel is beautiful and so clean that we felt like we were the first persons to stay in the rooms. Modern, extremely appealing decor. In-room satellite radio, very energy efficient, comfortable, quiet. We can't say enough about this hotel. There's a subway stop just down the street at the gorgeous Plaza del Sol. We shopped, had fantastic food, and bought electrical converters and adapters at a large department store there. Everything we needed was close and convenient. We went to the Reina Sofia Museum, Bernabeu Stadium, Madrid Zoo and Aquarium, the Presidental Palace, cathedrals, Retiro Park and so much more from this convenient location. I searched for hours and hours on Trip Advisor to find the perfect hotel. This is it!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Lorenauk81 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Even though my stay at Hotel Regina was only a short one, I still think it was fantastic. The location is superb, right in the city centre, a stone's throw away from many important landmarks in the capital: Gran Via, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Cibeles, Plaza España, Opera... everything within very easy walking distance. The rooms were very nice and clean, so was the rest of the hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful and the breakfast buffet was pretty good too. All this at a very reasonable price, not booking far in advance, in the middle of peak season? I think I'll be coming again next time I need to be down in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: annahjane
Reviews.Content: Being a family thought I could of shared a bed with the hubby as we put in a room with 3 single beds which was my disappointing thing great location were not looking at much but made it quiet as were there for wyd room service was a little hard with the language barrier but food was tasty housecleaning was great what ever I left lying around eg money cameras was always left alone made visiting for the first time to Spain enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: yulcya
Reviews.Content: the staff at reception is very welcomed, the location is perfect - a little bit away from noisy Sol square, but the M station "Sevilla" is just 2 sec away. And there is a Starbucks on the corner. Was not impressed with breakfast menu, but serving coffee especially for each single table is nice, and they made very nice b-day present for my brother with a cake and a candle! Conditioner inside the room worked nicely, and the balcony with a terrace is also a plus! Overall pleasant and relaxed experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: samexp
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel and location. Staff was good as well. However we got a room that was facing nowhere. To the staff's defense they did try to put me up in a outside facing room but it was packed that weekend. So I would stay here for sure but make sure your room faces the road. the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific accommodation and excellent location to explore Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PeterAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina for 4 nights and as we had a car (which is a nuisance at times in Spain) we chose Hotel Regina because there is a car parking facility right underground next to the Hotel. The Hotel was modern, clean and facilties were extremely good. Staff were attentive and helpful. Location is 4 star as everything is within walking distance. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend some time in Madrid with or without a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location & modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wargreg
Reviews.Content: Great spot, close to palace, the prado, and all of the great plazas in Madrid. Clean and nice rooms. Friendly service. Noisy at night and they screwed up our request for connecting rooms, but good hotel overall. Very modern, but lacks charm and charisma if that is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel...but a few words of caution”
Reviews.Author: novak500
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Spain my wife and I stayed here for 4 nights while in Madrid. The hotel is in a great location and in walking distance of most major attactions/sights in downtown Madrid. There was a metro station right out the front door and another just a few minutes walk down the street. The Grand Via is also a short walk. The buffet breakfast which was part of the package we had was great and very enjoyable. The hotel was also very clean and the front desk staff very helptful. We had one the renovated rooms, and really enjoyed the in-room satellite radio and modern style. The website mentions that the hotel is completely renovated but that is not accurate so try and confirm when booking if you are in a renovated room or not. The only real negative was the noise in the hallways at night. When people came back from where ever, you could really hear them and that had us up on the last 2 nights. I was torn to give the hotel a very-good rating but the noise from the noise from the hallway (and a quiet nights sleep is important to me) lead me to the average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Regina to be a terrific hotel for a great price. it is centrally located in Madrid, its decor is entirely updated, nice and clean, and the hotel staff was friendly and comfortable in several languages. I stayed away from their restaurant and stuck with the coffee shop next door for breakfast and evening coffee, and made use of the many restaurants in the area the rest of the day. Again, you can't be the location or the clear directions from airport via subway, you can't beat the price, and it has all the ameneties as well, from WiFi to a mini-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very modern Design”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Eye_USA
Reviews.Content: I saw a promotion on Travelzoo some months back for a double room at the Hotel Regina for $99.00. The deal included breakfast and a free bottle of champagne. I was planning a vacation in Europe and had planned to pop into Madrid for a day so I thought, "Why not?" I made the reservation directly through the hotel and showed up on Thursday, August 4, 2011. The hotel sits at the top of a hill in a fairly commercial area of Madrid. It is a twenty minute walk to the park and the Prado. At the time we were there, the city had shut down various streets because protesters were staging demonstrations a short distance away. Apparently the Pope was coming to Madrid for a visit and the people were not too happy that public funds were being used to facilitate his stay. It was tough to get a cab driver to take us there and it was even tougher for said cab driver to drop us off fight in front of the entrance. It is about a 15 minute cab ride from the main train station where the bullet train arrives. It cost us about 11 euros. IT SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN THIS MUCH BUT UPON PAYING THE CAB DRIVER HIT US WITH SOME STRANGE TAX AND THEN POINTED TO SOME READING MATERIALS STICKERED TO THE WINDOW. When we walked into the hotel my girlfriend and I were surprised to see people past out on the sofas and chairs immediately to the right of the main entrance. There was a good mix of teenagers, adults and children. They were all completely slumped over catching zzz's. This was a bit strange because it was 2:00 p.m. in the afternoon on a Thursday. This gave the impression that we were staying in a flop house. We tried to ignore this and walked right up to the front desk to check in. This was pretty effortless and we were placed in a room on the first floor at the very end of the hall. The room looked very nice, but there was no windows and absolutely no sunlight or fresh air to allow in. The only thing we had a view of was some kind of stone quarry closet. Past this rock garden of sorts was another hotel room so we had to immediately close the blinds so that they could not see into out room and we in turn could not see into their quarters. It was a bit weird but it did not take away too much from the overall modernity of the room. The shower was powerful and the sink could switch between hot and cold water in a split second. Closet was see-through with a mini bar that came stacked with a nice assortment of booze and soft drinks. The television had a few English channels which is always appreciated. Bed was firm and comfortable. My only problem was with the hotel manager. We had a flight the next day and needed an early wake up call. We were staying in room #140 but the person taking down the information thought she heard room #114. We woke with a quickness the following morning and had to scrap showers in order to make it to the airport on time. This might not have been so rushed or stressful if there was a window or any sunlight to gauge the time of day. But again, we were oblivious to the conditions of the outside world because of the location of our room. Note to travelers, if asking for a wake up call, make sure you have them read the numbers back to you so you can eliminate any possible discrepancies. I can only imagine how pissed off the people in room #114 were when they got a call at 5:30 a.m. Other than that, the hotel is nice and in a good location. It is close to historic monuments, shopping, and quality tapas restaurants. I would stay again, but in a different room and only at the reduced rate we booked through the Travelzoo promotion. On a side note, we finished the free bottle of champagne without any hangover the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Hotel Regina”
Reviews.Author: Cre3pyTie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the superior room and it had everything one should expect. It was spacious, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Needless to say about the location: in front of a metro station and steps away from Puerta del Sol. Would like to highlight the bathroom, as it could remind me a 5-star hotel bathroom, with lots of nice amenities, 2 sinks, and a lovely bathub with a powerful shower. The front desk staff is friendly and willing to help. Check-in and check-out were fast. Trying the restaurant (Amayra) is also a good idea. The food is good and is not overpriced. The breakfast is also nice, but a little expensive.. (if you prefer there´s a great place called Faborit next door with lots of good breakfast options) The only complaint (which didnt disturb me from enjoying the hotel) was the room service. The maids sometimes seemed they were not in their best days...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good value”
Reviews.Author: CTTOURIST_11
Reviews.Content: Even without the summer promotion this hotel is a good value. The rooms (our family took 4) were clean, varied and up to date. The included breakfast was very good and ther staff were very helpful. The location was so good we walked everywhere. My only regret was that we could not stay more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jennylove34352
Reviews.Content: My friend was on business while I played tourist. I loved the location, it was just in old city. I believe we had a attic room with a comfy king bed and very spacious including the bathroom. We had a dinner in the restaurant where service was excellent. If you are looking for great comfort and you don´t want to afford a splurge in a super expensive 4 or 5 stars hotel, I recommend the Regina

Reviews.Title: “Superbly run with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: williamnash
Reviews.Content: The Regina is in a terrific location, and furnished in a quirky but warm style with lots of unique, interesting accessories in the rooms and public spaces. My room was a superior one, which was a single enormous room with a very large bathroom. The management and staff here are exceptional, among the very best I've ever experienced in the world. They're solicitous without being too formal, friendly without being obsequious, smart enough to figure out what you want quickly and get it done. I thought the buffet breakfast was terrific. You pay for all this, but I would gladly return

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ronald1978
Reviews.Content: I didn’t know what to expect from a 3 stars hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised. For such that grade hotel, it has plenty to offer, including a generous breakfast, free coffee to-go in the early mornings and free wifi, besides the hotel restaurant is great. To top it off, the service at this hotel is simply amazing. I felt as though the receptionists knew me! When I check out of hotels, I am typically asked how my stay was, and I customarily respond by saying that I had a nice stay; however, this time, I replied, “I had a wonderful stay, and I’m looking forward to staying here the next time I return to Madrid,” and I genuinely mean it! While the hotel is conveniently located at the Sevilla Metro stop, and in the Old City, there are many others restaurants options around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a trip to Madrid just for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: anbaker_11
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed in Madrid. A very chic and modern hotel, but at a bargain price 75 € a night including breakfast, bottle of CAVA (Spanish champagne) upon arrival, fresh fruit, water and free late check out till 2 P.M., on the weekend - I got that special promotion in the hotel website. The taxi ride from the airport was 30 Euros and the subway ride back was 2 Euros to the airport terminal 1 from the hotel. The subway system was a great way to get into the city proper or the central train station (Atocha) from the hotel at a minimum of effort and price. The room was superior in every way and the staff helpful. The restaurant was great at night and the location was fantastic. Makes a trip to Madrid worthwhile

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid and loved the Regina”
Reviews.Author: lastron
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. Clean, new, modern. Rooms are beautifully designed. Staff was incredibly friendly. The hotel bar seemed a little like an afterthought. Nonetheless, it's a comfortable and cozy place to grab a drink or two before or after dinner. We would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: robk57
Reviews.Content: One of the better hotel experiences we've had in a long time. This is a first class 3 *** hotel that makes your money worth. I hope they open many more around others European countries. Service, decor, service, food, amenities, did I mention service...anyway, thanks for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Trip with the boys”
Reviews.Author: redlac73
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with great service,location and standard.. The staff were friendly and helpful. Two party members requested a room with a window and this request was granted with no complaint or fuss, great service. To keep 11 men happy was a great achievement well done to all the staff. Hotel close to busy and vibrant area with great selections for food and drinking places.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Lies !!”
Reviews.Author: jonnyboy604
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this place was the location! Otherwise the service was terrible. i bought 4 nights off of a third party website that included wine upon arrival, fruit and water in our room every night and free breakfast buffet for me and my guest. However, when we got nothing of the sort. when we went to go get breakfast in the morning they charged us 15 euros each! i tried to explain to them that i had paid for it in my reservation and even showed them my booking confirmation but they would not have it. Besides poor service, When i asked for an extra towel they said sorry we dont have any extra towels!! really? a hotel with out towels? Look there are much better places in the area that are much nicer than this so if you want to make sure madrid is amazing stay away from here!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and fine.”
Reviews.Author: LaRu65
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a room for 4 is a challenge, this is how we ended up at the Hotel Regina. The room size was great, the beds firm which is a plus for me, on the full size beds the down body pillows are worth mentioning, the bathroom was a good size nice and clean. The location is central to everything a tourist will want to see and the metro is outside the front door. The Lobby is modern and clean but as you go up the stairs and into the room you can see it needs a face lift. The AC worked very well and was needed! Overall it is a fine hotel, it isn't great and isn't bad, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but no character”
Reviews.Author: catsinbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in July 2011. Unbeatable location. Efficient staffs. Judging from other reviews, this hotel has two completely different types of rooms - cool boutique hotel type and conventional big hotel type. I found the decor to be rather boring. Walls were very thin that I could hear conversations and tv noise from other rooms and the hallways (it is rather irritating if you are trying to sleep at 2am.) The lobby and the restaurant...I found it lacked in charm and character. I will stay at somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent rate direct on the hotel website. We were allocated a room at the back of the hotel overlooking what we thought was a quiet little tree lined street. We were woken the first night to garbage collectors. On this lane we discovered there are also government buildings and the rear of a casino. On the second night we were woken to the noise from what looked like a stage show packing up and using removal trucks - at 2am - from the casino. It went for over an hour and another guest was heard yelling from their room for the noise to stop. The third night there was some sort of protest going on outside our room and outside a government office. We actually live on a busy road and are used to noise but three nights of really interrupted sleep was too much. I spoke to a lovely lady on reception and explained my frustration and lack of sleep for three nights running. I understood that this noise was beyond their control. She could not have been more helpful. They moved us to an internal room and moved our luggage for us. When we returned from breakfast we just walked to our new room. So my tip is to avoid rooms at the rear of the hotel. Overall the rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The second room was refurbished and very modern. You cannot beat the location and the foyer is an oasis in the middle of the city. Hotel Regina will be my hotel of choice when I return to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Bianci31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and we had a great and spacious room on the frontside of the hotel. The price was also cheap, we had an offer, perfect and so close in the centre of Madrid. Beautifull city, recommend to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcgahat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend recently and here are our thoughts on the hotel. Arrival: We arrived early via the train. It seems to require two transfers from the airport which is a bit of a pain so the bus may be easier but the price was only 2 Euros. The Sevilla metro station is right in front of the hotel which is a big plus. We arrived early and there was no room available but they told us to come back and there should be one available soon and a couple of hours later it was. The room: We had a standard room and it was very basic. Bed with simple bedding, a desk with a 13" TV and about 2 feet of space on either side of the bed and a small closet but it did have a big safe in it for laptops etc. The bathroom was pretty good size considering the room being so small and it was average as well. There was only one electrical plug in the room that I could find which was a bit of a pain if you needed to charge or power multiple devices. Internet was free and pretty fast so that was a big plus. The rooms are noisy, you will hear everything going on in the hallways etc. If you are a light sleeper, may not be the place for you. Restaurant: The restuarant has two areas, the area they use for breakfast which is the nicer area towards the back of the hotel and the regular restaurant that is toward the front and accesible to the street. Breakfast which was included in our rate (21 Euros each if not) was actually pretty good but not over the top in its offerings but everything we had was fresh and taste good. We also ate at the regular restaurant for dinner once and it was ok but the food is just average but the service is good. Location: That is the huge plus to this property. It is right next to Puerto Del Sol and other popular tourist areas and you have the metro right at your door for other locations you need to go in the city. Overall, service was very good from everyone, the location was excellent but the room was very basic. I would try to get a superior room if you can as I believe those are upgraded and have newer furnishings etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LRGE
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice place to stay while in Madrid. The location is fantastic - walking distance to most of the sights of Madrid, and a subway stop on the corner for longer distances. Restaurants are plentiful in the area. Our room was clean, comfortable, and modern. My only complaint, and I actually found this was true of most service people in Spain, was that the persons working the front desk were less than friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: GipsieAndalouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything - great location, helpful staff, clean - but I had one complaint and it´s that my room did not have any windows. That is, there were 2 windows but they looked onto a light well in the middle of the building so it was impossible to get sufficient light and any air (most hotels in Spain seem to have windows that open and I missed that at this hotel). Otherwise it was beyond reproach, and it was particularly clean. If you´re looking for something quaint, however, try the Villa Real a few blocks away as this one is ultra-modern and sleek, with grey and white colours in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, clean and comfortable, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: bestlover
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a really good location. Terrific breakfast - bacon and sausage, scrambled egg and omelets, pastries and croissants. Staff friendly and helpful. Room not huge but spotless and comfortable. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would go back without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to explore Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Anya_Ukr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Regina for 3 nights in a single room during my 'tourist visit' to Madrid. The best thing about this hotel is its location - it is simply perfect if you came for attractions and sightseeing and movida. Hotel is located on one of the major avenues, literally few steps away from Puerta del Sol and walking distance from Placa de Cibelles (convenient if you use the A1 bus to/from airport). At the same time it feels like it's not in the heart of the crowd. Another unexpected and pleasant thing was an early check-in - I arrived around 10am and was expecting to wait until official 2 pm check-in, but my room was actually ready, which was very nice. Staff was ver friendly and helpful at all times. And of course it's a very attracting price/value ratio. The room itself was small (but fine for a solo traveller like myself), very clean and convenient. Bathroom looked recently renovated. However, other rooms (apparently, doubles and twins) on the same floor looked newer. Room had an aircon and a fridge (not very powerfull though), plus WiFi and satellite with a few channels in English (usual for Spain). The only downside was the quality of sleep/noise levels. Looks like single rooms in Regina are considered less important and therefore they face the inner yard with all the communications and aircon outlets. Consequently I got the typical noise 24/7. To be honest, I was really tired from sightseeing etc. and readily felt asleep with my earplugs on, but otherwise noise level would've been an issue. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as convenient in terms of both living and location.

Reviews.Title: “A special place, both people, as the hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfood
Reviews.Content: Situated close to some major attractions and the subway, this hotel makes life easier for tourists who want to move quickly and meet the largest possible number of attractions. The professional team is very efficient and friendly. Every time I needed support as logistical as with dinner reservations or concerts, we were very well attended. The decor is modern, the breakfast very good, no hype. My wife did not feel well during the night and needed a doctor, in less than 30 minutes they provided a service. We recommend this hotel for everybody who wants to be very well attended.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: looker704
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be small in size however the service and facilities are exceptional. The location to Puerta del Sol is less than two minutes walk. Nearby there are many high quality restaurants and bars. The rooms (Superiors) are extremely well appointed with all modern facilities and are kept spotlessly clean. The staff are very professional and helpful and willing to go out of their way to be of assistance. The buffet breakfast was also very good value

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: angel810
Reviews.Content: Average, but clean hotel with very pleasant staff, in excellent location, and about 1 minute from the train station. If you catch the train from the airport you will need to change trains twice and 2 of the stations only have stairs so it is difficult if you have luggage. The beds were a bit hard, rooms small and a little on the old side, but adequate for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: josieod
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Regina Hotel for 4 nights in July 2011. This hotel has a great location in the centre of madrid. Check-in staff very quick and efficient and requests made when booking were quickly dealt with. We had room 534 which had a nice balcony. This was our 2nd stay in the Regina, and we will book it agian for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a good value”
Reviews.Author: IrishAli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. The location is great and the breakfast was fabulous.....probably the best hotel breakfast that we had in a month of European travel! The value for the money was excellent and everyone at the hotel was so helpful. If we travel back to Madrid, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value”
Reviews.Author: MagnumSauna
Reviews.Content: Took their deal of about 110 euro if you stay two nights for a single. Great deal, great location. Room not big, but spacious enough (no view at such rate though). 100% clean, and as a I said, just can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific base in the centre, stayed there 3 times so far and will be back”
Reviews.Author: VMTraveller
Reviews.Content: The location is tremendous and everywhere is walkable : Sol 150 metres; Plaza Mayor 750m, Prado 1k, Reina Sofia 1.5K, Thysen 1K, best bar life in the known universe right around you. Hotel is about 25m from Sevilla Metro stop (about 45 mins in from the airport). Taxi from airport depends on the time of day but 20 mins or so if it's quiet. It's only a 3-star hotel nominally and the rooms can be dark (though excellent size), but, hey, they are very quiet and peaceful and how much time are you going to spend awake in them anyway? Breakfast is ok if not exciting, reception staff friendly and helpful, there is a pleasant bar, everything in the room works, especially the AC and the cleaning is fine. Come out of the front door, go straight ahead down to the Plaza de Canalejos (150m) and the extraordinary plethora of places to have a good time in Madrid opens out in all its glory. Try getting the Metro - 20 minutes or so - to Casa de Campo station and walking through 1900 hectares of forest (of the same name) before catching the telepherique back into town.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough for the staff”
Reviews.Author: lovely25251
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel and we were both so pleased with the people at the Regina Hotel. I, unfortunately, didn't retain any names but the two women working the desk and all of the gentlemen who greeted us as we came and went, helped with directions, and helped carry our luggage were so very nice. I've stayed at a number of hotels and have experienced a variety of different attitudes from their staffs, but I have to say this was about the best experience I've ever had. The hotel itself was very nice and so very convenient for our stay, but there are lots of hotels, it was the people that will bring me back and for which I will recommend the Regina. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: luky33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights from July 5th through July 10th, 2011. I was with my wife and two sons (ages 17 & 20), and we had two rooms. The average price was $155 per night per room. This included taxes and free internet. Just the price and the location made this hotel a good buy. However, it was also nicely appointed, the breakfast was good, and the staff was helpful. We were within easy walking distance of the museums, the Mayor Square and El Corte Ingles. We completely enjoyed our stay, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: maryme47
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent a long weekend in Madrid shopping, dining and seeing city views. This hotel was perfect. CLOSE to everything....we walked everywhere The hotel is very safe and the staff was lovely. The rooms were a nice size, not huge, but I doubt you'd want to spend much time in your room with everything so close by! Breakfast was simple, but abundant. Price is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cageben81
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Regina Hotel were great! The beds and pillows were amazingly comfortable. The decor is very nice, modern and really makes the place look like a 4 star hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. It was just a short walk to Royal Palace. I would definitely recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE ROOM - COZY RESTAURANT - FRINDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: lindass1988
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a business / personal trip to Madrid and are so grateful we stayed at the Regina. The staff is superb and went out of their way to make our stay special. They gave us advice of the key tourist hot spots to hit since we only had a few days in Madrid. They definitely take personal service to the next level. The hotel is super chic but always felt like home. We will definitely stay there whenever we go to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Best 3*** hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: tina1972
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. All the rooms are good but if you get the chance try the terrace ones, with the biggest bed in Madrid. The food is great and well presented. The lounge area is very relaxing and has an honesty bar which is useful. Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StephieGill
Reviews.Content: My father and I have been touring around Europe, and of all the places I've stayed (which are all within the same sort of price range) this is my favourite. It's in a brilliant location in Madrid, literally right next to a metro stop, the staff are very, very helpful. It's apparently rated three stars, but that's much lower than I'd give it myself! We really loved our stay. Also, a quick mention for Don Pelayo restaurant, which is a few metres down the street if you leave the hotel and turn left. Amazing food, fantastic service. Good wine, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: gilbertos303631
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina last june at a family room(2 adults and 2 kids),wich means a spacious room ,although simple,but very clean.The hotel is very close to "plaza porto del sol" (two blocks in a pedestrian area).Staff was ok,breakfest just averaje ,but there is a Starbucks just at the corner.Worth a 3 stars category.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: stregan
Reviews.Content: This place just continues to impress me - the front desk staff are some of the best I have ever come across - they always smile and look genuinely pleased to see you. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Madrid hotel with a superb restaurant”
Reviews.Author: lmerc71
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel and restaurant. All the staff, especially the Manager Carlos, were very friendly and helpful. He quickly realised that food was an important part of our trip and suggested some alternative restaurants to ones we had booked - all were excellent. Their own restaurant is superb. The food (tasting menu), service and wine were all excellent. Breakfasts were also great. Regina is in a perfect location. It is also close to a Metro stop and the hotel will order taxis for you. We stayed in a superior room, which was very comfortable. Although Regina is modern, form does not outweigh function. We would definitely recommend Regina to anybody staying in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: theking990099
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Regina provided my husband and me with an ideal stay in Madrid. From the room to the restaurant and the front desk, we highly recommend this hotel. We ate a great buffet breakfast each morning and we enjoyed a great dinner at Hotel Regina restaurant (Amayra) on our last night in the city. The meal was equal in its quality to the best restaurants in the city. Our room was quiet, immaculate. We stayed in an attic room with a huge terrace. It was an absolutely perfect place

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: arnoldla70
Reviews.Content: The staff were very warm, helpful and kind. We were fortunate enough to have available a room with a large terrace. The breakfast was excellent with a wide array of choices. I would return to Hotel Regina without hesitation. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay at...”
Reviews.Author: BarbReid
Reviews.Content: I was perfectly pleased with this hotel. Our room was big enough, and I'd consider it roomy as compered to other European hotels we stayed at. The staff were welcoming and spoke good English. The breakfast was delicious. It's in a great location, clean and the beds were very comfortable. If I had to make a complaint it would be that it would be good if we could've been warned about the free porn channels on the tv. Being from Australia, I hadn't expected that and it was embarrassing to be looking through channels with my teenage daughter and coming across porn stations. Also, it would be good if the cleaning staff could respect the 'do not disturb' sign. In fairness, that seemed common practice in a few hotels that cleaning staff knocked and still walked in with a 'do not disturb' sign on the door. I'd be very happy to stay there again, and to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific 3 stars hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucca9939
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in a superior room. Location is ideal, in the heart of the city. We arrived around 12 noon; reception was very friendly and welcoming. Our room was ready in 30 minutes which was early. Our bags were already in the room. The room was very spacious. Pictures of the room on hotel website are accurate. The restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced for Madrid. The lounge was relaxing and low key while we were there. There is free coffee and tea available in the lobby during the night. The front desk staff also was very helpful in making dinner reservation for us. Their choices of restaurants were excellent. We really felt very comfortable there because the staff were so friendly and helpful. In addition we ordered room service and food was delivered within 20 minutes. The room also came with free wireless internet which was quite fast. In summary, I have no negatives and will definitely stay there on our next trip to Madrid. It definitely lived up to our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - apart from them losing my credit card.”
Reviews.Author: dparry88
Reviews.Content: First i wanna start by saying i hate reading reviews where all people do is moan but i have to give my honest opinion. Pros: Central location close to the tourist bus which we spent 2 days seeing all the sights (i recommend) The breakfast selection my fiance loved trying something different everyday The hotel restaurant very relaxing lovely food helpful waiters/waitresses they couldnt do enough for us. The transfer taxi service from the hotel was cheap and time saving so thank you for that. Cons: I agree about the noise on previous reviews the maids had no concept of their own noise levels having screaming conversations outside my door at 7am didnt go down well On the first day was told by a receptionist we needed to give them a card (credit debit) for insurance we handed this over thinking it was the normal thing went to collect it on the final day and the colleague refused to acknowledge we had even given it to him and the best advice from him was just to "cancel it" no apology then he moved on from us to serve someone else? I would recommend this hotel again we had a fantastic time its just a shame we had to leave on a bad note but would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: louis2121
Reviews.Content: I was trying to find a nice hotel in Madrid that would have nice restaurant, not the typical. Hit the jackpot with this hotel. Quiet location near lots of restaurants choices and shopping with clean rooms and well appointed. Would definitely chose again the Regina hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Montanid
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better - just a few steps away from the Puerta del Sol in the center of Madrid. Otherwise, the room was a good value for the price with a friendly hotel staff who spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Perfect Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DoubleNJenn
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at the Hotel Regina for 7 nights. I saw so many excellent reviews and the price was really excellent, so being the American cynic that I am, was prepared to be disappointed. Well, I was not! The hotel was everything it was cracked up to be. The hotel is modern and very clean. The maid service is great. The hotel is right in front of the Seville Metro stop and next door to a Starbucks as well as a place called Faborit, which has smoothies and sandwiches. It is located on Alcala, which is approximately a 3 minute walk into the heart of Madrid, Puerta del Sol, where all the action is as well as another metro stop. We stayed in a double superior room. It was huge and even had a little enclosed balcony with a table and chairs. The bathroom was very nice also. A tip for the ladies (or men with long hair) they have a blowdryer but it is very old and weak, so it is better to pack your own travel blowdryer and bring an outlet converter. The hotel has 2 computers you can use with internet. It costs 3 Euros for 15 minutes. You can buy more time for more euros, but honestly I would sneak over to the faborit and hop onto the internet for free. Bring ear plugs because people have a tendency to slam the doors for some reason. Other than that, everything was great. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location and a breeze to get to from the airport”
Reviews.Author: smithley
Reviews.Content: Our one night at the Hotel Regina was just what we wanted for an overnight in Madrid. After 2 weeks in quaintly-wonderful European hotel rooms, the Regina offered a nice bit of luxury, especially with its grand bathroom. We had a brisk check-in and even received extra assistance in printing off our boarding passes for the next day. The location is terrific - walking distance to the Prado or Plaza Mayor and other sights. Their breakfast buffet is quite pricey - I'd look for something outside the hotel. Best of all was the trip to and from the airport. We arrived at Terminal 4 and caught the bright yellow Express Aeropuerto EMT bus to Cibeles. From there it was about a 4 block walk to the hotel. We took the same transport back the next day. Since the buses run every 15 minutes, you won't have to worry about catching one and if one is too full, you could even just wait for the next one. Best of all - the price - only 2 euros per person per trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, exterior rooms are very nice, not happy about reception”
Reviews.Author: Malaga.Spain
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in this hotel but my last visit has been that, "my last". LOCATION The hotel has a fantastic location, in front of Sevilla Tube station, 3 minutes walk to Sol and Gran Via, main center areas of Madrid. There is a Vips Restaurant and a Starbucks next door, one of the main Theatres "Alcala" right in front of the hotel. If you go to Madrid for business or pleasure it´s the best location for both. There are taxis outside the hotel and bus stop too. ROOMS I prevously had stayed in this hotel and I was given very nice rooms, when you stay make sure they are exteriors. This time they gave me an interior single room, I had to complain to get a change. They have refurbished all the rooms and decoration is nice but the single ones are very small and that kind of hotel can not affors have clients staying there (nº 126 so small and so dark). Luckily I got a double room on the first floor looking towards the back street, not fantastic but it was ok. I highly recommend to ask for a exterior room overlooking the main street. RESTAURANTS The Buffet Breakfast is very good, no plenty of choice but high quality food. The waiters are very helpful. There is a Bar with a nice wine selection and daily menu. STAFF This is an issue. The guy who picks your luggage is very nice, cleaners are very attentive, waiters fantastic... What a shame about recepcionists! And this is the most important about a hotel. As I mentioned during the past years I have stayed in Regina so I expected to be treated at least in a nice way.
