First they gave me an interior single room on the first floor, after complaining I had to wait for 10-15 minutes until the recepcionist found a room for me. He wasn´t helpful and was treating me as if he was making me a big favour because he was going to change my room. I didn´t felt welcome, all the opposite, I felt very upset and he made me feel very unconfortable. This is a big difference from my pasts visits. The new room he gave me was on the 1st floor overlooking the back street and next to the cleaning room what meant I had a very noisy stay in the hotel. I can not belive he treated me that way and I told him I was a previous guest and I said I would like to have a room overlooking Alcala street (it was only for 1 night, so not so complicated). I feel very dissapointed and next time I will stay in different options like Petit Palace or Senator where reception staff make you fell welcome.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TwoGoodFriends
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel we stayed at three times over a four week perid for a total of 8 nights. Friendly staff, clean, comfortable rooms, excellent location beside Seville metro and a few minutes walk to Sol. Great value. We had need of urgent dental assistance and concierge was so helpful in finding an English speaking dentist. Highlly recommend this hotel. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wind41
Reviews.Content: Very convenient arrangement of hotel, in the street Alkala, some steps to street Gran Via and about 15-20 minutes to a palace on foot, 5-10 minutes to park Retiro and Prado museum, 25-30 minutes to station Atocha. Rooms open a plastic electronic key. In a lobby, opposite reception there is a restaurant working late. A breakfast from 7:30 till 10:30, a buffet. Room not so big. For two person a little closely to place suitcases. A bed big. The modest TV. The shower is united with a toilet. Room clean every day. The personnel part speaks a little in English.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Spain. We stayed at the Hotel Regina for the first two nights prior to a cruise and visit to Majorica. We booked a quad room for the two nights. The lobby and common areas were a little worn but the room was spacious, newly remodelled, clean, with a great bathroom. The location cannot be beat and was convenient walking distance to many attractions and to catch the hop on/hop off bus. Greate little coffee shop next door to catch a quick morning bite and a Starbucks for the coffee fix steps away. We had a slight problem with our AC the first day and found the staff friendly and responsive to correct the situation. We were able to access free WIFI without an issue from our room. I would definately recommend to any first time Madrid visitor especially with a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: jamie079
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great, which was the reason I initially picked it. However, the rooms were tiny and so were the beds. The walls between the rooms were very thin - you could hear everything in the next room and also in the hallways. The maids started cleaning the rooms at 7:30 a.m on Monday morning, which was extremely noisy. The cafe served below average food and not worth the cost - you're better off going somewhere outside the hotel. Unfortunately I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Godsend!”
Reviews.Author: Vivian2262
Reviews.Content: After a horrible experience at the Hostal Alcazar Regis (avoid this place at all costs), Hotel Regina was a godsend. Very reasonable and staff was very accomodating! Would stay there again in a heartbeat. Internet only worked in lobby...only negative. But it was FREE!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: alcalaviajero2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located with easy access to the metro station and a few blocks from Puerta del Sol; restaurants and tapas bars. In addition to be very well decorated and confortable, it has its own cafeteria and restaurant inside. There is an underground parking right at the door. But the best thing we found was the personnel in all areas, very friendly and helpful. They made our vacation in Madrid perfect and the prices were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “very highly reccomended”
Reviews.Author: mightymars_man
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at hotel regina in late june 2011 and it has been a wonderful experience The location is very central, literally steps away from sevilla metro, and within a 5 minute walk to the peurta del sol. Its a very modern clean hotel which has great standards. It has free wifi in the hotel which is great when travelling around europe, the double glaze windows block out any sounds, and the value for money is extraordinary Most of all, it has a great in house restaurant which has beautiful food at a very reasonable price, dont bother about chasing the tourist traps around the sol for food,stay in house and enjoy the experience. I know if I was coming back to Madrid i would have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: gazzerooni
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing all the reviews on TA. I visited Madrid 7 years ago and we were quite a bit away from all the sights so this time I wanted something central. The Regina is very central indeed and in the four days we spent in Madrid, we were able to walk everywhere easily. We didnt take a bus, metro or taxi once apart from getting to and from the airport. Our room was 438 I think so it was situated at the back of the hotel on the fourth floor. There was some street noise from people and bins being collected in the early morning hours which was surprisingly loud considering we were on the fourth floor. Bring ear-plugs if you are a light sleeper. The room itself was spotless and modern. The bathroom was very clean and came with toiletries. The shower itself was very good too with plenty of hot water and great pressure. I thought the bed was very comfortable and I slept very well. The only thing I didnt like about the room was that the window was quite low in the wall which made the room feel dark and the bathroom door was only a frosted glass sheet and didnt lock- you would want to know your room mate well! The staff on reception were friendly and helpful and all seemed to speak great English. There is a restaurant which looked good in the lobby. We didnt eat there as breakfast was €15 per person which was more than we wanted to spend. We did have a beer and tapas in the cafe at the front of the lobby when it rained heavily one evening and it was good. The location of the Regina is perfect and a major selling point for me. We were able to walk to the museums-Thyssen, Prado and Reina Sophia- in 10-15 minutes. The Puerto del Sol is only a 5 minute walk the other way, with the Royal Palace and the Plaza mayor only a few minutes past that. The Gran Via is around the corner- you will find El Corte Ingles as well as Zara and H&M etc. The Chueca district is behind the Gran Via with plenty of dining and drinking options as well as many boutiques and small interesting shops. This is also the center of Gay Life in Madrid so we ended up here most nights. It was handy only having a short walk back to the hotel at the end of the night. I would recommend Cafe Oliver which is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel for food- we ate there one rainy night and it was lovely. We also tried the Wok which had a few branches in Madrid- the warm duck salad was great. We booked the Regina through booking.com and got a great deal for €370 for 4 nights for the two of us. I think this was great value for money. I am not sure I would be happy paying over €500 though so do look around. We were going to take the metro to the hotel from the airport but we would have had to change trains twice. In the end, we took the airport express bus from the airport and got off at Plaza Cibeles. It was literally a straight walk up from there to the hotel- about 6-8 minutes. There are loads of taxis passing if you decide you want to get a ride to the hotel from the plaza. It represents excellent value for money as it only costs €2 per person from the airport. needless to say, we also got the bus back - it was so easy.

Reviews.Title: “goog located”
Reviews.Author: rodrigo51
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and good location, near to puerta del sol and el Prado museum.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: flausa941
Reviews.Content: The rooms were well appointed and clean. Front desk staff were always pleasant and helpful. We had a room on a major throughfare which was quite noisy. The next morning the staff gladly offer to change our rooms and the remaining stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jaclynt
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. The location cannot be beat; we were within walking distance from just about everything in central Madrid, and if we got too tired to walk, a metro station is a couple feet away. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially when the airline delayed one of our bags. The WiFi is also worth a mention...we wanted to upload our photos online each day and I could not believe how fast the connection was. The room itself was quiet and neat--very modern, we enjoyed the radio! If we travel to Madrid again, we'll definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5Travellers1263
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to other TripAdvisor comments about the location. It is perfectly situated in Madrid close to the Metro, tourist attractions and restuarants. It was so extremely convenient that we walked everywhere with our three children, ages 11, 9 and 8. The hotel was clean and the staff members were very helpful. We had to book two rooms as is typical in Europe, but we were all quite comfortable. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Torrz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Regina in August 2010, The location was great, just around the courner to the main square. When we looked on the website the pictures of the rooms looked like they had been renovated. When we got to the Hotel its was really nice, but when we got to our room the picture looked nothing like our room.It was clean but not new, but overall it was nice staying there. The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly, it was good for the value.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite”
Reviews.Author: andimc101
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Regina Hotel and is really happy that I choose to stay at the hotel. From the moment I arrived to the departure I was treated in a nice friendly way from all the staff members. Check-in was smooth. The location of the hotel couldn´t be better. The rooms are well equipped. Complementary night coffee in the lobby and free wi-fi in the hotel which is great, it can otherwise be very expensive in others hotels. I will definitely return to the hotel. I have a new favorite hotel when I am in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice of Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Sstone99
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week at the Regina hotel where we celebrated our silver wedding anniversary. I would give this hotel 10 out of 10 for everything! The hotel was beautiful; the room we stayed in was spotless and very well furnished. They had a free wi-fi and there were toiletries in the bathroom which were replaced every day if you used them. The breakfast was excellent and there was everything you could possibly want. The restaurant is a great place where they serve fantastic food as well as great wines. The staff are all lovely, everyone was so friendly and helpful. The Regina is a very central hotel near to most attractions. The hotel was a bit more expensive than we usually stay at but it was so worth it. If we go back to Madrid we would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “just about right”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler17
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 4 nights. The location was great just in the middle of historic center. Hotel was very clean and all functions worked properly. The bath room was spacious with granites all over. The rate was also great. I would definitely recommend this place and I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Here4Holidays
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous reviews on the Hotel Regina's great location, cleanliness, friendly staff and decent (not fantastic) buffet breakfast. We stayed in the newer part of the hotel - room 336 - which is so new some things aren't quite finished (flat-screen TV has a spot on the wall but is not hung there yet, etc.). Overall the room and fittings are very sleek, maybe a bit minimalistic but still nice. The 2 big windows opening to the tree-lined street in back are also pleasant. That tree-lined street got quite noisy Friday/Saturday night between midnight and 3am. Even with the windows closed and the sun blinds pulled down you could still hear the goings-on down there. I'm a city dweller so managed to sleep through it, but others might find it too much. While the hotel can't do much about the street, they could install damping door closers on the rooms. With all that tile in the hallways when ignorant guests slam their doors it's like a gun-shot through the whole floor. Woke me up a few times! Finally, suggest you skip the boring chain stores on the Gran Via and check out the more interesting ones in nearby Chueca. Also stroll through the huge Parque del Buen Retiro - a lovely retreat from the midday sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: pauvs
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Europe my husband and I stayed at the Regina hotel in Madrid. It was our first stop in Europe and we weren't sure what to expect. We were thrilled with the choice we made for this hotel. The location is great; very easy walking distance to the Prado, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Major and Royal Palace. The staff was very friendly and helpful - Ricardo was exceptional. Our buffet breakfast was more than we expected. The room was small but very clean and up to date. Great hotel - we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: san210172
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our recent night's stay at this hotel. It is a very good location for walking from the many of the special sites of the city. The staff were very friendly and efficient, plus helpful when required. The buffet breakfast was very substantial. The dining lounge and bar was quite nice to go and enjoy a drink and those people who were dining looked like they were being served some delicious food. When we return, we will definitely try this dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: slaty56
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina was a wonderful place for our first visit to Madrid. We are a family of 4 adults, so we stayed in the large family room, which worked out really well. The airlines lost my husband's luggage. The hotel staff were so helpful in tracking our luggage. Carlos and his staff were always friendly and helpful, and provided good suggestions for transportation and attractions. The hotel was very convenient to numerous restaurants, many shops, and of course, the Puerta del Sol. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: etmorg
Reviews.Content: After looking at numerous hotels in Madrid, we chose Hotel Regina as from it's website - looked to be comfortable, tastefully decorated and from the reviews the staff accommodating. We found the rooms of comfortable size considering most Europe hotel rooms are said to be small The hotel certainly did not disappoint, it is beautifully decorated and immaculately clean. The rooms were cleaned every day to a very high standard and towels were changed on a daily basis. The hotel staff could not do enough for you. Some tripadvisor reports have said they were disappointed in the breakfast - but, however, we find this hard to believe.... There were cereals, fresh fruit, fresh meats and cheeses, eggs, yoghurt's, selection of bread and pastries, juices... and other cooked items on request. Considering this is a buffet style breakfast for 15 euros, I feel this is incredibly worth every penny If truth be told, I am an extremely fussy traveler, who expects good value for money, clean and comfortable accommodation and a good standard of food. This hotel does not disappoint. All staff are extremely friendly and happy to help with any requests that you may have. We will definitely return on our next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ButBeuatiful
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is ideal for visiting museums and experiencing other cultural activities in Madrid. It is a bit worn in some areas. When staying here, be sure to stay in the newly renovated section. The restaurant is quite good and so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best 3 stars hotel at Madrid”
Reviews.Author: riky88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 5 days at the Regina. We chose this hotel as it has rated number ten on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. The location was perfect and the buffet breakfast was great. The room was comfortable, we upgrated and had a room with terrace, where we enjoyed of a lovely dinner with an exellent room service. Pricewise, it wasn´t cheap but it was Madrid center and all the extras made it good value for money. We will certainly return and wpild recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, old and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoOSUBeavs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. The rooms are fairly large but very old. The walls are not well insulated; you will hear everything happening in other rooms and other floors, and vice versa. The TV was an old tiny CRT with a poor signal connection. Perhaps the most disappointing part was the blow drier. Not only did it not work, it had a very strong smell of cigarettes, causing your semi-dried hair to also have that smell. We also discovered cigarette ashes on the windowsill after the room was cleaned, leading me to believe that the maid was smoking in the room. Location is perfect; the Metro station is literally right outside the front door. Staff speaks decent English, but not excellent by any stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: BonToronto
Reviews.Content: Very central and convenient location is true with the trade off of great noises. We spent a week there on the second floor in a small but acceptable room. The wall has no insulation so when one night the neighbour came back after mid night around 2:00 am, we heard them talking loud in Spanish, and TV was on. The noises were like from the same room. No way for even the great sleeper to sleep. We went for a bus trip and came back for one night before board the plane. We were given a corner room on the first floor facing the road. The room was bigger and nicer. However, over the night, we heard this big banging noise from a truck picking up garbage bins right under our window. There must be 50 or more garage bins to be picked up by that truck. We couldn't sleep the whole night. We were so exhausted to catch up an earlier plane next day. Although we complained at check-out, we simply received a "sorry" and an explanation that those were not this hotel's garbage bins. The receptionist should have told us the noise when he gave us the room. I believe they knew it. We wouldn't be the first to complain this unbearable noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: conFuSed79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and my sister over the bank holiday weekend. The location of the hotel is excellent; a stone throw's away from the El Corte Ingles as well as the metro stops. Very central! Service was good in the little cafe the hotel has downstairs, pretty good coffee. Rooms were clean and a good size (I had a triple room) with quite a spacious shower. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend for families w/kids, horrible room.”
Reviews.Author: NG_2007
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely accommodating of our early check in request - I really appreciated this. We booked a quadruple room for 2 adults and 2 small children. It was advertised as a family room that accommodates 4 people, that two of the beds are roll away is not mentioned. You walk in to a dark small room with two roll away beds, and then to a second room, with a closet and desk. The rooms were dark, with ragged brown curtains, a threadbare rug, a dented desk, and other shabby fittings. The room smelt of mold, which is not surprising given the rotting floorboards, rotting wooden window frames, peeling paint, ancient bathroom, and overall shabbiness. The bathroom needs renovation with loose tiles and shoddy fittings. The furniture was dented, floors badly scratched, and one wall had a big crack near the window with a chunk of plaster missing. The room was depressing, dark, and dirty. We moved to another hotel the second night as they could not find us another room. But, we are grateful to the staff who accommodated our request to cancel our reservation for the 2nd night, even though we checked out very late.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hedonista1951
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the centre of Madrid, worth more then just 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: BudaSorridente
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, staff helpful and courteous. Near the metro, restaurants, museums.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ErikogMonica
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, walking distance to all the "barrios". We had a beautyful room with a big private terrace. Great and helpful staff. We will definitely come back next time we're in Madrid, and there will be a next time!!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JTJD
Reviews.Content: Just home from a weeks stay at this hotel and we were delighted with every aspect of the hotel, service & the staff. It's location was perfect, very central, with easy access to all the central sights & shop/restaurants. The Sevilla Metro stop is right outside the hotel. The staff were very efficient, professional, yet friendly & helpful. Our ultra stylish superior room was spotlessly clean & well serviced with fresh towels & toiletries replaced on a daily basis. The shower was very efficient, room safe easy to use, AC efficient & the general standard of the room was closer to 4* than the current official 3* rating. Just be aware that the hotel corridors are not fully carpeted so there can be some noise from people walking/entering/exiting other rooms. Can highly recommend this hotel to other travellers & we wouldn't hesitate to return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “good position”
Reviews.Author: jamesosborne
Reviews.Content: Very noisy but in centre of city so has to be expected. No bath rooms very clean only 2 English TV channels and with English tourist I would have expected more, but Spanish are not know for being English friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel,cityside.”
Reviews.Author: Travlalu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina was the first hotel we stayed in during our Spain trip and it set the standard for us.Amongst the four it was definitely the best.We caught the airport bus and it dropped us off at Cibeles; from there it was just a ten minute walk up to the hotel.Hotel Regina is in a smart part of the town, mixing company with museums,good restaurants and city of Madrid buildings.Our hotel room was very attractive with a wooden parquet floor and floor to ceiling windows which looked out onto a cityscape filled with antique buildings,sculptures and Madrilenos going about their business.The window was insulated so once closed the room was quiet. The room itself was well laid out with neat black and white accented furnishings and a clean,white marble bathroom . The hotel staff were very professional and the concierge was always on hand to greet and assist when needed.The foyer downstairs was very elegant with artwork in the lounge area and a chic restaurant and cafe which were frequented by the locals as well as the hotel guests.Breakfast was not included with our stay but you could dine in the cafe if needed .We found it more economical to step outside the hotel as there were so many eating options close by.One of our favorites was Faborit, which sold great fresh juices,coffee and pastries.Another was Vips which is a chain restaurant selling reasonable good local food like rolls with Iberico ham and chocolate with churros as well as American style breakfasts with eggs,pancakes,bacon etc.. Walk out onto the cobbled streets outside the hotel in any direction you choose and you won't be disappointed. The subway station Sevilla is outside the front door and several buses are across the road.The famous Puerta del Sol square packed with shop after shop,the historic district with Plaza Mayor and numerous other places of interest are just a few blocks away.Two of Madrid's famous art museums the Prado and the Thyssen are about twenty minutes walk away.Any style of cafe,restaurant,bar or hole in the wall eating joint you will find around the Hotel Regina,including the beloved Jamon delis. Most of the places are open late into the night-the city is always buzzing. We had a thoroughly good time here and would definitely recommend the Hotel Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: tiggerwoods
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid to watch the tennis at the Magic Box. The hotel is in a great location to get to the all of the major places of interest and near to two metro stations. Our room was a good size, clean, with sufficient storage space and a free safety deposit box. Wifi is free but you do need to get the code from reception. We didn't eat at the hotel but there are plenty of places nearby. We liked La Chulapa and San Gines. The room was less than 100 euros per night and we felt good value being in the centre of Madrid. Retiro, Cibeles, Royal Palace, Puerta del Sol, Plaza España are all walkable from the Regina. There was a bit of noise from an adjacent room but that was not the hotels fault and we heard no noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that's far better than its star rating”
Reviews.Author: SaxSymbol73
Reviews.Content: Note: This is a copy of a review I've also posted on Expedia. This was a wonderful hotel. The room was in the newer, rear section of the hotel and was very modern, clean and quiet. The hotel could not be better situated to access the city. It is nearly directly above the Seville metro station, and is approximately a 10 minute walk to the Prado and Botantical Garden. It is also 300 meters from the Puerta del Sol (and the Sol metro station). For being so well-situated, it is set back from the main street on a bit of a quiet side street, making it feel less hectic and busy than other hotels in the neighborhood. My only quibble (very slight) was the rather tatty carpeting on the lobby stairs. It was old, torn, and shabby looking, and was definitely an outlier for an otherwise fantastic hotel. When I return to Madrid I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: CaroleO
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina is a very good hotel. The location is especially useful - just by the metro stop Sevilla and right in the heart of everything. Our room (212) was very spacious for two people - two huge beds and lovely bathroom with an excellent shower. As others have commented, the walls are thin but this is common in many hotels. The free wifi is worth the price of the room alone - very strong signal and fast connection. As others have said, the hotel is really clean. There are always staff hoovering, cleaning and polishing the public areas. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment on the food. The hotel staff are nice and friendly and all are very well dressed and look professional. All seem very conscious of trying to improve their guests' experience. It definitely feels more like a 4 star hotel than a 3 star. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Many Good Choices in the Area”
Reviews.Author: withliberty
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on a combination of location and price and was not disappointed. The front desk staff was always helpful and spoke enough English to help me out. Not much to report on the actual accomodations and I never ate at the hotel. Free wi-fi worked perfect. The location is truly unbeatable. It's far enough away from the noise of Sol Plaza, but close enough to walk to everything (Prado, etc.). A quick note on getting here: I booked Aerocity, which was a huge mistake. Shuttle was 45 minutes late and then took another 45 minutes to get me to the hotel, when it should have been no more than 30 minutes taking a taxi. I do not recommend the Metro/Sevilla station unless you are familiar with the subway system here because you need to take several transfers (pain in the butt with luggage). Best budget bet is to take the Express Bus to Plaza de Cibeles (2 Euro). Hotel Regina is then a very short taxi ride away (or walk straight uphill and hotel is two long city blocks away on your right hand side). My room was fine (401), but was located away from the noisier parts of the hotel. Since there is no soundproofing on the doors, you will hear EVERYTHING that happens in the hallway and I was able to clearly hear a conversation in the next room. The bed was the squeakiest bed I have ever slept on... but, it was a comfortable night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: aufidia
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and the staff were so friendly and helpful, would recommend this hotel to everyone.The breakfast was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great shower pressure.....and thats about it.”
Reviews.Author: Hundleychick
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this hotel got to be so highly rated on Trip Advisor. They proudly display Trip Advisor's 4 circle rating at the front desk--and I wanted to take the plaque and throw it on the floor. Pros: Fabulous location--literally step outside the door to the Sevilla stop on the very reliable Metro, free Wi-Fi, and as mentioned in my title--i have never been in a European hotel with such amazing water pressure in the bathroom. Cons: Everything else. The room was dated and had NONE of the necessities...ie. windows, alarm clocks, a hair dryer from this century, a chair, or decent closet space to put your things in. If you choose to stay here DEMAND that you get a renovated (or spring for the "superior") room b/c the rooms on their website look NOTHING like what we ended up in. The breakfast is a ripoff at 15 euro per person, per day! There is a Starbucks right on the next corner with much better fare for less money. And be careful with your bill--they tried to double charge us for said crappy breakfast upon checkout. Good thing we had brought along the printout from the booking which clearly stated the price we were quoted already had the ripoff breakfast factored in. Overall, I would not say that the hotel is dirty or horrible in that sense, but for the extremely high price we paid, the room was VERY inferior. With all the hotels in Madrid, you would be better off looking elsewhere. The room was worth maybe 79 euro a night, AT BEST. (And just b/c of location!)

Reviews.Title: “We would come again”
Reviews.Author: Elke_on_tour Posted by a clever-hotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very closed to Plaza del Sol, Subway Station in front of the entrance, Starbucks 50 mtrs. We stayed at the 5th floor and had a room with a privat terrace to enyoj every evening after Sightseeing our cold drinks from the fridge. The room was spacious, super clean and modern. Two pillows per person und and a very helpfull staff - a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Volleydentist
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel Regina. We arrived at 2:30 PM on a Sunday. Immediately they found my reservation that I had made via email. I got everything that I had requested, we got room 239. It is in the back of the hotel, I don't care about the view since I'm only there for sleeping and showering! Very clean and modern, has an elevator, free Wi-Fi and an amazing shower! The air conditioner worked for us, so I don't know if maybe people didn't know how to work it. We requested our room to be clean every day and they did a great job. The location of the hotel is perfect. Close to everything, Plaza del Sol, Plaza Santa Ana, la Gran Via many restaurants, pastry and coffee shops (like Farabit which is the Spanish version of Starbucks) and if you prefer not to walk you can get on the Metro that is just steps from the hotel door. If you want to get beer for 2.50 Euros go to Nueva Galicia also very close to the hotel and where all the locals hang out. Loved it!!! Over all, I will definitely stay here again. Specially because of its cleanliness, location and value. Madrid is amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: lovedarain
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel could not have been more perfect! It's very close to the Puerto del Sol which a lot of other things can be found off of. I can't say enough about the location of this hotel and the proximity to attractions. We enjoy walking so we didn't even bother to take public transportation that happens to be right outside the hotel. The staff was nice and helpful, the rooms were clean and cute. As I believe other travelers have mentioned there was no air conditioning because although it was hotter than normal it hadn't been hot long enough for them to turn it on. I asked at the desk about having it turned on and was told it was impossible. Another issue was that there is no sound proofing, so when a bunch of girls came home at 5am, very drunk and loud; the entire floor heard it. If/when I go back to Madrid, I will stay at this hotel again. Another thing to note, separate from the hotel; we did a tapas tour that met at the statue in the Puerto del Sol our first night in Madrid. This was the best thing we could have done to acquaint ourselves with Madrid, I highly recommend it...adventurousappetites.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: katerinaAthens
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say that Madrid is a wonderfull city very vibrant...As others have mentioned nothing really starts before 11, or 12 at night.... 1. Location. Excellent elegant hotel in the best location. Located just outside metro station Sevilla. Very easy access from the airport with the metro. You simply take line 8 Aeropuerto to Columbia station and there change for line 9 to Principe Vergara and the last change line 2 to Sevilla. Then you get off and you will see the entrance of the hotel. The street is very nice and the neighbourhood is very lively..Puerta del Sol, GRan Via and Plaza Mayor is steps from the hotel, in about 10 minutes walk you will be at most of them. 2. Rooms. At first because we had asked for a quiet room, they gave us one in the opposite of the hotel but we didnt like it much. It was like a tiny box, clean but nothing more nothing less...We stepped down immediately and complained for the room that didn't seem to be double (no way), and they immediately changed us with a better one more comfortable and much nicer at the front of the hotel..Just have in mind that Madrid is very noisy city and outside of the hotel the hotel all day and all night you may hear voices, people dancing and singing in the street. So if you want a nice room with Madrid's view but quiet too, just ask to be in the front of the hotel but on the upper floors, not in the first one.... 3. The restaurant of the hotel is very nice and with good prices and offers...We had a full dinner with a bottle of wine and desert for two people in 50 euros (an excellent dinner). 4. All that I missed from this hotel was that the personnel of the hotel in the reception was always too busy to bother with you.If you should ask them a question then you should patiently wait for their answer but without a smile on their faces...Too tired to help you, maybe...That was the impression given to me...Maybe they werent in their best mood, I don't know...They werent very friendly... 5. Madrid is a very beautifull city, if it was a woman, it was centainly be a spanish femme fatale, and if it was a colour thta should be definitely Red...Very vibrant. Puerta del sol, Plaza Mayor my favourite...Retiro park with the lake, The Palazio Real, the museums, but most of all the city itsself, with excellent buildings all over. 6. Lots of choises around the hotel to eat, drink etc. Just 200 m. from the hotel across the road, you will see plenty of bars, tapas bars to drink your mohito or shangria...Latina also was an excellent choise to eat and drink.... Just next to the hotel was starbaks and another coffee shop and next to the road it was an excellent after to eat, I just dont remember the name... 7. Toledo, is a must see....You don't leave Madrid without visiting Toledo the city of El Greco. All in all Madrid made me feel alive again, I felt in love again....It was an excellent trip I will remember for ever... Katerina, Athens

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel- near Grand Via, Plaza Mayor, subway, etc...”
Reviews.Author: ACCC527
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Madrid, and our stay at Hotel Regina made it that much better. The room was small, but that was expected. We could have upgraded, but we were thoroughly satisfied with our room. The bathroom and the room were very clean when we arrived and their service was top notch. The front desk staff were informative and patient with us as we asked numerous requests and questions. In fact, after an eight hour flight from NYC we arrived at the hotel at 11am. The check in wasn't until 2 or 3pm, but the hotel accommodated us and allowed us to check in early. They went beyond what was expected and delivered with ease. The hotel is walking distance from many attractions, eateries and subway stops. We highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, too warm”
Reviews.Author: TravelLady511
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this hotel is probably the best location from which to see Madrid. The subway stop is literally 12 steps away from the front door. Puerto del Sol. El Corte Ingles, and Plaza Mayor are an easy walk away and the Prado and Reina Sofia museums are also within walking distance. The morning breakfast buffets were beautifully laid out with lots of options and the wait staff at breakfast and in the bar were friendly and prompt. My bed was comfortable and my bath was well-appointed - actually much nicer than my home bath. I saw no insects and no mold/mildew. Everything in the room worked. Some writiers complain of noise but, although I heard workers working and chatting in the airshaft below me at night, it wasn't for very long and I always bring earplugs when I travel just in case. However, my room was very, very hot due to unusually warm weather and the hotel's refusal to turn on the air conditioning. Opening my room's (Room 228) window to the airshaft provided little relief and, in fact, made conditions worse because my room was over the kitchen exhaust fan. As a result, with the windows open in the morning my room smelled of greasy cooked mammal flesh and in the evening up return it smelled more strongly of cooked mammal flesh except garlic was added to the aroma. One of my travel mates was in the room across the hall so on our second day of hot rooms we opened both our room doors plus the hallway window and finally got some relief but, of course, couldn't keep the doors open overnight. Oddly, the hallways were about 10 degrees F cooler and the breakfast area had a very comfortable temperature. I understand that everyone does things differently but even the cheapest hotel room in the USA has room specific HVAC units. I cannot understand why any 4-star hotel anywhere can't provide comfortable temperatures. Would I stay here again? Yes, everything was wonderful except the temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, position and service”
Reviews.Author: Megan1302
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic central position, the staff were very helpful and the hotel bedrooms, and general areas were always clean. The only downside was that there is no air conditioning between October and April, the weather was unusually hot and our room was very uncomfortable. The hotel provided a fan immediately when we asked about aircon but it was really not quite enough. I would really recommend this hotel other than this concern.Our room was on the inside so not aware of traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “My first choice in Madrid for hotels”
Reviews.Author: CamMcK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times now while I have been on business in Madrid and it's the only place I will stay. It's clean, perfectly positioned in down town Madrid and right on the Metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: FSU2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed staying in the Regina Hotel, March 26-27, 2011, a four star at least. Our standard room (paid with rewards points) was like a suite, spacious and very clean, with a large modern bathroom. The very helpful staff spoke English, and the breakfast (included in our res. was fantastic). It's located within easy walking distance of Plazas Sol and Mayor, the Naval, Thyessen, and Prado Museums, and the "Seville" Metro station is right outside the front door -- one can take it for two euros to Barajas airport (rather than a $55 taxi ride). The Metros are easy to understand and cleaner than those in Paris. Regina is on a main boulevard; no dumpy side street. We'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyUSA
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in Madrid before we headed south. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and quiet. The front desk staff was friendly enough, but they were not helpful about where to eat or where to buy train tickets. So do your own research.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: SaucyMonkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of everything! The hotel itself has an upscale look. Our hotel room was very nice. It was clean, modern and the bathroom had 2 sinks. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bullwolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good all the staff are very efficient and extremely friendly.The hotel is kept spotlessly clean and the rooms are excellent.Had breakfast from the 16 March on our 4 day break all the variety you could want and good value. The location could not be better for all the sights and the metro is just outside the front doors. Great places to eat in the area. We are looking forward to visiting Madrid again and staying at the Regina

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel in outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Nigel-Pauline
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Regina from March 16th 2011 for six nights. We'd booked one of the better quality rooms as some reviews said the rooms could be noisy. We had no problems with noise and the room was very comfortable and well equipped. One major plus for the hotel was the level of cleanliness throughout and this was obviously seen as a priority by all the staff. The level of cleanliness we observed was as good as we've seen anywhere and as both my wife and I have in the past been hygiene auditors in the food industry it's something we tend to notice. The location too was a major bonus and the hotel was situated within walking distance to all the major attractions. in Old Madrid and has a metro station right on the doorstep. We only used the restaurant once as there are so many in close proximity to choose from but found the food to be of a very good standard and they also had an extensive selection of wines. If I was to suggest one area that the Hotel could improve upon then it's the WiFi coverage. In our room the download speed was quite often so slow as to be non existent. We got better coverage in the bar area but it was frustrating at times. However, the Hotel Regina is an excellent base for a visit to Madrid and we would have no hesitation in recommending it to others. They pride themselves on their high Tripadvisor rating and it's to their credit that they are using this process to drive their business forward and not rest on their laurels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: PeterDS
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here, and can highly recommend. Very convenient for metro, which is valuable in Madrid. Easily walkable to the big 3 art galleries (Prado, Thyssen-B, and Reine Sofia), Puerta del Sol (very close), and Plaza Mayor. Room very modern and clean. Sleeping area small but adequate, bathroom large with good amenities. Bed comfortable. The breakfast buffet is excellent (and includes sparkling wine if you feel like starting the day thus), and dining is good for tapas and dinner. Staff friendly and helpful- no problem for the non-Spanish speaker at all.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING GORGEOUS HOTEL with Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: meli_Travelbee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best Located hotel , seriously it couldn't be in a better place 1 min walk from Puerto del Sol , 5 Minutes from Placa Mayor and everything is close by. The Hotel rooms are nice , clean comfortable, bathrooms are exquisite. The only little downside is that you could hear the water pipes but I think that was only the room I was in. Didn't bother that much. Breakfast is good , nice choice of cheese , hams, hot foods and fruit. Staff are very friendly and nice. Would most definitely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family !!! Just WOW

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location! The decor is very contemporary/funky. It is steps from the Metro and very close to Puerta del Sol. Also a close walk to the major museums. The front desk staff was friendly. I never ate at the restaurant, but the food looked good as I passed by. The couple of downsides were: there was a charge to use the computer and while the room was supplied with shampoo, a razor, and comb but there was no hand soap (weird considering the other supplies). I would stay at the hotel again at eagerly recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: navigator_th
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights last year and it was great. The location is completely perfect!! You can walk to Puerta del Sol in 2-3 mins. There is a Metro station entrance just 20 yards from hotel’s door and you can go anywhere in Madrid. Our room was quite small which was European standard but clean and look nice. The bathroom was great in a good size and the free WiFi worked well. Many restaurants and cafés were around the hotel so you got choices to choose. However, our room was non-smoking at the back of the hotel but unfortunately got a lot of smoke every night. After put the wet towel under the door, it helped a bit then we could sleep. The wall was quite thin so we heard every word people talked in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location...”
Reviews.Author: vixsticks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina for 3 nights and were very impressed with the facilities and service. The location is perfect - within walking distance of everything we wanted to see, but just off the main thoroughfair, so quieter than some of the other central hotels. Puerta del Sol is 2 minutes walk away but the hotel is away from the hubbub, so you don't get any noisy people walking past your window in the wee small hours. Our room was spacious, clean, modern & stylish and we were lucky enough to be tucked away in a corner of the hotel, off the main corridor, so the room was very quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only slight drawback was the fact that you couldn't charge drinks in the bar to your room and the hairdryer in the bathroom didn't stretch to the mirror but these are tiny details in an otherwise fantastic stay. We'll definitely stay again when we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dan773
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights in Feb 2011 - had a superior room which was large and comfortable had no noise problems as other reviewers had has a metro stop outside the front door which is great for getting about and makes the hotel very easy to find. Had a starbucks and a cafe next door which gave us plenty of options for breakfast / refreshements (we did not have breakfast at the hotel) hotel is within walking distance or short metro ride from most of the attractions we went to. If we stayed in Madrid again we would go back Internet access at a charge but was 3 euros for 15mins. GETTING TO HOTEL FROM AIRPORT Took about 40 minutes and involved 2 simple line changes. The metro is easy to use and work out which way you need to be going. DON'T waste money on a cab or other expensive method of transfer RESTAURANT eat here one night Booked through RESTALO and got 33% discount ended up paying 51 Euros for a 2 course meal which was just okay - restaurant was a bit disappointing - lacked atmosphere SUMMARY Very easy to find Great location Large comfortable rooms Cheaper than other City centre Hotels I have stayed in WOULD go back WOULD recommend to nearest and dearest

Reviews.Title: “great hotel worth a higher star rating”
Reviews.Author: jckpenny
Reviews.Content: Superiors rooms very well furnished and whole hotel excellent decor and finish. Staff all helpful, friendly and welcomed returning guests like old friends while I was there. Enghish spoken. Restaurant very good choice at breakfast and evening meal, includes some Spanish specialties. I will definitely return to this hotel Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: galavantingjane
Reviews.Content: Excellent location!!! The Sevilla metro is literally 4 steps away from the entrance of the hotel and everything was within walking distance! The longest we had to walk was 25 minutes from La Latina back to the hotel because the metro stops running by 1:30am. This is the center most location in Madrid, with tons of shopping, places to eat, and bars to check out. Plaza Mayor, Parque de Retiro, Plaza de Cibeles are a 10-15 minute walk. Puerto del Sol is a 3-4 minute walk. Prado Museum, Reina Sofia, Plaza de Toros and Palacio Real are a few stops from the Sevilla metro stop, costing only 1 euro each way. The concierge was very helful with reservations and suggestions. We will definitely stay at the Regina again!!! TIP: My husband and I went during our honeymoon and I emailed the hotel and requested to have a room with a balcony facing the street because we wanted to have the best view of the city. I also requested for a "matrimonio bed" (matrimonial bed) because many european hotels are doubles or twin beds pushed together. When we arrived, we got both the view and a california king size bed! My husband and I LOVE the sounds of the city, so we left our balcony doors open every night. This may be excessively loud for most people due to the city life, but this is easily rectified by shutting the balcony doors and dropping the black out shades.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks every box”
Reviews.Author: passionfruit44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and had a very satisfactory experience. For the price we paid, my companion and me couldn't believe how central and perfect the location of the hotel is and the standard inside. After entering into the smart lobby and being assisted by the bell-boy we thought we had got the wrong hotel! The room was large, airy and nicely furnished with comfortable beds; making up for the tiny windows and lack of view. The en suite was particularly nice- very modern, clean with two sinks for a twin room. The staff were a little dissapointing compared to the rest of the hotel, especially over a disagreement about a phonebill. Nevertheless would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel in Madrid to any traveller or tourist; solo or family, young or old. The location seems nearly unbeatable, with the main shopping district very closeby as well as major parks and musuems all within walking distance. Overall a very comfortable stay in a busy and action packed city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhnhamilton75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good in a lot of ways, clean rooms, good value for money, nice restaurant, great free safe and wi-fi connection. Excellent location. Staff is friendly and helpful. I will be visiting again next year and looking forward to another fabulous holiday with warm and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Babytan
Reviews.Content: We have recently staued at this hoteland can confirm that reservation staff are very helpful since they managed to accomodate our complicated request and there were no surprises when we got the final bill. Hotel is situated in front of a metro station(you can fall into it if not careful..) and very close to restaurants and shops. Very clean and a good breakfast. Definitely reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jerycrr
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Madrid. Wonderful quit room. Completely satisfied with this lovely, friendly and beautiful hotel. The service was unsurpassed. Truly one of the best Free wi-fi If you go to Madrid, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: jonhyty
Reviews.Content: Regina is a very pleasant and comfortable hotel. The room (superior category) was large, well furnished. The staff is discrete but attentive and with good advices. Excellent restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: katy026
Reviews.Content: This is quite simple the best tree stars hotel I have visited ever. Staff is super friendly and the location is excellent. It is a one minute walk from the city center (Puerta del Sol) and this makes it a perfect getaway from the tourist. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service and great "accessible" room”
Reviews.Author: jenyyy
Reviews.Content: The wheelchair accessible rooms at hotels are frequently not accessible at all, and badly desingned and difficult to use. But at th Regina, not only did we get an excellent and luxurious room, but the bathroom set up was perfect for what we needed

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Regina!”
Reviews.Author: ktown0919
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! We arrived in Madrid having never been before and only going off of what we have seen on maps and in tour and travel books. This hotel is truly the perfect location - 2 blocks from Puerto Del Sol, 1 block from the Gran Via, 10 minutes walk to the Prado and within walking of dozens of wonderful restaurants. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the room and public spaces were incredibly clean. The beds were a little hard, but nothing terrible. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: quechuaa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location. It is in the center and opposite the underground station Sevilla, from which you can go everywhere. Rooms are large and nice, the bathroom is spacious and modern. Restaurant offers very good meals. I recommend this hotel for cleanliness of the rooms and helpful staff. I highly recommend it to visit Madrid

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: biazange
Reviews.Content: very good location and very good price, i"ve booked by internet, like an early booking!!!

Reviews.Title: “cool modern room and ideal location for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: skirtandsupersuit
Reviews.Content: we really loved this room. our room was on the small side, but the layout was very cool and it felt very private. the finishings and design were very modern and it felt a lot more expensive than what it was. there was some noise as has been mentioned, but i don't remember it bothering our sleep that much. the location really cannot be beat, especially for when you have limited time and want to take advantage of the city (especially bar and tapas hopping) in a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in madrid”
Reviews.Author: samontana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Regina the hotel is extremely perfect. It was just few steps away from the metro station and had 3 minutes walking distance to "Sol". Breakfast was perfect. There was a restaurant at the hotel and they made us the best chicken toast that we have ever ate. I stayed there for 7 days and everyday I had the toast. The room had a street view and as the buildings and area was perfect we enjoyed it very much. As a Madrid lover, I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. For business, for leisure it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, Great Value and warm Service. We´ll stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: BASSNJAZZ
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, we stayed for 5 nights on a double room, not to big but not too small, the shower is in good condition, roomy with good water pressure, always hot water, tub, hairdryer. The Hotel is recently remodeled as I could noticed, and it has a modern touch combined with the antique architecture that characterizes Madrid. We stayed on late November early December and the hitting worded good. Our windows faced toward a inside patio and sometimes you could hear noises coming from other rooms, flushing pipes and thinks like that but really quiet at night. The mattress was slightly uncomfortable, too soft for me and that is why I´m giving 4 points from 5, the sleep is the most important part. BEST LOCATION!! From Metro station across the street, ATM, cafeterias, all kind of restaurants, and a couple of blocks from the Puerta del Sol, Plaza mayor. The people at the front desk put this hotel at a higher level with their great service and assistance. Definitively We are staying there next time on Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location helpful staff, wi-fi connection uggggggg”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBears13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location in early January. Pros: Location, location, location. Only a couple of blocks from "Puerta de Sol". The staff was very helpful and there are usually 2-3 people at the front desk that can answer any questions you have about where to go, where to eat, etc. The bathroom was very nice, the only thing missing was a tub but, lol, it was almost as larger as the sleeping room itself. Room decor was sleek and modern. Cons: Room was small (I know, I know.. they are in Europe) but since we reserved a Superior room we expected a bit larger size. Tip, If you do the "superior" then the 2 twin size beds will make a king as opposed to the other option of 1 queen size bed. The free wi-fi connection in the room totally stunk. Lastly, a palmetto bug.... yes the type you would see in FL, we saw a huge one in the hallway and had to kill it. This in no way says that the Hotel is dirty, in fact they keep it very clean but we found this to be odd at the least. OK, I almost forgot, I love pizza, on the last night of our stay we just wanted pizza or something easy to order. The hotel staff pointed us to a pizza joint about 2 blocks away. WOW!!! Seriously, the best pizza we've ever had. The name is "El Trebol". This place is a must if you're a pizza aficionado. Not a tourist trip but a little mom & pop joint.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amitdds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Regina for 2 nights. Right off the Sevilla train station exit. I was surprised at the good quality of the rooms for 59 euros a night. Clean, and comfortable rooms. Although a light sleeper might find noise a bit annoying;, the walls don't do a great job of blocking out guests talking in the hallways. It didn't bother us that much as we had a room more into the middle of our floor away from the street. The water pressure in the room was very good and made for a great shower. The location is also very ideal, as most places are within walking distance or just a train ride away, so it doesn't matter where you stay in Madrid. The currency exchange rate this hotel offers is terrible. Just walk outside and trade at one of the many banks for much better rate at no commission. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would stay here again for this price.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: curtis6677
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable with a huge bed and a plenty of space. The bathroom was very clean. The hotel is in a excellent location for attractions. The staff was very helpful and gave us a list of their recommended restaurants We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cg26Bath
Reviews.Content: We were slightly apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the reviews but we need not have worried. Advantages: Brilliant location; 5 minute walk to Puerto del sol and about 8-10 minutes to the plaza mayor. There is a tube and bus stop just down the road and the whole area feels very safe and clean. Our room was very large, clean, well equipped, comfortable and the beds were brilliant. There is an adjoining cafe which serves breakfasts, tapas and drinks at very reasonable prices, so we didnt bother with the hotel restaurant. The porters were the most amazing guys ever, they were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. When we arrived they were there before the taxi had stopped; took our cases up to our room, lifted them on to the luggage rack and showed us around our room. When we left one held up the traffic in order to hail a taxi. Disadvantages; Our room was very hot which was annoying as we booked the hotel because the website advertised air conditioning. Apparently they turn it off during the winter and instead use climate control. However we found it cooler when we turned the climate control off. I am glad I bought a fan with me!. Other reviews have mentioned noise, and obviously central locations are noisy, but this was no worse than say the Thistle in Brighton or the Hilton in London, both of which also have excellent locations. For the last year I have travelled with silicone ear plugs (available from Boots) and I now have always had a good nights sleep. The reception staff were not the friendliest bunch I have been served by, but they were ok when you needed them. All in all a fantastic hotel for a fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: laudri
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel experience. Everyone on staff is smart, kind and anxious to be as helpful as possible. Great breakfast. We would certainly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: dziubek
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms. However short beds (I'm 174cm tall and my feet were out of the bed) and forget about getting a good night sleep - you can hear all other guests living around you.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay when visiting Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rott1212
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. The hotel was very clean and the front desk was extremely helpful The breakfast was always really good. Our 4 night stay was quite and pleasurable. Lots of restaurants around and the area felt safe to me. It was a great hotel with reasonable prices. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No idea why rated so high”
Reviews.Author: Noodlesz
Reviews.Content: Location great yes. But rooms and hotel are tired. Maybe some rooms are a lot nicer than others. Dinky 10" tv in the two rooms I stayed in with old mattress from 1998 as per the date on the label. First room on first floor was terrible layout and paper walls. I can hear people upstairs and outside on the same floor. When housekeeping was cleaning rooms nearby it's like and earthquake. Switched rooms after first night and has been better but this time the floor was seriously slanted and bed has a lump in the middle. Plus side housekeeping is really clean so kudos to them. Front desk staff are old and unfriendly, but will help you with your requests. So I will make that a positive overall but don't expect anything above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “This is how a hotel should be run”
Reviews.Author: art115511
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina struck me as a blueprint for how a hotel should be. Very prompt service and all needs were met beyond expectations. The location was fab - if you are young and energetic you can walk to all the museums from the hotel or if you're feeling less inclined the metro is only a short walk from the hotel. Overall a great place - friendly staff, good accommodation and location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lpacheco1
Reviews.Content: I am a travel writer and I spend months planning my trips. I have also worked for The Ritz-Carlton Hotel chain in sales and marketing, so my expectations are pretty high. Also, when researching Madrid, this city has so many hostels, hostals, and hotels, honestly it was mind boggling. Speaking virtually no Spanish, and traveling solo, this was an important concern, however, from the minute I checked in, to check out, this hotel catered to all my needs. The front desk agents and concierge were so accommodating, and there was always someone at the desk that spoke english. The concierge Ricardo, gave me recommendations and booked tours that picked me up at the hotel. More importantly, this hotel is in the best location possible. Minutes to Puerto del Sol to the Prado museum, as well as, restaurants and Starbucks literally next door! The windows and double insulated, so you don't hear the street noise at all. I also paid out of pocket for my expenses, so my budget was tight, and you can't beat the value and service of the Hotel Regina in Madrid period.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: foss1940
Reviews.Content: I can not express enough how much I enjoyed my stay at The Regina Hotel!!! Right from the start, when we arrived, we felt welcomed. The staff are si friendly and helpful. Great location My room was lovely and had everything we need. It is the little things that just add to feelling comfortable somewhere. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Book The Regina”
Reviews.Author: rclk0102
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at the Regina Hotel. The staff are the friendliest and can not do enough for you. The layout of the room is very well done with all you need worked into the space available. I can also add that the location is terrific specially for visiting the city sights

Reviews.Title: “Location and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: RG0482
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a hotel with an excellent location and a reasonable price this is it. Hotel Regina is located in very central and nice place. However, if you want to have good sleep quality, forget it. We've stay in a 1rst floor room, and very early in the morning - and late at night - we could hear everything was happening in the corridor (people walking and talking, cleaning ladies vacuing, etc) and even people talking in nearby rooms. Air conditioning wasn't working, so the room was too hot (even in the winter). So, we got mixed feelings. The overall experience ok, but sometimes there are more important things than location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Bette P
Reviews.Content: In the Centro district, Hotel Regina is steps from the Sevilla metro station as well as numerous restaurants, tapas bars, & coffee shops. It is also an easy walk to all the major museums and tourist sites. I stayed solo in a double room, so my room was the perfect size for me, but might be cramped for two people - small rooms are typical in Europe. It was nicely decorated and with an incredible deal from Expedia, the price was right. A few minor issues - The room was really warm, and the A/C turned off, so the window had to be opened (to an air shaft) in order to make it bearable to sleep. The hotel is decorated in a lot of marble in the lobby and on each floor. While beautiful, marble amplifies every sound - doors shutting, people talking, luggage rolling. Madrid is a city that stays up late, which means people coming back to the hotel at all hours. If you're a light sleeper or like to turn-in early, ask for a room at the end of the hallway to minimize the noise. While the dealings I had with the staff were pleasant and professional, I can't say that they were the friendliest people I've ever encountered. With all the food choices around, I did not eat in the restaurant, but it looked (and smelled) really good. Overall, the location and value make this an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren000
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and the room was spotless. Room was on the small side, but they usually are in Europe. Hotel is footsteps from the Sevilla Metro station and super close to Puerta del Sol and Sol metro station, also to Plaza Mayor and Gran Via. Metro system super easy to use!! The only down sides to the hotel I would mention is that you can hear the trash pickup truck at around 2 AM and that the lobby is filled with cigarette smoke smell from the bar area (I don't smoke). If I go back to Spain, I'll definitely stay at the Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: andry35805
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Regina for 4 nights, the customer service was truly wonderful, facilities were excellent. Its proximity to the shopping and entertainment could not have been better. All round a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: bish079
Reviews.Content: The hotel Regina is ideally located just round the Puerta del Sol Square and close to many great restaurants and shops. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly, the bedroom was spotless and very comfortable. We would definitely return to the Regina on a future trip to Madrid and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: balmainboy
Reviews.Content: As has been stated in previous reviews this place is excellent value,the rooms are large and spotlessly clean,you can virtually walk to everything and great food,shops and bars are only a stones throw away. Sadly the Tapas Bars are becoming more and more expensive every time we go.The days of the little locals type tapas bars are slowly being swallowed up by more upmarket places.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Budget-Friendly Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Neo01510
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently returned from a 3 week belated honeymoon to Europe, split between two countries (Spain & Italy) and 5 cities (Madrid, Barcelona, Venice, Florence, & Rome). Hotel Sonya was the hotel we stayed in while in Madrid (for 5 nights) and we were pleasantly surprised at both its comfortable/contemporary room as well as by its prime location. The Room: Given that my wife and I are currently in graduate school, we were looking for budget-friendly hotels for our excursion, while also trying to avoid hostels or shady-looking lodging options. Hotel Sonya was a great way to start our trip. The room was fairly large for European standards (especially since I had read that room sizes are paltry in comparison to rooms in the US). This came as a pleasant surprise since we were preparing ourselves for a smaller room. The room had a desk, an LCD TV, a closet, and an in-room safe. The bed was comfortable, with a firm mattress. Extra blankets and pillows were stored in the closet if desired. The bathroom was modern, with a decently spaced shower (though the door didn't close all the way). Still, the bathroom was large enough for both my wife and I to get ready together in the mornings. The water pressure was nice and strong as well, which was excellent. Free wireless internet was available and the connection was decent. We were able to communicate with our family over Skype and rarely had any connection issues. The Hotel: The staff at the front desk was helpful, and we were able to store our luggage in the luggage room while we waited for our room to be available (we arrived at 8:30 am and couldn't check in until 2 pm). This was nice, as it allowed us to explore Madrid without worrying about our belongings. Granted, we aren't the neediest of individuals when it comes to hotel services (i.e. we don't use room service or laundry services and rarely ever find the need to be constantly asking hotel staff for directions/advice), we found the service personnel to be friendly. There is a lobby area but we didn't really have time to lounge around, and there is also a restaurant (which we didn't use), but they are there for those who like that sort of thing. One thing to keep in mind, especially if you've never been to Europe, is that smoking occurs pretty much everywhere. Of all the places we visited, Madrid was by far the smokiest. You get used to it after a while but it is a shock at first. Location: Just steps from Puerta del Sol, we found the hotel to be extremely well situated. We arrived at Madrid Barajas Airport and made our way to the city center using public transport (Metro). Extremely easy and punctual public transport system. By far the best we have ever personally experienced. Ultra modern, clean, and efficient. If all public transport was as good as Madrid's, the world would be a better place. As you can see, we were super impressed with their system. A metro stop was located just outside the hotel and the puerta del sol stop was minutes away, providing more access to more lines. We were minutes away from the Royal Palace, Gran Via, Plaza Real by foot (and most places are conveniently service by Metro as well). Final Verdict: If you are looking for a well-priced basic room to sleep in while you explore the awesomeness that Madrid has to offer, Hotel Sonya is a great option!

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking and book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: welaj
Reviews.Content: As everyone has said a great location within easy walking distance of all the main sights in central Madrid. For trips further afield the metro station is just outside the hotel door. My room overlooked a courtyard so this meant is was quiet. Lovely shower. Only minor niggles are there is no proper English TV channel only CNBC, the cafe is the smoking area and the restaurant opens very late in the evening (to be expected in Spain). I would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone. Look out for their special 3 night offers on their website which makes it good value for money. The buffet breakfast is slightly expensive but good if you don't want to have lunch until the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: OliverE77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in a triple room in this centrally located hotel. The room was tastefully furnished, spacious, well-equipped with three single beds in 2 rooms, desk, built-in cupboard with safe and flat-screen TV. The bathroom with bath tub was rather big, modern, clean and offers all the facilities that one would expect. Important to mention is that the windows of this room facing busy Calle Alcalá were fantastic, blocked out noises very effectively and were equipped with roller blinds. The room was quiet most of the time, but this largely depends on the other hotel guests as noises (conversations, steps etc.) from surrounding rooms can be heard. The only negative aspects were that the room was way too warm (it was November!) - my watch showed 31°C. The AC had already been switched off and so the only way to cool the room was to open the window. The mattresses weren´t too comfortable and rather short, but bearable. Wi-Fi was available free of charge and connection was easy and reliable in our room. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The next Metro station ("Sevilla") is virtually just outside the hotel door and Puerta del Sol, one of the biggest Metro hubs, is about 5 minutes away. If you don´t need a huge buffet-style breakfast (which costs € 15,- per person) there are plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance, where you can have breakfast for €2,- to 6,-. We never had breakfast at the hotel and therefore I can´t tell you anything about it. All in all a really nice place in the heart of the Spanish capital and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “location, price, amenities, great”
Reviews.Author: lettienets
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week Oct 6-13 as a single and found the location fabulous for walking anywhere central, day or night, right on METRO line, easy to get to from airport etc. The dining room was more formal and expensive so I only ate in the small restaurant facing the street where breakfast could be traditional or more Spanish style of a sweet roll or tostados, tortilla slice with bread and cafe con leche. At night, tapas alone could fill you up nicely. Staff spoke English and had touring ideas on the dreaded Mondays when nearly every museo is closed. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotelin the heart fo Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lnrd737
Reviews.Content: Good sized room with great facilities. Welcoming, informative staff a high level of service. Well presented breakfast. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Madrid and both shopping and sightseeing attractions are easily accesssed by walking or subway. Overal, the hotel is excellent we would recommend it as the place to stay when vissiting Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good deal”
Reviews.Author: garridogal
Reviews.Content: Centrally located on Calle Alcala, the Hotel Regina is minutes from Cibeles, Puerta del Sol and the Plaza Mayor, to name just a few spots. The location is truly excellent and that can't be beat. The lobby is nice and always bustling, as it's almost incorporated into the restaurant next door, and the staff is very friendly. Accommodations depend, however, on which half of the hotel you're in. I stayed here at the beginning of our trip and at the end. On the first-leg, our room was in the modern back half. It was very nicely decorated, and the bathroom was lovely. (My photos here are from that stay.) The view in this section of the hotel is non-existent as the windows face an small opening between it and an office building next door. However, this creates an ideal sleeping environment and you'll never know that you're in the middle of a major city. On our return leg, our room was in the front, older part of the hotel. I can't say that it was a negative experience but here are my complaints. There were three of us and the room was divided into 2 sections. I took the section with the single bed which was in an alcove. The alcove's sole piece of furniture was the bed. There was certainly room for a night stand where a guest could put his or her belongings and, more importantly, a lamp.
