The only light in that section of the room was the florescent one on the ceiling. It was horrible to have to use this blinding light whenever I needed to see something. Hence, the need for that table. Also, the person using that bed has no view of the TV while lying in bed. Some of us like that sort of thing. The plus, however, was the view (from the main room.) That just can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very central good service.”
Reviews.Author: Bkops
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights over the madrid national holiday weekend in October. Hotel staff was extremely couurteous and eager to please. the bell hop was a sweetheart! On arrival i was a little concerned over the rrom given. being slightly clastrophobic and the window opend to an interior dead space at floor level. i was a little worried awould not be able to sleep and the room was a bit cramped for all our gear. my aunts hda similiar rooms. one decided to stay where she was but we asked if we could see other rooms. they were very helpful and we were both given street view rooms. perfect. the city was at our window. the casino was next door so around 2 AM there was a lot of talking outside below us but once you closed the window we were ok. Not too sure if there wasAC in the room. the restaurants were very well run and great service and food. I would stay here again. hotel was clean and the bathrooms in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rip off pricing, invisible service”
Reviews.Author: LondonHarryC
Reviews.Content: If I'd paid €100 a night for a room, I would have thought that this was an ok budget hotel in a fab location. However, for €392 it's an extraordinary rip off. Why? The rooms are small, and oddly angled, which make the practical space even smaller. They are almost devoid of any of the kind of "luxury" that you'd think almost €400 should buy - so a tiny portable TV, rather than anything like a flat screen. Despite the lavish in-room menu on display, there was no room service food available at 2350 "because it was late and the kitchen has closed" - in Spain, where most kitchens are at peak load at midnight!! The mini-bar clearly not been checked in years - half the bottles were empty but had had their tops carefully replaced. Breakfast charged on top.... This is an area where there are much better, and much better value hotels in abundance. Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: Migs17
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina is a great home base for exploring Madrid. Located directly in front of the Sevilla metro stop which made getting around this fabulous city such a breeze. The subway system is so clean and easy to use so being right in front of it was a tremendous help. Room was clean and had a great nights sleep after sightseeing all day. Great hotel in a great central location for a decent price. Would definitely stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: GAGTVM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the old city centre and most of the must see sights are a short walk away. There is a subway station located right at the hotel entrance. madrid subway is the second largest network in europe(after london) and it is quite a convenient way of getting around this big city. Moving beyond the location, the hotel is quite average as such. As many others have mentioned, the receptionists are quite disinterested in their work and i guess the concept of "service with a smile" or friendliness is just kinda lost on them. I must also add that the receptionists are quite mature and there are very few youngsters manning the place. Perhaps, this could be a reason why many other reviewrs have also mentioned that they were not happy with the receptionists. The hotel could definitely consider a grooming session for them i guess :) The hotel rooms are quite big(we were in the superior rooms) and basic modern amenities are there but the hotel does definitely lack class... somehow when the last renovation happened, i guess they didnt bother to get in a good interior designer or a good architect. Somehow, the rooms do not make any impression on you and when you are paying the kinda rates that the regina charges, you definitely do expect something beyond basic clean rooms. the lobby is quite unimaginiative and its quite onvious that the hotel knows very well that it will continue to sell at the rates they are going at based purely on the location. For this sort of budget, i really think you can just look at being a bit away from the city centre and have better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: lwmueller
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucks. Period. It's not terribly expensive, but it's still not worth the money. The front desk staff and the servers at the restaurant/bar are exceedingly rude. You'd be lucky to get any of them to make eye contact with you, whether you speak Spanish (which we do) or not (which we also tried) Hands down, the loudest hotel on Earth. For all three nights, myself and my partner slept on and off in 15 minute increments at best. The bed is obscenely uncomfortable. You can feel everything spring digging into your body, I even tried sleeping on top of my pillow as a surrogate mattress. And the noise, my god, the noise. A hotel room door closing, anywhere in the hotel, sounds like a sonic boom, since the halls are lined with a cheap marble that only enhances the misery. You can hear every phone ringing, every conversation, other guests snoring or worse... It's a never-ending cacophony and it makes for a very cranky morning. Most rooms don't have windows, or windows looking out into another guest's window, so enjoy feeling like a rat in a cage. And if you're not an early-riser, don't expect your room to be cleaned, because the maid service won't come back. Yes, the location is great -- but if you can't get a moment's peace, you won't feel like touring any plazas anyway. DON'T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina stay some where else”
Reviews.Author: poar
Reviews.Content: my partner and I stay at Hotel Regine. We chose the hotel having viewed the pictures on the web site. When we arrived we were shown to our room very small quite closterphobic. bed shoved against the wall due to the room being so small. The view from the window was a dingy and what seemed like a lift shaft, no natural light. Looking straight into someones bathroom, and a naked man coming out of the shower. So the blinds had to be drawn at all times if you like to keep your modesty. Asked to change room and where offered another room. Completely different to the web pictures. The room was old, decor very dated, two single beds. Not very satisfactory given we planned on a romantic weekend, (could'not push beds together because of the unit in the middle. Shower was functional but keeped on falling off the wall, hair dyer listed was from the 1920's, I could have used my own breathe to dry my hair. Bathroom little grimme not the standard I would expect from £112. 00 a night. Noise from the street, treble if you are a light sleeper. Peanuts in minibar over 12 months out of date, which we eat and spat out. Yes we where given two mini bottles of champagne. Infrom they didn't have another room. No wirting paper. Staff in the cafe very rude and spent time chatting to eachother rather than serving. I wouldn't stay there again and wouldn't recommend to anyone. P Chand U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: csteen
Reviews.Content: Nice, no frills, perfectly located walking distance to the Prado and business area. Clean. Helpful staff (except for one) and very friendly. Price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy building works, not good for leisure travellers”
Reviews.Author: FunkstaHippyOnline
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel specifically because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and I am very particular about noise so I was comforted to read a few reviews about how quiet the hotel was. On entry the hotel was very clean and modern we were checked in promptly and show to our room. The room, though small was clean and uber modern - clearly recently refurbished as it had a lovely new bathroom and big show. First impressions were great, as we had spent a week before on the south coast of Spain staying in a room with no aircon we were really looking forward to having a cool bedroom. Unfortunately the cold air seemed to blow directly onto your head once you were on the bed and my wife found this unpleasant so we had to turn it off. The TV oddly would turn itself on at midnight as well but on all occasions I was getting ready for bed so it didn't disturb us though I couldn't get to the bottom of turning off this room 'feature'. I was really pleasantly surprised at just how quiet the room was at night, despite being near a very busy road. Unfortunately the biggest shock came at 8am the next morning when we were woken abruptly with the noice of hammering and drilling coming from below. This continued all morning until we got up, and then started up at 8am the next day with loud noises like heavy machinery being operated. We went to investigate and discovered the hotel is refurbishing the floor below and the horrendous noise continued at 8am every morning. This was really not appreciated by a couple on a relaxing break. We decided that it wasn't worth complaining about it and being moved to a potentially noisier room at night reasoning it would be better to be woken up at 8am. But I wouldn't stay here again unless I knew the works had finished. I'm sure it would be fine for business travellers who need to be up early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, overpriced, good rooms and shocking window view.”
Reviews.Author: emhunt94
Reviews.Content: The hotel is location on one of the most central and main streets in Madrid. Literally in front of the entrance is the 'Sevilla' Metro station and 200m down the road is Puerta del Sol. As for the room, we were in a triple room which had good beds and a nice bathroom. However the single window in our room faced out to a gap between building walls, which to be put nicely was not so appealing. The staff were reasonably helpful, but be mindful that if you want something, you defiantly need to make that clear to whoever is helping you out. Hotel Regina is not however a relaxing hotel more of a comfortable one. The restaurant was very average as well and very over priced. And as a final mention, right next door is a cafe called Faborit which has free wifi and do a great bailey's frappe. All in all my time there was pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “NIce service but the room can be better ! Still like it !”
Reviews.Author: Brendadix
Reviews.Content: Madrid is not as an expensive city as i thought and it was easily to find this hotel as it offered us at reasonable rate. The hotel was at normal 3 star hotel standard but the atmosphere was pleasant, with average rooms. That is our general thought. But one thing is that i dont like as the 'double bed' room contains 2 single beds pushed next to each other. We came as couple and was not a nice sleeping. The staff was very friendly, and helpful though and their breakfast was very good, gave us full of energy each day. Location is not bad either, very easy to get to anywhere, even the Real Madid's football stadium. Other than that, i think this is still a good hotel and the price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not great service”
Reviews.Author: SR1990
Reviews.Content: Hotel Regina was located about 200 meters from Puerta del Sol and the Sevilla stop on the red line was right in front of the hotel. Also, there was an ATM about two doors down from the hotel entrance, which was very convenient. The rooms were also very nice and spacious, although I'm not sure of the value, since I stayed with a large tour group. Now for the bad: Our room was incredibly difficult to get to. We had to take the elevator up to the fourth floor and then walk down the stairs to the first. It seems confusing, but it was in a separate part of the hotel (only some rooms) and this was the only way to reach it. The hotel staff did not even let us know this and did not even help us when we asked how to get there or help us carrying the bags down the steps. Also, the WiFi did not work in the room and the receptionist told me it was just too bad and that the Internet just didn't work everywhere. Terrible service and even though the hotel is nice, I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL, SMELLY, CIGAR SMELL EVERYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: lmmoreyra
Reviews.Content: Smell bad, but the hotel is good. Very good place. The staff is not helpful and nothing is complementary, they just do what they HAVE to do, nothing else. Don`t expect welcome drinks, complementary breakfast, chocolate on room, fruits or water. Regular hotel

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, excellent location, lack of intimacy”
Reviews.Author: OanaB
Reviews.Content: You don't get soap and shower gel apart from those at the beginning of your stay, even though you ask for them personally from the cleaning team. Finally, you have to go to the reception desk to get them. No towels during one day. Again reception desk. No intimacy due to the fact that all room and bathroom windows face an inner yard so that you could be invaded by all the noises coming from the other 20-30 rooms. Excellent location though. Be careful, sometimes the hotel is rated as a 3*-hotel, whereas on other occasions it is rated as a 4*-hotel. Don't be mislead, as I was, thinking that I was booking a 4*-hotel. The truth is that the standard rooms are located in the 3* part of the hotel, while the superior rooms are located in the 4* part.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not great service”
Reviews.Author: boncohen
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we got the distinct impression that the front desk staff did not like Americans. We got a lousy room. Our questions were answered perfunctorily, and although we got the feeling that the second person at the desk might have been nicer, he seemed afraid to look us in the eye. The bellhop was very nice -- unfortunately, he didn't speak any English and his Spanish wasn't great either! The next morning, a nicer person was at the desk and we changed rooms with no problem. Each time the first staff member was on, though, we avoided the desk, and would have had a much better stay if we could have asked more questions. We were afraid of him.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: DDMHaddonfield_NJ
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Spain and spent three nights at the Regina. I had requested an early check in and the room was ready at 10 am when I arrived. The staff was courteous and informative. My room was spacious and the bathroom was large with a double sink. The hose of the hairdryer had a hole in it but I bring my own and was able to use it with a plug adapter. I received no meal coupon but did have coffee and a pastry in the small hotel cafe. The location was great - across the street from the Sevilla metro and only a few blocks from Sol. The airconditioning worked well which was fortunate since it was about 100 degrees in Madrid. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelcat22
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Regina hotel in Madrid and cannot fault it. We were given a large room with a balcony overlooking the street below. The hotel is located right by a metro stop so it was really easy when arriving from the airport. We were on a room only basis but we found there were plenty of places to get a breakfast, aswell as evening meal. Central Madrid is a lot smaller than we expected so we didn't need to use the metro whilst we were there as everything was within walking distance, and this hotels location was perfect; not too noisy as the Gran Via may be, but also not off the beaten track. We had air conditioning and a huuuuge flat screen tv in our room, the beds were comfy and we also found the hotel staff to be very polite and helpful. I would certainly return to this hotel again. Hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: garthy777
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days with my wife in Madrid to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary and we were very happy with Hotel Regina. The location in central, which is very important in Madrid and the desk staff were very helpful. We were also able to get a stay 4 pay 3 nights deal which made the value great. Our room faced the street so it was noisy when we opened the windows (i don't like AC), but i guess this would be the same in all central hotels in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, upscale hotel at a decent price, right in the middle of things.”
Reviews.Author: lindaesacramento
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the Regina, and wish it was more. It was a more upscale hotel than we are used to, but the price wasn't bad. It was also the only place where we ate an actual dinner in Spain, opting for tapas most nights. The Regina offered a 50% off coupon for guests, and it was well worth it. The breakfast buffet was also the most complete breakfast we had all week. The bathroom was awesome; large, fully stocked, and with a tub and bidet, as well as double sinks and great lighting. The location was right downtown. We thought it would be noisy, but the air conditioning made a nice hum to drown it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: williamp9974
Reviews.Content: My wife, college age daughter and I stayed at Regina for three nights, part of a 10 day trip. We had a room facing the street and loved it! The restaurant was way too expensive. Many options real close- Had breakfast at Nebraska- actual name of restaurant- across the street. We also took two side trips- Toledo and Segovia. We took public transportation everywhere. It was great. The Metro is super easy to use and cheap. Trains are fast and on time. While in Madrid, we toured a number of cool places- Prado, Royal Palace, Plaza del Sol. My only complaint is the smokers- everywhere in Spain. It didn't bother us in the hotel room, but did at different tapas bars and restaurants. Had a great time- fabulous trip. Regina is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to return to Madrid and stay at Hotel Regina again!”
Reviews.Author: pollockce
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Hotel Regina based on other reviews and its central location. I could not have been more pleased with this decision. We arrived very late and were greeted with a smile and quick delivery of our room keys. The room was beautiful and modern and the bed was extremely comfortable. The service was always helpful and quick to respond. We accidently spilled liquid on the bed and after a call to the front desk, the maid was at our door and promptly changed the sheets. We've traveled a lot in Spain and that quick response is not the norm. The location couldn't be better. The Sevilla metro stop is directly in front of the hotel and Plaza del Sol is a short walk. We didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant but it always seemed to be full of locals which is usually a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and I'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: dishydes
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel in May 2009 as I had treated my niece to a trip to Madrid for her 21st birthday and we were going to see Real Madrid v Barcelona at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. I had never been to Madrid before and have to say I was taken in by the whole city and part of that was down to the hotel which is ideally located and absolutely ideal for an traveller who wants to get about the city without much fuss. Several Metro stations are located nearby as are many of the tourist attractions of Madrid (many just a short walk away), the tourist bus trips are also there. The staff were very friendly and although I could speak some Spanish it was mostly English used and the staff were more than able to help with the enquiries I and my niece had. The rooms are fairly basic but have a comfortable feel to them, the hotel itself has a nice decor and the breakfast buffet in the morning was a bonus of a way to start your day. This hotel is ideal for seeing Madrid and for any form of tourist as I've no doubt already said. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, in one of the best locations in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mgm53
Reviews.Content: We had only intended to stay one night, but due to the ash ended up staying for 4. After reading reviews about street noise we requested a quiet room and that is exactly what we got. Very quiet, spacious room and a huge bathroom with walk in shower. ok the view from the bedroom window was of a light well, but who comes to madrid to send allday looking out of thier window. I found all the staff helpful, they all spoke english but as ever an attempt to speak spanish is apreciated. The location is superb, 200 yards right out of the hotel and you are in puerto del sol 200 to the left and you are in the museum district. the metro is outside and for 2 euros you can travel to the airport by changing twice. Good value was the royal palace which if free for eu citizens on wednesdays. For 60 pound a night i would not bother staying anywere else in madrid

Reviews.Title: “Tiny window , No air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: morestarsthanUSAflag
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was the only thing to recommend this hotel for. The room was small with the smallest window overlooking what is best described as a service shaft. ie pipes and cables running up the walls. We had room 304 the view was of three other rooms in close proximity . If you wanted to see if the sun was out you had to twist your head to look up to a patch of sky at the top of the shaft. The room was unbearably hot and I tried to cool it down by adjusting the fan on the wall, I mistakenly thought this was air con but was told by the desk the hotel does not have air con. I think this room would be suffocating in the high summer.

Reviews.Title: “This will be my first choice next time in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Estufarian
Reviews.Content: Superb location - steps from Subway. Also walking distance to many essential sites and museums. A couple of changes needed when coming to/from airport, but that's only a one-time issue. We were in what seems to be a newly renovated part (at the back) as there are two different sets of elevators, and the back part is a few feet different in floor height from the larger front part (Actually looked liike a differnt building had been 'absorbed' into an older one. Astonishingly quiet room - especially considering the street outside was used twice for large protest meetings. Wi-Fi was free - except didn't connect in the room, but no problems using the lobby. And although other reviews indicated single beds only (no doubles) we requested a double and they pushed the two beds together and used oversize bedding, so we ended up with something like a King. Radio system was web-based so we could listen to radio stations world-wide. Staff were mostly excellent - a couple of glitches (towels weren't rplaced one day) but overall we were so impressed we recommend to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great for the price I paid!”
Reviews.Author: frankfurt2010
Reviews.Content: The room is very stylish and clean. The hotel is directly in front of a metro station which is super convenient. Although the shampoo and soap they provided was cheap and poor quality and the front desk staff was not as friendly, I still enjoyed my stay there since I only paid for 69 euro for a night. It is great for the price I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Petergolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very much in the heart of Madrid, being only a 3 minute walk to the Puerto del Sol and next to the casino. If you want to visit Madrid then this is ideally located with the Sevilla metro station directly outside the hotel. The hotel appears to have all it rooms upgraded recently to a good standard. The hotel can be a bit noisy but I suppose that is what you get in central Madrid, it did not stop our enjoyment. Most rooms do not have much of a view, but as a base it is excellent. The hotel and rooms were very clean and well maintained and they were tended every day. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel lobby which always seemed popular. We did not use it as there are so many alternatives available on the doorstep. Breakfast is available at 12Euros. All the hotel staff spoke English so no communications problems. We travelled by car as part of an extended visit to Spain. I did a lot of research before we went as to how I could park in or around Madrid. I had to reluctantly accept that there was no cheap way of taking your car. All hotels which had car parking charged and staying out of the city and travelling in each day would have diminished the pleasure of our stay. The hotel does not have parking but there is a public car park directly opposite the hotel. The charge was 27.80Euros a day. It seemed a secure park and I had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid was better than we thought, absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: babe8
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Regina, had a couple of problems but the staff on reception sorted them for us without any trouble in fact they were excellent. Our only advice we would give, is try not to get a room at the front of the hotel near the road especially if you want to sleep. Sadly we did not enjoy the breakfast at all, sad as we felt it let the Hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Hotel, fantastic Location, noisy inside and out.”
Reviews.Author: BittenTravelBugs
Reviews.Content: Easy hotel to get to just up the stairs of the Sevilla metro stop in a beautiful location of Madrid. It is only a block or so from Puerta del Sol which is a good place to start your trip from. We booked through a popular travel website and based our room purchase on price and location. On these grounds the Hotel fit the bill and we certainly have no regrets booking this place as our first hotel in Spain. O.K. room, two twin beds, clean, very nice bathroom, and an alright overall place. It was very noisy both within the building and sounds coming from the street, the floors creaked, and the staff was pretty oblivious to guests. Nothing too fancy and as we travelled through Spain we realized the base room price on the internet is just that, the base room. While some other rooms would be strong three star rooms, ours would need a little push to get there. In the end we were happy but did find better places for a similar prices later on in the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Purjelentaja
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late in the evening and were appointed a small but nice room, a bit aged in style. Clean, wooden floors, good sized bathroom. At night we noticed there was some noice coming from the corridor, but the main problem was it was unbearably hot in the room, and in the morning we asked if they could do something with it. They instantly offered us to change to another room and they would fix the heating problem before next guests would arrive later that day. After we came back from breakfast, our babbage was transfered to our new room: modern, stylish, very nice room, even much nicer than previous. The only problem from that on was that they obviously had some problems with room keys, as we had to go twice have the key cards rewritten. Location of the hotel is perfect, just a couple of minutes from Puerta del Sol on a busy street. Nearest metro station Sevilla is on the doorstep, 50mins from the airport with two transfers. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful whatever we asked, and we never had to wait for response. And a very big plus was free wifi in the rooms. Next time in Madrid, we won't need to think of any other place to stay than Regina: cleanliness, good service, location, and free wifi make it a perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: smarcy
Reviews.Content: I agree with the majority of reviews: the location is fanatastic, the staff is aloof but bearable especially if you speak Spanish. We were in Room 202, which was an ok size, was clean, contained the number of beds we needed, and had a nice bathroom. It also had a great view of the street, which was terrific during the day, but was full of honking cars, and loud drunks all night long. Even with earplugs we got very little sleep. As long as you're careful not to get a room that faces Alcala, the hotel is a good value. One last warning: the lobby of the hotel is full of cigarette smoke all day & all night, as is the cafe, since smoking is permitted in the cafe. For non-smokers it is distinctly unpleasant. Oh, and I was never able to get the free wifi...

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: getalonggang
Reviews.Content: Two of my sisters and I stayed at the Hotel Regina for three nights March 2010. The price, location and reviews from this site prompted us to book this hotel. We were thrilled when we stepped off of the metro and found the hotel immediately. It's in a lovely building and our room was spacious, classy, and clean. The bathroom was huge for a European hotel and lovely. This is the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in for this price. The staff was great and we were able to communicate fine with our basic knowledge of Spanish. If we are ever in Madrid again, we will definitely try and stay at this hotel. It's a gem. My sisters ate at the restaurant at the hotel and weren't terribly impressed, but there are some great restaurants nearby. Pans & Company is on the same street and has a pastry and coffee special each morning for around 1.75 Euros. We also ate at Fresc Co on Caballero de Gracia for a cheap buffet-style meal. It's a chain with unlimited refills for 10 Euros. On our last night we ate at La Gloria de Montera Restaurante on the same street as Fresc Co and had a really delicious meal for a reasonable price. Arrive early b/c there will be a line. Other recommendations for Madrid include taking a day trip to Toledo, and getting to the Royal Palace when it opens to avoid long lines.

Reviews.Title: “lovely room, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: graytowse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for exploring Madrid. It is pretty central and on a quiet street. We stayed in room 144 which appeared to be newly decorated with modern fittings. No problems at all with the room, in fact it seemed really good value for what we paid. Unfortunately, there was a staff service door close to our room and all we could hear until 12 midnight and from 6.30 a.m. was this door slamming every time a member of staff went through it which was often and at times constant. This totally spoiled our stay as we got so little sleep. Other than that, a real find and would stay again in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Choice, Great Location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WNY_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: I've been to Madrid before and I was looking for a better choice from my last hotel there. The Hotel Regina seemed like a good value with a good location. The hotel is surrounded by some beautiful banking buildings in Madrid and is near all major sites but not in a heavily traffic area like Gran Via. The lobby is large with ample seating and a restaurant. Check-in staff were pleasant but a little aloof. I first got a room with very strange directions. Part of the hotel is being renovated. After looking a couple of times I gave up and came back to reception and they gave me another room that was easier to find. My room was large with a decent sized bed, large pillows and large bathroom. There was an in room safe and a small tv. Wifi was free but as other reviewers mentioned very spotty. It kept working fine and then would stop working. It was very frustrating at times. Overall the hotel was okay with the decent price and great location. The decor was dated but functional. It's definitely a decent choice but there may be better choices in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the feel of the genuine helpfulness”
Reviews.Author: RiiaTepa
Reviews.Content: My mom and I (Riia) booked a standard room coming from Finland, and my brother and his family booked independently a superior room, coming from Bulgaria. I had emailed the hotel, in English, a few weeks prior to arriving, asking if we could have a smoking room and if they might be able to situate us close to each other. I never received a reply, but when we got there, it turned out we had a room on the same 5th floor as my bro’s family. Even though our room wasn’t as big as theirs, it was about the same in décor. They just had a bigger bed, which, sleeping with mom instead of my wife, would have been great – or at least we could have used two separate beds. They also had a bigger bathroom and the bedroom, but that was neither here or there, as the sizes of ours were bigger than most standard rooms. Same size balconies and the balconies were BIG. And even though the hotel had told us there’s NO SMOKING anywhere (except in its bar/café, or outside/inside by the sliding front doors), we of course broke the rules and smoked on the balconies (so sue us? Petty rules for petty people, or should I say the government of EU?). The staff was very friendly and helpful, although few of them knew English that well - usually better than my Spanish though! The location was great. Next door to several coffee shops, and only a block or two away from ‘the action’ like Gran Via and Puerta del Sol. If you want shops right by your hotel, this would not be it, you’ll have to walk a little, but they are not far. The food in their café/bar and in their restaurant are overpriced, but again, the service is incredible. For example, in the bar, they give you free tapas with drinks. Their restaurant probably keeps advertizing 50% off paellas, and when the ‘original price’ is 32 euros, the 16 euros is still way too much. Check out the Restaurant Paella de la Reina very close by – the quality of food is superior. But for the respect of the staff at the hotel, they found out the phone number of a (competing?) restaurant, and made us reservations. It’s hard for me to believe Hotel Regina is rated only 3 stars – I’d rate it at least 4. I very much enjoyed the stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Comfort,Value the three main requisites for an enjoyable stay-all achieved at the Regina”
Reviews.Author: BUCEPHALES
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Regina early March to visit the superb museums and explore the city. The hotel lived up to all the positive reviews. It's location is ideal. Right next door to the easy to use Metro making it great to get to and from Barajas airport (2 euros!!!) or if you need to go further out in the city. we were there for 4 days and our main reason to visit was the Prado,Reina Sofia,the Thyssens,the Retiro and the Royal Palace mixed up with a bit of shopping and general strolling through the streets of this vibrant capital. Madrid live up to and exceeded our expectations on all counts. The hotel was very clean, our room at the back of the hotel was very quiet from the noisy busy street. Our room (208) was comfortable with a well fitted bathroom and a telly which we did not use except to watch out for the weather reports. After walking all day we did not want to go searching for somewhere to eat and ate each evening in their restaurant. The menu del dia was superb value at 16euros for freshly cooked tasty food. We will remember the suckling pig which one could cut with your fork! The fish dishes were also superb. You could eat for a lot less in all the commercial eateries and other smaller restaurants, but none would exceed the comfortr or convenience of the Regina. The waitresses and the waiter were all very polite and helpful in translating the various menus. Exploring Madrid was magic. None of the main attractions (I do not include the football stadium) is far from the Regina. It's only 15-20 minutes walk to any of the big galleries or the Gran Via or the Plaza del Sol or the Plaza Mayor or El corte Ingles etc.etc. We felt comfortable at all times walking the streets and riding the Metro. Being pensioners entrance was free to the Prado and the Reina Sofia and much reduced at all the other sights. Take your passport to validate your age(over 65)they ask for it every time. The art at the Prado ,Sofia and Thyssens is without parallel and if you are into that ,you will be in heaven. History is everywhere and you will be aware that it is a capital city and very much the seat of power for the country,big cars,security and camera crews everywhere. Weather in March is always iffy and it was cold and rainy on a couple of days but it did not matter as we were indoors most of the time. We would recommend Madrid as a stimulating and marvellous place to stay ,and the Regina the hotel in which to rest and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....but conditions apply”
Reviews.Author: Seraphimo
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel Regina from February 25 - March 2, 2010. I was visiting Spain for the first time with my spouse and decided to choose Regina due to its great location. It is truly situated in a very nice area of Madrid, central to everything - metro (Seville - red line) and close to the Times Square of Madrid, Puerto del Sol. It has grocery stores, restaurants, museums, royal palace all within walking distances. For my LGBT friends, this is right next to the gay area of Chueca - so you can party all night and then walk back to the hotel. As for the hotel, the room we got was a back room #117, so it was away from Alcala street and hence no traffic noise. The room was comfortable and clean when we got there with enough closet space for the 2 of us. The bathroom has a walk in shower with good hot water. There are no bedside clocks here, as is the norm in any European hotel, so if you are used to it bring along a travel watch. The bed mattress was not too great in my opinion, I like a firm mattress and mine was squeeshy. The room is also safe as far as valuables storage is concerned - there is a safe in the room, I just put a lock on my bag when I was out. The rooms are a bit thin-walled, so if you have a noisy neighbor, you may hear it - I was lucky that way. The hotel staff were pretty helpful, we even left our bags there as our flight to Barcelona was much later at night and we had to check out by 12pm. The hotel does have a restaurant, Amayra, that offers a 2 for 1 dinner for about Euro32 that includes 2 courses, appetizer and a dessert. But there are so many tapas bars and restaurants around, you really do not need to eat there. The 2 biggest issues I had with the places were the bad internet service and the heavy smoke smell even in a non-smoking room - let me explain. The internet was WiFi in the rooms but was very touchy - the connection would keep dropping every few minutes and the best times to use it were either early morning or late nights. At peak hours, just about forget it!! I believe that any modern hotel should have good reliable internet service - if not do not advertize that you do have it. Secondly, the room I was in was a non-smoking room. However, I do not think all the rooms on the floor were. Also there was a lounge area just next to the room where people would light up. So the smoke would just permeate everywhere. At night I placed a damp towel next to the edge of my room door to keep the smoke out - it helped a bit. They need to organize the zones better so that it is truly a non-smoking room. Other than those 2 concerns, my stay was pleasant and enjoyable - Madrid is an awesome city and I may stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: kiroop
Reviews.Content: This is a greatly located hotel and rooms are very clean and spacious enough. Bathrooms are very clean and modern. The hotel is right by the metro and very close (5 minute walk) to Puerta Del Sol and less than 15 minute walk to most other attractions in Madrid. It was chilly when we went (about 40s during the day) but still it was bearable to walk everywhere. As far as the noise is concerned, it would have been a problem if we were staying for a week or so but being we were only there 4 nights it wasn't so bad. And if you tell the staff, they do try to accomodate and help lessen the noise (they switched us to different room since our first room was facing outside street and I also heard them telling the late night drinkers in the hallway to kindly go to their rooms). To make up for the disruption, they did give us complimentary buffet breakfast one of the days which was nice. All in all, I would stay here again but would definitely make sure to get an inside room. One more thing, I know we were in a non-smoking room but you can still smell smoke a little bit when others are smoking in their rooms. But I think I am a bit more particular about second-hand smoke than the average person. Also we got a great deal on the hotel for less than 100USD/night so I think we came out pretty well. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars is bc of the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, Restaurant, Location and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Sabicas
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel and it will be our hotel of choice for future visits to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: NyMellie
Reviews.Content: Hotel regina is in a perfect location. You can walk to Porta del Sol in a few minutes and easily get to many sites from there.Right by the Sevilla metro station. The lobby is a little cramped but how much time do you really spend there. Rooms a very clean and basic.The pillows are great. Staff is pleasant and helpful. The cafe is good but you can get plenty of cheaper breakfasts right next door. There are restaurants and cafes everywhere. You are in a great location for an unbelievable price. I would return here without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lipsticktraces
Reviews.Content: As I write this, I am spending my third night in the Hotel Regina. What a find! Located just steps from the Puerta de Sol (the Times Square of Spain) -- you can also walk out the front door and you're smack dab at the Sevilla metro stop. Walk fifteen minutes further and you're at the Prado museum, or go the other way and you're at Plaza Mayor! The current (Jan. 2010) rates on Expedia are exceptional for a hotel of this level. There's a bar, restaurant, room service, mini bar, free wi-fi, flat screen tv with cable/radio, laundry service, etc. Unlike many European hotels, you have room to move around the bed. There's a big closet and a safe (extra fee). I'm in an interior room and it is SUPER quiet. Front desk staff is uber professional and speaks English. Did I mention the pillows on the bed are out of this world? Do yourself a favor and stay *here*!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Denman2008
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I was confident in our choice of hotel. Me and my Mother travelled to Madrid for some sightseeing and managed to get a great deal on the hotel. Good Points... The city of Madrid is beautiful and the Hotels location is just brilliant, it has some brilliant restaurants and cafe's in the immediate vicinity, with a starbucks almost next door. The Plaza de la Puerto del sol is close by with everything you need, many souvenier shops even a Mcdonalds and Burger King! The hotel is within walking distance of pretty much all the attractions including the Museo del Prado, Palacio Real and famous Plaza Mayor which I highly recommend visiting. So if you are after somewhere where you can reach everything easily, pick the hotel regina! I completely recommend the hotel's restaurant and cafe for food and drink. The staff are very welcoming and we had a top class 3 course meal in the restaurant. We found both pretty pricey however nothing too outragous. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated to a high standard for a 3*, it was kept clean and had a nice vibe. We had a standard non smoking room and it was tastefully decorated and plenty big enough. The bathroom was lovely and the whole room was very clean. Staff at the hotel spoke perfect English and were very helpful allowing us to keep room on until evening and ordering us a taxi to the airport. Unlike some hotels i've stayed in beds were very comfortable. Bad Points... The only big problem we had was the noise. Our room was in the middle of the hotel at the top of a stairwell and although we couldn't hear any traffic from the front, we could hear everything else!! Other people have commented on the noise and the rooms certainly aren't soundproof. We could hear every word of everyones conversations both in the coridoors and in the neighbouring rooms! As we were only there 3 nights it didnt bother us too much but if you are staying longer definitely taking a pair of earplugs! Also don't even attempt a lie in, the housekeeping starts promptly at 7.30 am with the hoovering of the coridoors and sometimes doesn't finish til the evening! *If your travelling within the next few weeks be aware that when we stayed there was some minor redecoration going on which added to the noise level, nothing too drastic though. Everything is pretty expensive but then again it is anywhere the euro is to be honest, just make sure you choose wisely. The only other complaint we had was that our room looked out on the airconditioning shaft, not attractive! A small problem though. For us non-smoking Brits who have got used to the smoking ban, beware the cafe is the designated smoking area. I have no problem with people smoking inside at all, just not whilst I'm eating, it wasn't very pleasant. To be honest though these bad points are all minor and the good far outweigh the bad. Top Tips Definitely invest in a phrase book as we found many of the people spoke little or no English which can be a problem when ordering things. You can get by on the basic 'gracias' and 'por favor' but it's nice to make the effort. Remember your European adapter, we forgot ours which was a big problem. Luckily there is a huge department store in the Plaza de la Puerto del sol a bit like Debenhams which sells everything! If your sightseeing start your break with a tour on the open top bus it's a great way to see everything the bus stops are located outside hotel and you but tickets from the magazine stalls for 17euros. Always look at outdoor menus before you go in restaurants/cafes to gage prices. You dont want to get caught out paying 40 odd euros a head! Taxis from airport to hotel regina should be no dearer than 30euros, so dont be conned. Try to buy your euros before you go, because the rate seemed to be worse, I wouldnt recommend changing money in the hotel. If your room only, I recommend venturing to the plaza to buy some bottles of water and maybe snacks just in case you get thirsty or peckish and don't want to pay the pricy room service. Finally if your looking for great traditional spanish souveniers we found a gem of a shop on the right about 3/4 of the way down the Calle Mayor in the direction of the Palace. It sold beautiful things and was very reasonably priced. You have to see... Palacio Real - Madrid's Palace Cathedral Almudena - stunning stain glass windows which is located next to the palace Plaza Mayor - Lovely cafes and souveneir shops Botanical Gardens - But not in the winter. Museo del Prado - Amazing art gallery (free on Sunday afternoons) Plaza del puerto del sol - Fantatstic area of shops, tapas restaurants, bars. I would definitely recommend this hotel it is a perfect base for a sightseeing holiday, we had a great stay at the Regina and would go again to the beautiful city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Learmonth09
Reviews.Content: Right by the Sevilla metro station and near the main square. Rooms to the front of the hotel are large with a good view of the street, but noisy at night. We asked to change to a smaller, but still adequate, room at the back of the hotel which was fine and the hotel made no fuss about this. Rooms well appointed and clean although the bedlinen was well-worn and the carpet on the main stairs frayed. Breakfast at €15 was poor value if not included in room price, but there are plenty of small cafes close by if you are prepared to have breakfast Spanish style. There are a number of good restaurants close by which are a cheaper alternative to the hotel restaurant. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Claris22
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an amazing location! Metro stop right outside the entrance of the hotel, easy to walk to almost everything. We walked to the market, Reina Sofia, Prado, so easy to get around from this hotel. There are also great restaurants in the area, and a grocery store right down the street. The staff was really helpful and kind, overall I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paulh1941
Reviews.Content: There were seven in our family group, four rooms. They give us rooms next to each other in the new section, rooms were large and very clean, internet was good in all rooms but one. The location is excellent, next to subway, bus routes, Plaza Sol and close to Plaza Mayor and Prado. McDs, Dunken Donuts and excellent local restaurants three or four blocks, major shopping and grocery store in Plaza Sol. Enjoy great side trips to Segovia, Toledo or De El Escorial. Madrid Palace is a must see. Tip the Prado and Sofia are free after 5 or 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Tech&NAU
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Room was fine and bathroom nice. It's all about the location. Step off the Metro Seville and there is the hotel. To get anywhere in the city - walk down the street to the main station Sol and you can get anywhere. The neighborhood is very safe - and up scale. Check out the casino down the street and you will understand what I'm speaking of. And for an easy fast breakfast - Starbucks next door. Very welcoming staff - and very quick to the highspeed trains.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: Heyjude2009 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable 3 night stay in the Regina on a B & B basis. Breakfast was buffet style with a somewhat limited selection but had a choice of hot and cold items. This was included in our hotel deal. We had a triple room which was very spacious and cleaned to a high standard and an excellent shower room which also was a good size. There were no tea / coffee making facilities in the room but there were plenty of coffee shops situated locally so that was not a problem. There was renovation work going on in the hotel but it didn't affect our stay at all. On the first evening we dined in the hotel restaurant & enjoyed a lovely paella which was reasonably priced. I would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Adolfo1976
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I picked this hotel. I wasn't sure what to expect from $100.00 a night from Expedia. When I arrived my room was not ready, so we walked around and room was ready within an hour. I requested a queen bed so I got a room on the 1st floor next to cleaning staff. After an hour I requested a new room because the noise was too much for me to stay for 7 nights. The front desk guy was very nice and gave us the perfect room with double windows. My room was pretty big and clean, also Free WIFI. I would def. recommend this hotel to everyone. FYI the rooms are not soundproof but I didn't mind the neighbors noise at all. I will be staying at this hotel on my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kristinawhite10
Reviews.Content: I like to travel on a budget and I was very pleased with how nice Hotel Regina was for the price. It was very clean and modern inside and the rooms/bathrooms were a decent size. Everything was very clean and charming. The staff at the front desk and in the restaurant were very attentive and friendly. My sister and I speak Spanish fluently but the staff was also fluent in English and very helpful with recommendations for nearby dining and attractions. The hotel was walking distance to most of the big attactions in Madrid (The Palace, Plaza Mayor, Prado, etc..) and right near Gran Via which has good shopping and dining. Additionally there is a metro stop within a block of the hotel so you can get to almost anywhere in Madrid from the metro. I would definitely recommend Hotel Regina to anyone traveling to Madrid for personal or business interests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ebleimund
Reviews.Content: Overall we really liked this hotel. The Sevilla metro stop is literally right out front, Puerta del Sol and it's surroundings are just down the street, and in general the hotel was clean and staff was friendly. We could hear our neighbors at night, but it wasn't too bad. The bed was actually pretty comfortable, and they brought extra pillows on request. The in-room safe was free. The only real trouble we had was upon checking out, when we were handed a 120 euro bill for 4 breakfasts (2 people), even though the person checking us in had explicitly said that breakfast was included. I honestly couldn't remember whether it was supposed to be included, so I said "it is included?" and he confirmed that yes it was. We were happy about this, of course, as the breakfast was a good hot/cold buffet right downstairs. But then the check-out guy said that rooms booked on hotels.com or expedia never come with breakfast, but how were we supposed to know that? We insisted that we were told it was included, and gave them that there's-no-way-in-hell-we're-going-to-pay-this-bill face, and his colleague nudged him and he relented. We kept asking for the name of the guy who checked us in, but they didn't bother to look and just gave up. Anyway, that was kind of a negative way to end the experience, but overall we were happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Teal123
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to stay at the Regina because I usually prefer major chains but I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was nice and clean and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The bathroom is large and all marble with a spacious shower and toiletries provided. The reception staff spoke English very well and we used their advice many times. Calle de Alcala is beautiful but it's one of the busier streets and can get noisy. The windows do a great job in keeping the sounds out but if you leave them open you get the feeling of the city which really comes alive at night. We opted out of the breakfast since you can get one for a few Euros (including at the Starbucks next door). We also never tried the dinner since we were usually out around that time. The best thing about Hotel Regina was definitely the location. The hotel is in the center of the city, within walking distance to all of the major attractions. Sevilla metro station is at the hotel's doorstep and Sol (with 3 metro lines) is about a block away. Don't be afraid to walk to the Prado or to the Palace since they are about 15/20 min away with plenty to see on the way. Try Plaza St. Anna (5 min away) for lunch or dinner. There are plenty of restaurants with outdoor seating and great atmosphere. Our favorite were tapas with turkey and carmelized onion at El Lateral. Also, La Finca de Susana (2 min away) is great for dinner. Modern and well priced (bottle of wine for about 10 Euros).

Reviews.Title: “Classy great hotel, Fantastic location, book it!”
Reviews.Author: Happykiddo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September - it did not disappoint. All the hotels I read about with good reviews required long metro rides/walks to get into the centre of Madrid - not this one!! It is literally at Sevilla metro station which is 1 minute walk from Puerta Del Sol - the centrepoint of Madrid's tourism, shopping and nightlife. The hotel is on a street surrounded by amazing architecture and a few minutes walk to anything you'd want to see including the museums, tapas bars, shops and more. The hotel itself had a beautifully decorated lobby with comfy sofas and relaxing lighting. The room, although very minimal in furniture was huge and remarkably clean. The big beds were very comfortable with two types of pillow. Also each side of the bed had individual light controls which was nice. There was a huge plasma tv mounted on the wall with the usual channels, but we didn't watch much tv anyway. The bathroom was spotlessly clean - and the best thing about it was the lighting - I find hotels often have terrible lighting in the bathrooms - not this one. The shower was amazing - high pressure, no shortage of hot water. As the hotel is being renovated there were signs of the corridors being painted, but that never caused any problems for us or disturbed us. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel as the breakfast seemed expensive but the restaurant/bar looked very nice. All in all a great stay at a fantastic hotel - if you're looking for a central located hotel that is clean and comfortable and even classy - this is the one. For the price, it can't be beaten!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: I-work-too-hard
Reviews.Content: We travel to Madrid every year and each time look for a hotel that is clean, well positioned and value for money. With so much to do in Madrid, all we want is a clean hotel, in a central location. This hotel is perfect. Immaculately clean, the rooms were fairly basic but still had tv, hairdryer, toiletries etc. This hotel is outside of the Seville metro station so getting from the airport is a half hour trip on the metro ( same as all of the other centrally located hotels). The service was good and efficient with additional towels on a daily basis and a good housekeeping service. I would recommend the Room mate Alicia for a similar priced hotel which is a bit more modern but not quite in as good a location. Would return to the Regina as was excellent value for money when booked through expedia on a room only basis.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Basic”
Reviews.Author: cazpom
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. It's right outside the Sevilla metro stop, and only a block away from Sol. I had a single room that was very clean, but only the basics. I had minimal contact with the staff, but they seemed professional; I don't appreciate over-friendliness. They were able to answer any questions I had. I can't comment on the restaurant since I preferred eating out. Do not stay here if you expect to be pampered. If you're only looking for a place to sleep at night, pick the hotel (but only if you can get a good rate).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but probably wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: LindsSweet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the Hotel Regina in the standard room for 3 nights. The location really couldn't be better--in the heart of Madrid on Calle Alcalá and within walking distance to pretty much everything. Also, there is a metro stop (Sevilla) literally right outside the hotel, as well as a Starbucks. The walls in the hotel were paper thin and you could hear everything going on around you (it was quite noisy at night). There is also a lot of construction going on at the hotel. No view whatsoever from the room I stayed in, and the AC didn't seem to work very well (which can be a problem in the 90 degree heat). Furthermore, there were ants on the floor of my room (on the 4th floor). The bathroom was on the small side and with the shower setup, the water got everywhere. They offered a continental breakfast with a good variety of breakfast foods--yogurts, fruit, pastries, meats, cereal, etc. The rooms did have free wi-fi, which was nice. The staff was extremely nice and attentive to needs, but next time I would probably choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: ScottieTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we have stayed at the Regina. The hotel has a brilliant (central) location - across the road from the Santa Anna area (restaurants, tavernas, night-life, etc) and just a short stroll from Sol and Plaza Mayor. The metro station is just outside the hotel if you would rather not walk to the Retiro, Palace, Prado, Flea Market, etc. The rooms we have stayed in have been excellent (large, clean, well-serviced, etc) and, in our opinion, offer great value for money. The buffet breakfast is of a very good standard (range of pastries, juices and cold meats, fruit, tea/coffee, hot dishes, etc). Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for location, value for money and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice. Free Wi-fi in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: timer13
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on this hotel on Expedia and we were very pleased. We were probably given a room reserved for low rates. It had no view and was on the same floor with offices, housekeeping, and meeting rooms. The room itself was very nice with a huge bathroom. It was cool and quiet until 9am when housekeeping staff began noisily retrieving their equipment from the storage closet next to our room. This was not a problem for us as we were ready to get up by that time. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers BEWARE.... HOTEL REGINA, keep all valuables locked at all times, thefts do occur from your room!”
Reviews.Author: sunnigirltravel
Reviews.Content: Staff seems rushed & unpleasant most of time, especially if you don't speak fluent spanish. $1200 digital camera stolen from room. Felt safe & comfortable enough to leave camera in room, in carry on bag, in closet & it was "lifted". We had in possession at all times, except one day while out. LOCK ALL VALUABLES. Staff not helpful in assisting with claim :(

Reviews.Title: “Close To Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BBSLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: Location is a short walk to Sol and Plaza Mayor. Really close to everything. Free Internet in the rooms. Beds were comfy...or many we were just exhausted? TV's good and plenty of English channels. Desk clerks all friendly and helpful...and entire staff is very professional and polite.

Reviews.Title: “ear plugs needed”
Reviews.Author: peterspain_8
Reviews.Content: Good central location large parking garage and underground station in front of the hotel Maybe bad luck, our room (234) was very noisy; in spite of being in the back of the hotel street noise etc kept us a wake half the night. The room was very tired specially the bad room. But it was clean and cheap euro 59 per night is a good price for this location. If you want to sleep I would ask for the inner court rooms no views but also not the same noise. the good news was the service was good and wifi for free

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to HOHO buses, sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: daryleann
Reviews.Content: With the subway right next to the doorway and the Hop On/Hop Off bus stops within 2 blocks, the location of this hotel is fabulous. Upon arrival, we were a bit put off by the loud noises from the bar almost in the lobby, but our room was very quiet. Breakfast was quite adequate and I had to force myself to stop trying different things as there would be other days! We did not use the restaurant otherwise. We did not use the metro as it was so easy to walk to sites we wanted to see, either on own or from the HOHO bus. Lots of little eating places in the general vicinity. The room was not cramped altho not large, but the bathroom was nice and roomy. It was hard to read in bed, as the lighting wasn't great, but we were usually too tired anyway. Internet was available in the hall - for a charge. It was usually 'down' the four days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, acceptable rooms”
Reviews.Author: JMGBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, heart of the city, close to major places. The common areas are nice and very well decorated. There is only one elevator on my side of the hotel that made moving up and down very slow specially when big groups checking in. Room was kind of small with a very tiny window but clean and tidy. The hotel web shows other type of room so I guess there a bit o everythoing. Wifi was slow. Breakfast was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJBruss
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Regina Hotel in November, 2008 - Group of eight girls celebrating a friends special birthday. Hotel is in a great location, very near centre and all that is going on and near metro for links to other parts of city. We felt safe walking to and from hotel day and night. The Hotel is very clean, rooms are nice, dated but now refurbished some rooms odd shape but serviceable with good beds and storage space, mini bar and safe, good bathroom facilities. Breakfast is buffet hot and cold foods and plenty of selection, best I have come across in a while. Reception staff and in general staff in hotel very friendly some spoke english well. The bar is busy and seems to be used as a meeting point - bar staff friendly - english ok. Hop on hop off bus tour good (can be cool on open top dress warm) was to see city. Some great tapas bars near Playa Mayor (better than eating expensive food in square) I looked at hotels around and for the few euro extra I definately return to Hotel Regina. Madrid is a great lively city with lots to do. We had a great time. I liked it so much I have a return visit planned 29th Jan. Guess where I stay? Hotel Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina Madrid”
Reviews.Author: yorkshire101
Reviews.Content: The Regina is the perfect hotel for a short break in madrid. on a quiet street but close to the centre, 2 minutes walk from the Puerta del sol square, and 5 minutes from the Plaza Mayor, within 15 minuets walk you can see all the major attractions. the underground is out side the front door First impressions as you enter are this is a 4* not a 3* hotel. Rooms are very clean, a little small but this is made up for by the top class bathroom,staff are very helpful, a very good breakfast (Hams,cheese,cereal,toast,and cakes ) I would recomend this hotel to anybody wanting a good hotel competitivly priced in a central location. Only one thing to watch,we booked via a hotel booking company online,most sights only priced the regina for a room ,breakfast was extra , one had it at the same price included ,we took our booking details with us because on checkout the hotel try'd to charge us 10 euros per day . on seeing the paper work they admited their mistake, we could not have asked for a better stay

Reviews.Title: “So pleased to have discovered the Regina in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Alondra1b
Reviews.Content: We booked our room using "CentralRv"site, and saved $200 over Expedia. The Regina is beautifully located, within walking distance of many museums, including the Prado, as well as shopping and Plaza Mayor. The room was adequately furnished, no frills, the beds very comfortable, TV and free wi-fi. We were particularly impressed with the cleanliness of every part of the hotel. A bar/cafe and a separate restaurant offer good food and snacks 8am to midnight. There are also many excellent places to eat from elegant restaurants to colorful tascas one can walk to, theaters also nearby. The staff is professional and friendly. Would recommend for seniors like us, as well as young families or businessmen. Prices very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard for the heart of a capital city”
Reviews.Author: marbf2000
Reviews.Content: Great standard for the heart of a capital city . Ask for a newly renovated room and if it´s a double that you need you will get one with a double bed ( not the standard 2 singles put together ), away from the noisy street . A very central hotel ,and very clean .Perfect to explore Madrid . The only problem I came came across was the loud cleaners early in the morning cleaning the other rooms , but nothing that a quick phone call to reception wouldn´t solve . Overall a nice clean hotel , defenitly recommended .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Travelyst
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regina is centrally located, and within easy walking distance of great dining, shopping and sightseeing. The rooms were large enough that we could relax comfortably, and the bathroom was also a nice size for two people. Our room faced the street, and we had a nice balcony and could open our windows to watch and listen to all the hustle and bustle below us. Although the city has quite a nightlife, street noise was NOT a problem once we closed our windows. The staff was very friendly and professional. The rooms (and all other areas, as far as I could tell) were well maintained and clean. Breakfast was substantial and very good. All in all, this was a wonderful place to stay while visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: WymeswoldVets
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of 15 staying at the Regina from Friday 26th to Saturday 28th September, and to be honest we didn't spend much time at the hotel as we were out enjoying ourselves. The hotel itself is OK - clean, simple and in a great location. Our rooms were all OK without being special, but the main selling point is the location bang in the centre of Madrid, within easy walking distance of all the major sites, galleries, parks and squares. The Regina is right opposite the Sevilla Metro staion, so access is easy, and it's about a 2-minute walk from Sol. Some tips: - On arrival at the airport, buy the combined Bus/Metro pass which is valid from the airport and all around town. The transport network is superb - they've pumped millions into it recently - and the ticket is really cheap. 11 Euros for three days unlimited is teriffic value - Check out the 'Museum of Ham' just by the Place Major. It's a bit wacky and you can drink there until about 2am. Our group were there drinking until the close, and the total bill for 15 guys drinking heavily all night was 60 Euros. We legged it before they realised their mistake. - Beware that there are pickpockets and thieves everywhere - espcially around the Sol area. I had my phone stolen at 4am, but realised and got it back from the bloke after I threatened him. He then gleefully showd me his collection of phones he'd stolen that night! Be very careful if anyone comes over to you like an old friend, shakes hands and pats you on the back. You may just find that your phone / wallet has just gone. Otherwise, hotel is fine and Madrid is good fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: amyzing
Reviews.Content: We are a Canadian couple who booked this hotel as part of a package from Air Transat. I have checked the price for the hotel alone on Expedia.ca and it was going for $250 a night for the week that we stayed there (July 29-August 5). If I ever go back to Madrid, it has to be to this hotel! I have travelled all throughout Europe, and the room at the Regina was the average European-sized room, smaller than our North American rooms, but I didn't feel cramped. But thank goodness it was summer and the windows were closed because we did not have a pretty view from the window (we were on the fifth floor). The a/c in the room was not as cold as we would have liked it but we slept fine until the last night when the a/c broke. But I think this had something to do with the intense heat in the city and the constant use of the a/'c throughout the hotel and city! Our safe was programmed to lock and unlock with the swipe of one of our credit cards which I thought was a fantastic idea. They asked us for a credit card at check in and we had no idea why so we were a little worried, but the porter who brought our luggages to the room explained that the credit card would lock and unlock the safe! Brillant! Breakfast was better than I have had in other European hotels, there was porridge, eggs, sausage, croissants, doughnuts, cereals, cold cuts, cheese, bread, fruit salad, sliced fruit, pudding, yoghurt, Spanish tortilla (potato and egg omlette- yum!) a coffee machine, and a juice machine. This was a real money saver for us, as we didn't really need to eat lunch with such a big breakfast! We are not picky eaters so there was more than enough to satisify us! The first few days the cleaning lady forgot to give us our towels, one night we called front desk, the other time we caught up with her in the hallways, and from that point on, we never had to ask. She did a great job cleaning the room, we would walk back in and smell the lemon cleaner! I think they clean first and replenish towels later, so they either forget or we returned too early! What really impressed me about this hotel is how clean it was. Madrid in general is a clean city, but they had cleaning staff working at 10:30 night, washing the lobby walls! Incredible! Another thing I enjoyed was its close proximity to the metro and to Puerta del Sol. We would walk down there every night, the hotel is a 10 minute walk to great shopping, and food. If you don't always feel like eating out, you can visit the El Cortes Ingles supermarket (the entrance is just off Via Precioso) and pick up some munchies. Also, El Museo fel Jamon (not a museum but a deli) offers 'picnics to go', a ham sandwhich, a drink (pop or beer), and a fruit for 2 euros, and this is close to the hotel. Because in general, I found eating out in Madrid to be much pricier than expected. Madrid is a fantastic city, I really enjoyed myself there, but it was HOT!!!! Avoid visiting in the summer, but if you are a teacher like me and have no other choice, good luck! We quickly fell into the typical Madrileno pattern of eating a late lunch (when we did eat lunch) around 2, napping, and then eating a late dinner. The sun did not set until around 9:30 at night, and it cooled down to about 30 degrees celsius at night., so pack accordingly. Some highlights in Madrid: -the hop on hop off tour has two great lines! -the Prado (international teachers get in free!) -the Thyssen and Reina Sofia are much smaller than the Prado but have some really cool pieces -Retiro Park- awesome! -Royal Palace -he Cathedral of Madrid- make sure you climb to the roof top for a great view of the city -cable car trip from West Park to Casa do Campo -Egyptian temple in West Park -SHOPPING- Madrid is a fantastic place to shop- we found that every place accepted credit cards but they need photo id, so make sure you have it with you. And if you can, take a bus from the Padre Pio station to Segovia for a chance to see Roman aqueducts in fantastic shape and the Alcazar fortress where the Catholic 'King' Isabella was crowned Queen of Spain! Note that the Cerralbo Museum was closed for renovations while we were there- unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: GP45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regina from 25th - 29th August 08. It is perfectly located, just a few metres from the Sevilla metro to the front door of the hotel. Madrid was very hot and the cool air that greeted us as `we entered the hotel was just what we needed. However, it wasn't like that in our room and we baked. Air con really poor. We also asked for a double bed when we booked and were given two singles. The hotel staff were very happy to change the room but as the first one overlooked the main street and the second overlooked the back yard, we decided to stay put. The breakfast was plentiful but we thought it was boring and poor quality and we had to ask for towels and toilet paper as we were left without either! Our main concern was security. The hotel has this crazy system of the door swipe card also being the swipe card to lock and unlock the safe, so it seemed likely that cleaning staff would also have access to the room safe. We couldn't get ours to work anyway and having read reports of theft at the hotel decided we wouldn't leave anything of value in the room at all. I had my purse stolen from my bag on our last night. It was deftly removed as we crossed the Plaza Saint Ana. Lost a lot of cash, my metro ticket and two credit cards. The hotel staff were helpful but how I wish the security in the hotel had been better! Due to the heat and the theft, we basically had a lousy time in Madrid and couldn't wait to get on the plane and head for home. Shame really, as I had booked it to celebrate my husband's 60th b'day. Think it was the worst b'day we have ever spent and certainly won't forget that one in a hurry! Would unreservedly recommend the hotel for location and the room though basic was a decent size. However, I will NEVER go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: ScottieTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Regina from 21-28 August 2008. As mentioned in other reviews the location is superb - easy 5/10 minute walk to all main tourist attractions. Our room on the 4th floor was clean, of a good size and well-serviced. The buffet-style breakfast can be what you make of it - juices, fruit, hot food (sausages, bacon and scrambled eggs), croissants, toast, cold meats, cheese, etc, etc. The Santa Ana area is an easy 5 minute stroll from the hotel - great selection of tavernas and restaurants. The tapas-style restaurants can be excellent value for money. A must is the Sunday flea market (10/15 minute walk) followed by a stroll in the Retiro. Watch out for con men in streets pretending to be tourists and try not to leave handbags on floors in restaurants (they all too easily disappear).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina - Great Positioning for a great city”
Reviews.Author: keith2214
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, smack bang in the centre of Madrid and inches away from Sevilla metro station( on the other side of the street opposite the hotel). 2 minutes walk away from shopping and ideally situated for all the attractions. 35 minute metro ride from the airport and your in the hotel. The food was great but watch out for Manuel from Fawlty Towers in the bar, I jest you not! The 2 chinese girls running the bar are great and speak great english. I would have no hesitation in going there again. There a Starbucks 2 doors down with english speaking staff. We went in the first week in August were the temperature topped 45 degree's - leave your jumpers at home. Madrid is a very safe city with loads of police around (and I mean loads)! Take plenty of cash, Madrid is not exactly credit card friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this 3-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioSunSeekers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Regina Hotel in Madrid. The location is excellent. It is an easy walk to both the Royal Palace area and the Prado Museum area. Puerto del Sol is a two minute walk, which is where we were able to catch a direct subway line to either train station for day trips. For our family of four we had two large rooms at the back of the hotel, each with large windows that opened. Rooms were clean and kept that way with thorough cleaning each day, complete with fresh towels. Beds were very comfortable. Each room had a safe. The temperature ranged from 25 to 40 degrees C during our stay, so we were pleased at how comfortable the air conditioning kept the rooms.
