Breakfast was good, with fresh and canned fruit, eggs, bacon, cold cuts, cheese, bread, buns, croissants, yogurt, cereal, juice, a good variety of tea and coffee. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Most spoke some English. Regina Hotel is an excellent 3-star hotel in the centre of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: S_G_Taylor
Reviews.Content: Great central location - we could walk everywhere we needed to go. The rooms we were given (3 single travellers) were dreadful. They stank of smoke and one was uninhabitable due to being above the kitchen and the smell of food was overpowering. The rooms themselves were like something time forgot. I seem to remember sticking to the carpet. Extremely depressing. We asked to be changed and the staff could not have been more helpful. Admittedly we would have liked to have moved that day but they told us to pack out bags in the morning and they would move everything for us. They obviously get asked this a lot as they didn't question it. They did move us the next day into the refurbished rooms and they were fine. Not outstanding but not bad at all. Breakfast was poor by business hotel standards but quite edible. Would stay there again if the price was right and I could guarantee a refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regina - Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugDonegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for 3 nights and found that the location was very good. The breakfast was also fine but the double room was very small and cramped with well worn carpets. It was also gloomy as it looked onto a back yard type of space. Hotel staff were quite indifferent. I asked to book a transfer to the airport and to check back to have it confirmed, It wasn't so I had to request it again the next morning, then to find the company were booked out, so we had to book a taxi at much higher rates. I had forgotten my phone charger and asked for one for a few hours, one man at reception said he had none but a second man came forward to offer it....it seemed to depend on who exactly was on reception. Generally not helpful. All in all, I wouldn't return to this hotel. On a good note, shopping in Madrid was very good especially for nice leather shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Retiro Park”
Reviews.Author: Forgottensage
Reviews.Content: This large hotel is in a great location. You can walk to world famous art galleries in twenty minutes; it's close to the subway and the very lovely and wonderful Retiro Park. Thick trees line the main boulevard. Three different double-decker open topped tourist bus lines run through the city, the leaves literally traveling just feet above your head . . . wonderful enchanting tours of Madrid. At nighttime the same lines give entirely different impressions - you can get on and off the buses at will. Retiro Park is quite immense, with a lake and places to relax and have lunch at. The hotel rooms are cozy and expensively decorated. The only negative I would share is that Spaniards are often extremely formal. You can be lost in the beauty of Madrid but have a hard time getting anyone to engage you in conversation. The longer you stay in one place, they will begin to befriend you, but you must be patient, if that is one of your goals. Another traveler had thousands of euros ripped off from their hotel room at this site, so if I stay here again, I will not use the safe nor leave my money in my suitcase. Each floor of the hotel has quirky art, just off the elevator or stairs. Lots of statues and unusual art adorning the large buildings of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful!!!”
Reviews.Author: karolinka_81
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel 4 years ago, and found it really perfect!!! Location is excellent, rooms very comfortable.. so, I was really enjoyed my staying there, that is why I decided to choose Hotel Regina again for my visit to Madrid this March.. but it was a real mistake!! Please, think twice before book this hotel... I was there with my friends, so we booked 2 DBL rooms, and everything was OK till the last day, when we found that our money and other personal things were stolen from our rooms!!!!! Totally they took 2500 Euro (all cash that they found in both rooms) and fotocamera....The safety boxes doesn't worked in both rooms, and when we asked on the reception to repair it, thay said us, that they will do, but they didn't.... that is why we kept our money in our locked (!) suitecases!!! And finally our money disappeared....No doubt, that it was somebody from the hotel staff, who has an access to the rooms. When I told everything to the hotel manager and asked him to help us, and find out who could "visit" our rooms, he was terribly rude with us, he strongly "reccomended" us to go to the police, but he personally will not do anything, and also he said us, that we lost our money somewhere, and now trying to blaim him!! Of course, now it's impossible to get back our money and do something.. but please, do not make our mistake and choose another accommodation.... otherwise you could pay much more for your staying at the excellent 3*** Regina Hotel in Madrid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Position perfect, overall average”
Reviews.Author: Ian
Reviews.Content: Just return from 5 nights at the Regina. On arrival given room 325 , on entering room found very hot, tried air conn to no avail, opened windows to find we were on third floor over kitchens, smell of food awful. Went to reception who advised hotel full for night, but would move us tomorrow as only 13.00 hrs and other people yet to arrive seemed odd we could not move, at 9.30 nect morning the manager advised we would be moved at mid day. Moved to 4th floor and rear of hotel, lovely room (as was 325), but you could still hear people talking in street below with windows shot and metal blinds down. Breakfast had a range of food but same daily offer after 3 mornings could not face same choices again. Rooms are large, with good linen, very clean and good bathrooms with power shower heads, no tea/.coffee making facilities. Staff were very helpful but could not understand as we were staying for 5 nights why we should have been issued with a room that was barely adequate for a 1 night stay. Finally however the position is excellent, metro yards away, hop on/off bus 100 yards for either route, surrounded by tapas bars and restaurants, would stay again even with bed and food issues because of position.

Reviews.Title: “Allright for me -- Poor for my travel companion”
Reviews.Author: bene
Reviews.Content: It's one of the few places I could find with four beds in a room (2 adults and 2 children). There is one part of the hotel that is newer and another part that is older not renovated. My wife was disappointent with an older room given the price we paid, but hey this is Madrid and the Euro. I found it allright and very central to all the things we wanted to do - bus tour, old city walk, shopping, restaurants... I would say you could do worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: gshamis
Reviews.Content: Madrid is known to be difficult for people who don't speak Spanish, and we didn't. Hotel stuff knew enough English to make our dealing with them not overly difficult. They didn't ask if we wanted 2 beds or 1 so we ended up with the wrong one. Hallways and lobby are nice and clean. Our room had a really nice bathroom with 2 sinks. It only had 1/2 bath-tub enclosure so taking a shower wets the floor and doesn't keep the heat in. It had a modern safe with a lock triggered by any credit-card -- so u don't have to memorize combination or carry a key. Included breakfast was Ok ,but not at all healthy. Also the internet service is disappointing. It's not in the room -- it's in the lobby and it's 3Euros/15min or if you have your own device it's 6Euro/hour from Telefonica only in the lobby (u can't use it 3 times 20min each, single use 1h) The front desk did offer to book tours for us, but we didn't 'cause we thought that 50Euros for 1/2 day and 89-130Euro for full-day is way too much at 1Euro=1.49$ We were disappointed at the end of our stay when they booked us a shuttle but refused to help us figure out which terminal we were flying from (we were going to Barcelona) and if our flight was on time -- so we had to do it using their non-free internet access

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: audscb_07
Reviews.Content: My parents and uncle stayed in a triple room in the Regina Hotel in Madrid. It was a holiday weekend and I had a really hard time finding a triple room for this week. This hotel had received mixed reviews, from excellent to very poor. My parents received a very nice reception when they arrived with both the reception staff and the porter being extremely helpful. (Every one of the bags was brought up to the room) The room itself was furnished in a bright colours with a wooden floor, the beds were very comfortable. The only things I would point out were, for a triple room there was not much wardrobe space. And, as in a previous comment, the bathroom door consisted of smoked glass. This is a little impractical for a mixed group but it was livable with. There is air-conditioning and heating in the rooms. The room was an "interior" which means that any windows open onto the internal shaft of the building. Personally, I didn't see this as a problem. You can open the windows and get some fresh air and if you want to see the views - step outside the hotel! You couldn't ask for a better location! And reception will help with booking tour buses and maps of the city. My parents did not have breakfast in the hotel but there are three different coffee shops - if not four - right outside the hotel so there was no problem there! My parents were very happy with the hotel and would recommend to any other visitors. They also had a problem with the room safe - I think this is down to the instructions being incorrect. It was sorted out after we contacted reception, not really a problem

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: RJEK
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the helpful staff when we arrived at the Regina. With limited Spanish (maybe 2 words like vino tinto) we had to confirm an onward flight. The reception staff offered to do this for us, even providing the boarding gate information and booking our airport shuttle for us. The room was spotless, not huge but perfectly comfortable. In fact the presentation of the hotel overall was excellent, very well maintained. Only two nights there but the location is good, with a metro station at the front door and a maze of small streets only a short walk away with great choice of restaurants and cafes. Again providing excellent service, the staff at reception kindly offered to organise an early breakfast for us as we had a 6.30am shuttle (before the dining room opened). Would recommend this hotel for its great presentation, friendly and very helpful staff, and convenient location in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: bhooj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Regina in Mid October, 2007. First of all, the location of the hotel is excellent. It is within a 2-3 minute walk of both great nightlife districts and great shopping districts. The Prado museum is a 15 minute walk. The room was clean, and the bathroom was great. My wife especially liked the hair dryers. Breakfast served was standard buffet, nothing special. The beds were fairly firm, but comfortable. Would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A dump in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ecortez01
Reviews.Content: From the lobby, the Regina doesn't look so bad. Once you see your room though, you'll want to leave. The rooms are extremely small (smaller than a London hotel room), out of date, and not terribly clean. The downstairs restaurant probably won't make you sick, but you won't enjoy it either. The hotel is, however, in a terrific location. Right on Calle Alcala, a couple of blocks off of the Grand Via, and right on a Metro line (unfortunately it's a metro line that only goes north and east, so it's not that helpful). If your looking for a place to throw your bags while enjoying Madrid's nightlife, the location can't be beat. If, however, you want a decent bed, and a bathroom that was updated since WWII, then skip the Regina. (If you want location and a good hotel, try the Hotel Urban a few blocks away--more expensive, but so much better.)

Reviews.Title: “would be happy to reccomend”
Reviews.Author: bellarita
Reviews.Content: Booked with a friend for 4 nights B&B room allocated was next to the lift and could have been noisy on requesting a change of room we were advised none available at that time which we accepted. Next day we were give a much nicer room without any problem. Staff very helpful and polite rooms clean and spacious hairdryer could be better though. Breakfast ok though would have liked some "Fresh" fruit rather than canned but value for money was given Location first class next to metro and within walking distance of major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: SuaveUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in september and were not impressed at all. First off the customer service was horrible. There was no greeting no hello or anything, they just gave us our key and shewed us to our room. It felt like we were bothering them by coming to there hotel. When we got to our room we were greeted by 2 twin beds a cracked wall and iron burned carpet that looked how i felt when i see it.. like THROW UP!. As far as the location it was great, really close to everything and quiet. I would not recommend this place if you are planning a trip to madrid. Good luck, you've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: lousally
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Regina in Madrid earlier this month. I really can't fault this hotel. Our room was very nice, with 2 big single beds pushed together - lots of room (I hate those tiny double beds where you can't move!) with a large en suite bathroom that had everything we needed. I had read some reviews about noise from the street, but our room was on the top floor facing the back and we heard absolutely no noise at all. My only tiny little niggle was that none of the hangers in the wardrobe had the little hooks on them, so when I hung my skirts and dresses on them - they slid off! Breakfast was the usual buffet style with the usual selection that you get pretty well anywhere, which is fine. But the best thing about this hotel is the location. You really cannot get any better. Dead opposite the old town, a few minutes walk from the other attractions, and if you're really lazy there's a metro stop (Sevilla) literally outside the door. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to see Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WinemerchantPoole
Reviews.Content: Great location 5 mins Puerta Del Sol,5 mins Santa Ana,10 mins Plaza Mayor.Room was good size,with large marble bathroom,free safe and new wood flooring.Cafe bar in hotel was good,packed every morning.Absolute bargain at 65 euros a room.Staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel My Family Has Ever Stayed In !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cajncritter
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after looking at it on the internet and through a travel agent. When we checked in, they did not honor our reservation for a king bed and gave my husband and I 2 twins at a higher , which were not acceptable. Our kids had the same type of room at a lower price. Then they gave us a TINY room!!!!!! My husband could lay across the bed and have his feet touch the wall and his hands on the other wall. He is 6 feet tall. The shower / tub was 30 inches long and 18 inches wide. Only 2 towels, no wash cloths and every time we got addtional towels, the housekeeping staff would take them out of the room. We couldn't even open our suitcases and still walk to the bathroom. We sent laundry out and three days later we had to demand that it come back. It came back in a bag and WET as we were checking out of the hotel one day early as we could no longer tolerate this place. The desk staff was rude and were not helpful. Internet access was costly. Breakfast was "supposed" to be included in the room cahrge and it was not !!! Old bait and switch tactics !!!!!! HORRIBLE PLACE !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location!”
Reviews.Author: verymerry
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying at this hotel - breakfast was included in the price and the food was good. The hotel had a nice reception area and great sized rooms, and the bathroom had double sinks. The only downfall was the bed - we wanted a double sized bed or bigger but we got 2 twin beds pulled together - but once inside they were very comfy. The metro is literally a few steps from the hotel entrance which is great if you are getting around by train. The hotel is in a great location with many restaurants, stores, and cute squares within walking distance. The hotel can also arrange for you to get a shuttle to the airport which worked out great (20 euros for 2 people). We would defintely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Madrid; Regina was OK”
Reviews.Author: KellyPaige
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Regina for 3 nights in a triple room. The hotel is conveniently located very close to Puerta del Sol. The staff was NOT friendly and the breakfast was not very good. Our room had hardwood floors and a nice size bathroom. The location is really what saves this hotel. Also, there is a Starbucks directly next door and a Pan & Co. (a fast-food type place with very good sandwiches!) near too. There is also a VIPS which is good for a late night snack. The Regina was fine for us because we just needed a decent hotel with a good location for a short 3 night stay. Metro stop is right outside the front door (very, very convenient). The metro in Madrid is amazing and really easy. We were all over the place for just 1 euro a ride! Just grab a metro map and go. Oh yeah, try to not get ripped off getting a taxi to and from the airport. We got ripped off on our way to the hotel. I don't think the ride should be more than 20 euros, but I would e-mail the hotel and ask them a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malteso
Reviews.Content: Complaints of Hotel Regina Madrid - (1) Beware of bait and switch tactic with breakfast charges, (2) During the online booking process, no indication is made whether the room rate quoted included taxes and other charges, yet I was billed a tax of 7%, and (3) Except for bellman and maids, Hotel Regina Madrid staff was impolite and inhospitable. In April 2007, I reserved three rooms through the hotel’s website, for three nights for twelve persons beginning June 16, 2007. The hotel website facilities are provided by Central Reservations Limited (CentralR.Com). Upon checking in the early morning of June 16, 2007, we were told by front desk staff, unequivocally, that breakfast was free, i.e. included in the room price. Most of us ate breakfast for two mornings. Upon checking out, we noticed that breakfast charges of 12 euros for each breakfast, had been added to our bill. I questioned the breakfast charges, and was told by front desk staff, that breakfast was an additional fee. I indicated that hotel front desk staff had informed us at check-in that breakfast was free. Front desk staff told me that individual was not available to confirm what I was saying. Front desk staff then told me breakfast charges were additional because the online booking form did not indicate that breakfast was included in the room fee, huh? I responded that there was no reference to breakfast charges at all in the online booking process, thus the online booking form was not any substantiation for the hotel’s basis for charging the breakfasts. Hotel staff refused to remove the charges. Upon returning home, I contacted the hotel about the matter. I further explained that I had saved copies of every web page of the on-line booking to justify what I was saying. Again Hotel Regina staff refused to reimburse the inappropriate breakfast charges. I also contacted CentralR.Com about the matter. CentralR.Com sent a form communication stating “…we will endeavour to reply to your request as soon as possible”. As of this writing, I have not received another response from CentralR.com. No indication was made on the booking forms and subsequent confirmations that taxes and surcharges would be charged in addition to the room rate. Yet upon checkout we were charged an “I.V.A.” tax of 7% on the room rate, breakfast charges, and other charges. I have traveled extensively over the past thirty years and have stayed at literally hundreds of hotels of all sizes and class. I can unequivocally state that the Hotel Regina Madrid, except as previously noted, had the most impolite and inhospitable staff I have ever experienced in a hotel environment. We are still bewildered by this experience because we treated all Spaniards professionally and respectfully. Please feel free to contact me for details.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mrsv1cky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the hotel Regina ofor 3 nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. On arrival at 23:00 they tried to put us in a twin room even though we had booked and paid for a double room - this was soon sorted and a double room was found for us. The rate was very reasonable at €70-€80 per night. The room was very clean and tidy, it did have a window but had no view. The bathroom was a nice large size with a shower (always hot water), there was a hair dryer but it only blew very slowly and it was cold air - for anybody who has long or thick hair - I would advise you to take your own hair dryer as it will take you forever to dry your hair otherwise. The Metro was fantastic, from the airport it took 40 mins and cost no more than €3 per person - then its just across the road to check into the hotel. The Metro is also good for getting around the different areas there. I was also advise a walk or Metro trip to the park which is beautiful. We would stay in the hotel again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Regina Hotel a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: palpal
Reviews.Content: Wonderful central location with metro station just 10 meters in front of the hotel, large tastly decorated room, good breakfast but not much various. Room minibar and safety box were not working even after repeated reports. Staff not particularly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel; excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mh19
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Regina. It's quite reasonably priced, and, in my view at least, offers good value for the outlay. The room was very comfortable, with decent beds and a particularly nice ensuite bathroom. Staff are helpful and efficient, and will be willing to help you to organise sightseeing tours etc. Furthermore, it is excellently located, being literally in the very centre of the city. Overall, a very pleasant and conveniently located hotel which I would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not sure it was worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GazzatheGrumpy
Reviews.Content: Let's say one thing first - you won't get much more central than this in relation to Sol, Pl Santa Ana and suchlike; it's a mere five minutes walk to Santa Ana and the two brewpubs there (what we went for!). However... okay, it's a nice hotel and all that, but either we were unlucky with the room (quite small and facing a little ventilation shaft) or the place adds on a little extra for it's location. Everything worked fine, the bed was very comfy, we had no real complaints - there's a metro station literally outside the front door for getting around the city - but I've had much better hotels elsewhere for less money, that's all, and I couldn't find a cheaper price than I got the room for anywhere else on the web. Overall a good, well-located hotel, but get a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Room Very Small”
Reviews.Author: jenkiki
Reviews.Content: Madrid was great but the hotel room was very small. There was barely any walking room. The hotel itself looked great in the restaurant and lobby area. The breakfast was good with what it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & good room”
Reviews.Author: Mollicolli
Reviews.Content: Location is absolutely perfect: near everything but quiet, smart restaurants and cafès nearby, safe. Breakfast waas very good, lot of choice and quality above the average. Rooms are of very different quality. At first we had an awful room with the carpet and an old bathroom, but we asked for a room without carpet because of my husband's asthma and they immediately gave us a perfect room newly refurbished, the one in the web pictures, for the same price (of course!!). That room was quite spacious, nice and clean, with a very comfortable bathroom. It was on the interior side, so really dark, but we didn't matter. Staff very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very dark room”
Reviews.Author: laura777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights (12th-16th jan) , have to be honest the room was very dark with no natural light if you put your head out of the window and looked up you could just see the sky .Room was very hot and the a/c didnt work , also as our stay included a weekend it was exceptionally noisy with guests still partying at 4 am .Breakfast at 12 euros I thought was expensive but only ate there once , loads of other places to eat .Now for the positives extremely good location with the metro being right outside the door which at 1 euro a trip was great for getting around .I would stay at the Regina again but would insist on a better room

Reviews.Title: “Let's be honest here”
Reviews.Author: Wallstseniorita
Reviews.Content: I'm from New York City, and I am going to be very honest about my experiences at Hotel Regina. First, the hotel staff is a bit dry and not very helpful at all. The one good thing about this hotel (which is a big positive point of Hotel Regina) is its location. It's located right across the street from Metro Sevilla and very close to Plaza Mayor. Other than that, everything about the hotel is subpar. Our first room was a shoebox which was NOT renovated, and looked just GREY everywhere. and it was right next to the elevator. So I went downstairs and complained. They gave me a better room which was renovated and somewhat bigger. So that was good. We were supposed to check out on December 25th, but when we came back from sightseeing on Dec 23rd (arrived on the 21st), we found our room keys not working and when we went downstairs to see what happened, they had checked us out. WHAT? so we showed our itinerary and at that point, we were able to get a working key again. Other than that, the stay was satisfactory and one big complaint i have is that the hotel staff needs to be more helpful. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ravenspirit
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at this hotel. The lobby, rooms and ambiance matched those hotels charging 120 Euros or more. I booked a single room through their on-line service for 70 Euros. I stayed here twice during a two week visit to Spain. The first stay was in a single bed room. A bit on the small size, but fairly typical for Europe. My second stay I got a free upgrade to a full size room and queen bed that was wonderful. The hotel is on a major street, so I was a bit worried about noise. Most of the rooms face inward or on a side street. Rooms that face out do have double windows. I request rooms off-street, so noise was never a problem. A metro stop is right in front of the hotel, as is two coffee shops that are great for a quick breakfast. It is also a short walk to the old downtown district with many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stourportsaddler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located with the Metro station across the road ( Sevilla). Everything is in walking distance and the hotel staff are very friendly. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to sample the wonderful city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great locations”
Reviews.Author: gumchiu
Reviews.Content: excellent locations. right at the centre of the tourist attractions walking distant to one of the main metro station really clean. front desk services was standard, speaks good english as well I didn't try out their breakfast but by the look of it, it seems very nice. but there are plenty of new restaurants behind the hotel. good to walk around and try them out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: homelessinwales
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in the Regina with 3 girl friends. The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the Porta del Sol so it's a great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and included in the amazing rate of £45 per room per night. The view from the window was a lovely white wall but who cares? The rooms were very clean and the bathroom even had 2 sinks. The flight with easyjet was £36 and the Hotel £45 so the 3 days stay in Madrid was cheaper than a night in London!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JorgeValencia
Reviews.Content: For a tourist the loction of this hotel is about the best Madrid can offer. The hotel has been recently modernised, rooms are clean and staff efficient. The size and quality of the rooms does however vary a lot. On one of our visits we were given a small room, suffering from a strange heating problem: there was no way the very high temperature to which the room was heated up could be brought down. We were moved then to a great, large (and cool) room in the fourth floor. All in all, however, for the price a good hotel in an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Granada28
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice is how close this hotel is to the Metro. Literally, thirty feet from the "Sevilla" stop on the Metro, a very central stop, minutes from Puerta del sol and plaza santa ana. The hotel is impeccably clean, and has a very decent breakfast buffet. right next door there's a nice cafe, and around Plaza santa ana there are tons of good restaurants and bars. The double decker tourist bus also has a stop right near the hotel, if you choose to take it. The only "problem" is that the acoustics may bother some light sleepers, like myself - our room faced the inner courtyard and we heard every noise that a large group of giggly young tourists made - including the loud door slams at 6 am. Other than that, I warmly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not great but in good location”
Reviews.Author: emzelle
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room via the internet but when we got there they had no record of our booking (good job I had a confirmation email!). They found us a room in the basement of the hotel which didn't even deserve a star rating. The door was kicked in and we didn't even have a window. I immediately went and complained and then then put us in a room which had obviously just been refurbished. The room was what you would expect for a 3* - clean and fairly spacious. The minibar was locked up and we were told it was out of use which was annoying as we wanted to use it to keep water cold in the heat. The security safe in the room was also not working. Breakfast was not great - a typical continental style buffet but the food and drink tasted artificial and wasn't very fresh. All this said, the location was good and we walked to most of the sightseeing attrations with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Plush hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room and it was absolutely fine. Clean room and bathroom, no view but no noise either, air con (appreciated as it was 38C outside). The hotel itself is in a superb location, moments from Puerta del Sol, Plaza de Santa Ana and Chueca. There is a metro station (Seville) immediately outside. All for under 50 EUR a night for the room ! One minus point which is why I didn't give it 5 star - the hotel added 7% IVA (tax) twice to the final bill, but the agent we dealt with sorted this out. If returning to Madrid, I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our kids loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a family room at the regina in August 04.We were very pleasantly surprised and all agreed it felt like we were staying 4* rather than 3*.The location was perfect for visiting the city on foot. The decor of the lobby, bar and breakfast room were lovely. The bedroom was great for a family as it had a walled partition between the twin beds and the double so we were all togethr but had some privacy.We had large windows opening onto the main street right above the flowers and flags which decorate the facade, somehow this made us feel special (a royal balcony! which thrilled the kids) The bathroom was spacious and really nice. The decor of the room itself was simple but did not detract from a very pleasant stay-we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Dami66
Reviews.Content: I spent my Easter holidays in this hotel (6 nights) and I don't agree with the good reviews I have read on this site. The hotel has a very good location, the lounges and the cafeteria are nice and elegant. I don't complain about breakfast: it was a self service buffet, not one of the best I've seen. The problem was the room: I was given a double room which was terribly small and had a window on an inner courtyard. In that courtyard there were heating implants which made noise, so I asked to change room (I have never had problems with rooms in other hotels). The staff was kind and they soon showed me another room: it was very old fashioned (not all rooms have been renovated!!) but bigger and they told me it was quieter. I suppose that the rooms on the front street must be very noisy because of the traffic at any time, maybe they are bigger and better. The bedcloth was broken and the hairdrier was half-broken. The worst thing was the noise in the morning: I didn't need my alarm clock because I was awaken every day by the continuous banging of doors, not to mention the chambermaids who shouted from a room to another. I was happy to sleep at home when I came back! To sum up, there is a big gap between the common parts of the hotels, which are nice, and the rooms I have seen, very old fashioned and which overviewed terrible inner courtyards (from the courtyards came also smell of food from some kitchen, fortunately it was cold and I rarely opened the windows). If I went to Madrid again, I'd spend a little more money but I'd chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rlbrowdy
Reviews.Content: This place is right on the main drag, so it is easy to find if you are driving. It doesn't have a garage, but the entrance to a public parking lot is directly in front of the hotel. We stayed one night. Never used the metro directly in front of the hotel because everything we wanted to see was walking distance, including a fun flamenco show nearby (with geriatric dancers). If you are looking for value and location, you can't go wrong with the Hotel Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jmatcham
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of reviews I read here. It was the best I could do to refine my choices. Well, I am grateful to everyone who wrote well of it. It is a central as any hotel can be. It is very clean, lots of marble, perfect bathrooms with reliable hot water. Cheerful and helpful people run the hotel. There is a big restaurant which serves an excellent expansive breakfast. I didn't eat there in the evening so I cant vouch for that. There also a very agreeable bar which lets onto both the hotel and the street and which serves amongst the usual drinks a variety of tapas. Very nice after a hard days plodding around to be able to relax with a drink in the bar. All in all, this is an excellent hotel where they have made an effort to be visually entertaining with small but differently styled lounges on each floor and various arrangements of objects a la Gaudi/Miro/Picasso/Dali (might not be to your taste...but friendly and thoughtful). It is also very quiet. Most of the rooms are not at the front and the fact that there is no view is well disguised. I didn't mind that at all but some might. They also have free safe's in every room which we found a little eccentric to use but in the end worked well. I feel I owe them this review. Feel safe to book there! JM NB We went to Toledo with Julia tours...DONT! Go on your own steam.
